FacilitiesAndServices: American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Diners Club credit card,Mastercard credit card,Visa credit card
Description: Was Nicolas Flamel also an alchemist, as well as a rich bourgeois and former owner of the oldest house in Paris (1407)? Historians may disagree, but we have no doubt about chef Grégory Garimbay. This chef with a star-studded CV (Sylvestre Wahid, Alain Ducasse at the Plaza Athénée) transforms his ingredients into culinary gold. Jelly of courgettes and blackberries; field-grown tomatoes, smoked ricotta and sorbet of green zebra tomatoes; blue lobster from Brittany, green peas, shellfish jus: the new master chef of this distinguished establishment signs balanced, modern recipes, whose aromas and flavours are intelligently assembled, resulting in no-frills, down-to-earth, occasionally original dishes, like his chocolate and girolle mushroom tart. Ah! a culinary alchemist indeed!

Name: Une Table, au Sud
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Great view,Mastercard credit card,Restaurant offering vegetarian menus,Visa credit card
Description: Ludovic Turac, who boasts stints at Le Bristol and Guy Savoy, is happily at the helm of this restaurant, firmly anchored in the South of France. His inventive yet disciplined recipes overflow with regional flavours from Provençal vegetables to locally sourced fish and meat from the Southern Alps, further enhanced by panoramic views over the old port and the basilica of Marseille. His signature dishes “My version of aïoli” and “Local catch like a bouillabaisse” are always a delight, which is also the case of his passport menu in tribute to Marseille’s international maritime heritage.

Name: Saisons
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Visa credit card
Description: In the heart of Marseille, a stone’s throw from Place Castellane, this contemporary venue is the exuberant project of a duo of pros, both local lads. Chef Julien Diaz, who honed his talents in London and Corsica, works with sommelier Guillaume Bonneaud. Seating for thirty, a pared-down interior, depicted by wood, iron and untreated materials, spot on food-wine pairings and creative cuisine that bears witness to the establishment’s ethos, particularly in terms of seasonal and locally sourced ingredients from the Mediterranean and Corsica. The lunchtime menu is a bargain.

Name: Sola
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Visa credit card
Description: Just a stone's throw from the River Seine, looking out onto Notre Dame, we are clearly in Paris – yet here we are in Japan! Sola's interior is full of contrasts, from the calming pale wood to the exposed ceiling beams and heavy solid wood doors. In the basement, there is a vaulted cellar with tables arranged on tatami mats (be sure to remove your shoes). Japanese chef Kosuke Nabeta serves a delicious fusion of the exacting standards of Japanese cuisine and the wealth of ingredients from rural France. He introduces us to traditional Japanese culinary techniques, which he wields with great skill (smoking, drying, marinating, fermenting, alternative cooking methods etc) using ingredients such as soya, sake, ponzu and mizuna. Be sure to try his signature dish of calf sweetbreads served with a rice cake topped with a truffle emulsion! Harmonious, refined and personal cuisine.

Name: L'Épuisette
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Great view,Interesting wine list,Mastercard credit card,Restaurant offering vegetarian menus,Visa credit card
Description: An “épuisette” is a child’s fishing net, often forgotten on the rocks by the seashore and this establishment enjoys a matchless waterside location on the fishing port of the Vallon des Auffes. The house’s iconic “Fanny” menu is as dazzling as the July sunshine. The chef knows his business: the produce is flawlessly fresh, the recipes meticulous and the flavours distinctive – all of which with lashings of generosity. We sampled a bouillabaisse of capon, monkfish, galinette, weever and John Dory – to die for! A delicious port of call.

Name: Ogata
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Counter dining,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Visa credit card
Description: Ogata could well be Japan’s other Embassy of Paris. This temple dedicated to Japanese art de vivre is located in a private mansion in the Marais, masterminded by Shinichiro Ogata, a world-famous designer and restaurateur, who seeks “beauty and balance in all things” (his own words). The essentially traditional Japanese food sports an omakase spirit, through a tasting menu comprised of immaculate seasonal produce that is perfectly suited to the restaurant’s suave sophistication. We tasted some remarkable starters (spinach, roast asparagus, fried squid, sashimi of horse mackerel), as was the tamago yaki, a subtly perfumed omelette roll. The best seats are at the counter. Pop into the shop or art gallery before leaving…

Name: Accents Table Bourse
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Restaurant offering vegetarian menus,Visa credit card,Wheelchair access
Description: "An accent indicates where a person comes from; it tells us about their country, their region and their history. It is this idea of openness and discovery that I want to uphold, a cuisine made up of encounters and exchanges." These are the words of Ayumi Sugiyama, the Japanese proprietor of this contemporary restaurant with a Scandinavian vibe, as well as its pastry chef. The dishes are a combination of classic fare (succulent hare à la royale in season), more daring creations and subtle experiments with roasted and smoked flavours. From start to finish, balance and precision… as is the case with the owner's desserts and the sommelier's judicious advice. Warm and vibrant service.

Name: Ose
FacilitiesAndServices: American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Terrace,Visa credit card
Description: After stints in top establishments from New York to Paris, two veteran chefs now swap places every fortnight, taking turns in the open kitchen and the dining room. 100% bistronomic cooking from scratch using local, fresh, seasonal ingredients is the backbone of this bistro in the Abbesses neighbourhood. The menu, chalked up on a slate daily, is bang-on confident with a strong French bias and showcases deceptively simple recipes. ‘Ose’ means to dare – so what are you waiting for?

Name: Kwon
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,Credit card / Debit card accepted
Description: Cinema, TV series and… food! Korean culture has become omnipresent in France – much to our delight. This restaurant's trendy decor has a minimalist, industrial feel, a menu of Korean classics such as barbecue and bibimbap, and above all a keen sense of detail. The care taken over the accompaniments is particularly clear to see, whether you opt for the emblematic kimchi, crunchy beans with a smoky flavour, caramelised lotus flower or cucumber with chilli. This is generous and fresh fare and good value for money!

Name: Alebrije
FacilitiesAndServices: Credit card / Debit card accepted
Description: After training at the Paul Bocuse Institute and a number of noteworthy spells in top establishments, such as Troisgros, youthful Carla Kirsch, who hails from Veracruz in Mexico, has settled in the Croix-Rousse district. The signature here is clearly Mexican from the décor, which features old rafters with splashes of colour, to the food, which Carla joyfully crafts using top-notch seasonal ingredients (sweet corn in the starter and chili peppers in the dessert). The menu changes monthly and the beverages include a few Mexican wines as well as tequilas and mezcals.

Name: La Table de Mee
FacilitiesAndServices: Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Visa credit card
Description: This Korean restaurant pays tribute to the country's specialities in a stripped-back interior dominated by wood and with a counter where diners can sit and watch the chef working at his large plancha. Punchy flavours and sauces are the order of the day, courtesy of the obligatory kimchi, Korean fried chicken and delicious ssams (wraps). The mackerel fillets simmered in a soya, chilli and white radish broth is a standout dish. Insightful tips from an experienced sommelier (ex-Gaya and Pilgrim) will help you choose from the selection of wines and craft beers.

Name: Double Dragon
FacilitiesAndServices: American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Visa credit card
Description: In this friendly "Asian canteen", sisters Katia and Tatiana Levha offer simple dishes of mixed inspiration (China, Philippines, Thailand etc) in an upgraded "street food" vein. This is cooking that is full of character, with pronounced flavours, and often deliciously spicy. A fun experience and tasty fare.

Name: PY Restaurant
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Terrace,Visa credit card
Description: In this dinky brasserie in a classy neighbourhood, Pierre (in the kitchen) and Yuko (front of house) are a champion team. Take a seat in a trendy décor to sample hearty, well-crafted dishes that set the tastebuds tingling: Basque black pudding à la plancha, fried squid and creamy mushy peas – without forgetting the knockout desserts, such as creamy grapefruit, olive oil biscuits and mango sorbet. The evening menu features a wider range of top-notch ingredients (lobster, beef fillet, sweetbread).

Name: Veronatuti
FacilitiesAndServices: Credit card / Debit card accepted
Description: Start with a salad of fennel and orange of Sicilian inspiration, followed by a main course from Emilia-Romagna (stracotto of braised beef in red wine, carrots and onions) and a dessert of Lombardy and Piedmont inspiration (homemade ice cream served with a crumble of sbrisolona made with roasted corn (farina bòna) and a thin layer of chocolate). The owners of this authentic trattoria embark their diners on a whirlwind culinary tour of Italy. Everything is fresh and homemade - even the coffee comes from a local roaster. Delicious food without killer prices.

Name: Les Canailles Ménilmontant
FacilitiesAndServices: American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Visa credit card
Description: In the heart of Ménilmuche, just beyond the boulevard, two partners have set up shop behind this colourful façade, formerly the site of the Bistrot Blanc Bec. The two cohorts have opted for a tried and tested formula: quintessential, traditional nosh, full of flavour and generosity. Competent, efficient service.

Name: Cucina Mutualité
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Visa credit card,Wheelchair access
Description: The colourful modern bistro decor and extremely cordial staff make for an appealing atmosphere. As for the food, the wonderful seasonal Italian menu is a pageant of authentic, flavourful and truly generous dishes: you won't be disappointed by the melt-in-the-mouth braised ox cheek paccheri... al dente, obviously! You may even be allowed a second helping.

Name: Le Tiroir
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Terrace,Visa credit card
Description: This establishment in the working-class district of Vaise, appointed in a characteristic trendy bistro vibe, is irresistibly endearing! The work of a youthful team, the food slaloms between iced tomato soup served with a mousse of white balsamic vinegar and a more patriotic Gallic line-up (tartare of beef, foie gras) – the menus and carte are regularly renewed. Excellent value for money and pleasure, including in the evenings.

Name: Le Kitchen
FacilitiesAndServices: Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Terrace,Visa credit card
Description: In the student district of the Louis Lumière and Jean Moulin Universities, this Kitchen is thriving. The interior, a delightful blend of Art deco and Scandinavian (as is the owner), holds only eight small square tables. The pastry display case (to eat in or take away), the work of the owner’s pastry chef companion, sets our tastebuds drooling and the kitchen is open for breakfast and teatime, as well as lunch (but is closed in the evenings). Organic local produce, vegetables mainly, take pride of place on the table.

Name: Sauf Imprévu
FacilitiesAndServices: Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Visa credit card
Description: Félix Gagnaire, a pastry chef by training and son of multi-starred Pierre Gagnaire, whose international renown needs no introduction, deserves our respect for this restaurant (open mainly at lunchtime) in the Brotteaux district. Flavoursome food with a firm focus on pedigree French traditions: watercress soup, poached egg and bacon; warm porkpie; mango and passion fruit cheesecake. The regulars joyfully dig in to wholesome, hearty dishes oozing with regional flavours and heritage. Everything is fresh and entirely made from scratch. A safe bet every time.

Name: M Restaurant
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Terrace,Visa credit card
Description: A cocktail of vitamins! Julien Gautier’s cheerful establishment adds a whiff of exuberance to Lyon’s well-heeled, tree-lined Avenue Foch. The smart interior sports a muted blue and flashy orange colour scheme, felt grey designer armchairs, linen tablecloths, a bar and a wine cellar encircled by a conservatory… The similarly charismatic service is as smooth as a silky béarnaise sauce. In the kitchen, the veteran and talented chef, formerly of Léon of Lyon, rustles up an appetising, market-sourced menu, combining flawless technique and know-how in a bid to pamper our tastebuds with delicate flavours tailored to modern appetites. The honey-flavoured madeleines served with a fromage blanc sorbet are awesome!

Name: Le Zeste Gourmand
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Visa credit card,Wheelchair access
Description: A minimalist interior in the zeitgeist (slate grey tiles, white and yellow walls and bare light bulbs) and food to match: finely crafted, flavoursome dishes based on premium produce at prices that make sense.

Name: Saku Restaurant
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card
Description: Saku is the nickname of the chef of this establishment tucked away behind a nondescript façade. He and his wife, both of whom are Japanese, prepare jubilant Gallic cuisine in keeping with today’s tastebuds, with the occasional Japanese tang. The produce is fresh, always in season, at common-sense prices, and the service is friendly and professional.

Name: Caillebotte
FacilitiesAndServices: American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Visa credit card
Description: Chef Franck Baranger crafts fresh, thoroughly modern dishes, the secret of which only he holds: lightly seared squid, redcurrants, courgette and gremolata; line-caught fish, marinated cucumber, polenta, béarnaise sauce and fig pickles… A casual, friendly vibe provides the perfect foil to distinctive, appetising and colourful food.

Name: Chez Michel
FacilitiesAndServices: American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Restaurant offering vegetarian menus,Visa credit card
Description: Masahiro Kawai, the Japanese chef of Chez Michel, plays a joyful, flavoursome traditional score, in which nothing is forbidden, from iconic Brittany stew (kig ha farz) to Paris-Brest pastry, without forgetting roast foie gras. He celebrates regional produce, starting with Brittany, lavishing care and generosity on each dish.

Name: La Méditerranée
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Terrace,Valet parking,Visa credit card
Description: The frescoes evoke the Mediterranean in this restaurant opposite the Théâtre de l'Odéon. The maritime inspired cuisine, in which particular attention is paid to the best ingredients, is influenced by the accents of the south. In summer dine beneath the azure blue awning.

Name: Mensae
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Visa credit card
Description: Cuisine of the moment, full of freshness and with spot-on flavours. Among the classics, on the menu all year round, the frogs' legs, garlic and parsley or the mousse au chocolat praliné are good enough to spark a riot. The decor has the good taste to make itself discreet. The small sidewalk terrace is welcome in summer and the lunch menu is a boon.

Name: Les Canailles Pigalle
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Visa credit card
Description: This pleasant restaurant was created in 2012 by two Bretons with impressive culinary backgrounds. They slip into the bistronomy (gastro bistro), serving bistro and seasonal dishes. Specialities: ox tongue carpaccio and sauce ravigote, and rum baba with vanilla whipped cream... Tuck in!

Name: L'Antre Amis
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Terrace,Visa credit card
Description: The chef-patron at L'Antre Amis brings passion to his cooking. Using seasonal ingredients, he composes a short up-to-the-minute menu (Landes asparagus, Graubünden meat and devilled egg; cod loin fillet and creamy risotto with early peas), as well as tapas-style dishes for sharing. To be accompanied by your pick from some 200 wines. Pleasant contemporary setting and terrace on a quiet street.

Name: Impérial Choisy
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Visa credit card
Description: A genuine Chinese restaurant frequented by many local Chinese people who use it as their lunchtime canteen. Hardly surprising given the delicious Cantonese specials on offer!

Name: Auberge Pyrénées Cévennes
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Visa credit card
Description: Chef Pierre Négrevergne is really flourishing in this house that is over 100 years old. He delights diners with his tasty "grandmother's" cooking, which highlights French gastronomic heritage (home-made terrine, blanquette de veau à l'ancienne and grilled rice, millefeuille), served in generous portions. It is still a treat to eat here.

Name: Aux Plumes
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Visa credit card
Description: A young Japanese chef with a great track record creates inspired, generous cuisine using the best ingredients in the neighbourhood. Cream of sweet potato soup, cocoa emulsion; lychee and coconut milk blancmange and exotic fruit minestrone – the original dishes are carefully prepared, change on a weekly basis and are delicious every time. At lunchtime, a trilogy of starters at an unbeatable price.

Name: Le Casse Noix
FacilitiesAndServices: American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Diners Club credit card,Mastercard credit card,Visa credit card
Description: Old signs, clocks and vintage furniture: the scene is set. As for the food, authenticity is the order of the day: delicious down - to - earth canaille cuisine, good wines and an amusing collection of nutcrackers picked up here and there by the owner's mum. Tasty.

Name: Jouvence
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Restaurant offering vegetarian menus,Visa credit card
Description: Located not far from the rue de Cîteaux, this apothecary-style shop from the 1900s is not merely aesthetically pleasing. It proposes modern cuisine, replete with quality ingredients, such as scallop ceviche or a fine Angus entrecôte. The chef has a sure and generous touch, and the service is attentive.

Name: Spoon
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Brunch,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Terrace,Valet parking,Visa credit card
Description: On the mezzanine floor of the Palais Brongniart, diners are drawn here by the promise of aromatic spices – tamarind, ginger, coriander, saffron. The chef's dishes are inspired by the Maghreb, India, the Middle East: Doha chickpeas with lemon caviar; amberjack, curry leaves and coconut milk; Fez pastilla with dried fruit, cinnamon and star anise.

Name: 52 Faubourg St-Denis
FacilitiesAndServices: Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Restaurant offering vegetarian menus,Visa credit card,Wheelchair access
Description: Fans of neo - bistros are going to love this place with bare concrete and exposed stone, a concise, tempting menu, good wines and craft beers. Nothing is left to chance, down to the coffee, which is selected and roasted by the owner. Bear in mind the place doesn't take bookings and doesn't have a phone.

Name: Le Radis Beurre
FacilitiesAndServices: American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Visa credit card
Description: Chef Jérôme Bonnet found the perfect location for his restaurant on Boulevard Garibaldi in Paris. He prepares tasty, well-crafted cuisine that bears the hallmark of his early years in southern France. The pork loin with braised endives, Mimolette Vieille cheese and a pearlescent jus is just one dish that will certainly grab your full attention.

Name: Mandoobar
FacilitiesAndServices: Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Visa credit card
Description: Good authentic Korean restaurants are not two a penny in Paris, but this little restaurant, where the chef works behind his counter, is one of them: diners look on while Kim Kwang-Loc, as nimble-fingered as he is precise, creates the famous mandu (Korean dumplings) and tuna and beef tartares that make up the bulk of his minimalist menu. Passionate about Korean herbs, he seasons each of his delicate and tasty dishes with addictive flavours, perhaps in a quest to recreate his earliest culinary memories in Korea…

Name: Clamato
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Visa credit card
Description: Inspired by the oyster bars of the East Coast of the United States, this outpost of Septime owes its name to a cocktail that is very popular in Quebec, a Bloody Mary of sorts with the addition of clam juice – needless to say, you can try one here! The place has all the makings of a bistronomy hit, with its trendy decor and short menu that puts fish and seafood and vegetables centre stage, and draws on international influences. The ingredients are chosen with great care and prepared as simply as possible, then presented in plates for sharing. Please note that reservations are not possible: first come, first served!

Name: Richer
FacilitiesAndServices: American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Visa credit card,Wheelchair access
Description: This place appeals as much for its arty "canteen" vibe as it does for its dishes, which showcase a fresh and tasty take on market-inspired cuisine, as in the long-braised beef chuck served on a fine broccoli purée. Bear in mind, though, that the only way to reserve is to show up at the restaurant.

Name: Zen
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Terrace,Visa credit card
Description: This enticing restaurant combines a refreshing contemporary interior design and authentic Japanese cooking. The menu is well - rounded and faithful to the classic sushi, grilled dishes and tempura, with house specialities of gyoza and chirashi. Ideal for a quick lunch or a relaxing ‘zen’ dinner.

Name: Le Pantruche
FacilitiesAndServices: American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Visa credit card
Description: Pantruche is slang for Paris... an apt name for this bistro with its chic retro decor, which happily cultivates a 1940s - 1950s atmosphere. As for the food, the chef and his small team put together lovely seasonal dishes in keeping with current culinary trends.

Name: Bistrotters
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Visa credit card
Description: A lovely place in the southern reaches of the 14th arrondissement near Métro Plaisance. The Spanish chef carefully selects his ingredients, with a preference for small-scale producers in the Paris region, and instils them with various influences (Asian, Mediterranean etc). Laid-back service.

Name: Abri Soba
FacilitiesAndServices: Counter dining,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Visa credit card
Description: You may have heard of soba, Japanese pasta made with buckwheat, the reputation of which is currently snowballing around the planet. The chef of this restaurant has made soba his house speciality and serves it lunch and evening in an amazing variety of preparations: hot, cold, in stock or with finely sliced duck. Simply flavoursome – get out your chopsticks!

Name: Pho Tai
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Visa credit card
Description: In a quiet street in the Asian quarter, this small Vietnamese restaurant stands out from the crowd. All credit to the chef, Mr Te, who arrived in France in 1968 and is a magnificent ambassador for Vietnamese cuisine. Dumplings, crispy chicken with fresh ginger, bo bun and phô soups: everything is full of flavour.

Name: Ishikawa
FacilitiesAndServices: American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Terrace,Visa credit card
Description: Chef Yugo Ishikawa has set up shop in this minimalist restaurant with a long dining room located in a busy pedestrian street in the heart of the city. He throws himself body and soul into painstakingly crafted, traditional Japanese dishes. Daily specials might include tonkatsu shoulder of pork in breadcrumbs, tuna tataki with ponzu oroshi, tsukemono pickled vegetables and a range of delicious dishes. Worthy of a genuine izakaya in downtown Tokyo.

Name: Racine
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Terrace,Visa credit card,Wheelchair access
Description: "The name refers to not just one racine (""root""), but several: the chef's Burgundian roots, a great source of pride for him; the origins of the ingredients he uses (90% of which are produced within a 100km radius). His tasty and well - balanced dishes do the rest. Small delicatessen and wine bar on Thursdays and Fridays. "

Name: La Vierge
FacilitiesAndServices: American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Visa credit card
Description: You will adore this vintage interior with antique tables, wooden chairs, old tiles and an open kitchen. As for the food, the chef sends out fresh, effective and flavoursome fare – from the first to the last bite. The lunchtime menu is a steal.

Name: Bergamote
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Terrace,Visa credit card
Description: The unusual façade of this bistronomic bijou can be found in the heart of a district in the throes of renovation. A youthful chef carefully crafts seasonal fare, depicted by crisp flavours in a simple, natural setting. The lunchtime prices are deliciously eater friendly – more ambitious in the evening.

Name: Baca'v
FacilitiesAndServices: American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Terrace,Visa credit card
Description: Good wholesome food and a casual, down-to-earth vibe depict Émile Cotte’s approach. After a traditional textbook approach to cooking, he now favours a more instinctive, spontaneous style, adding a personal twist to updated bistro classics, such as oeuf parfait, country bacon and cream of parmesan. The regularly changing slate menu is deliciously affordable and there is also a 5-course surprise menu.

Name: Chez les Anges
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Diners Club credit card,Interesting wine list,Mastercard credit card,Valet parking,Visa credit card
Description: This chic brasserie, which was refurbished and revamped a few years ago, proposes an extensive set menu and an à la carte menu packed with premium ingredients (sole meunière, Galicia rib of beef). For solo meals, there is nothing like the central counter, where seafood is displayed on crushed ice. Tasty and masterful cooking, and a fine wine and whisky list… What a treat!

Name: 20 Eiffel
FacilitiesAndServices: American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Visa credit card
Description: In a quiet street a stone’s throw from the Eiffel Tower, this restaurant offers a understated interior full of light. On the menu, you can choose from a range of updated dishes, prepared by two chefs, all of which place the focus on flavour and taste. For example, a delicious fillet of wild Pollock with squash.

Name: Les Petits Parisiens
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Visa credit card
Description: Chef Clément Gélard, after honing his skills in top establishments, is crafting modern bistro fare, adding an inspired touch to time-honoured family favourites such as stuffed cabbage. Food lovers won’t be able to resist the chocolate mousse with olive oil and fleur de sel or his absolute must: vanilla flavoured rice pudding with dried fruit and butterscotch – to die for!

Name: Brigade du Tigre
FacilitiesAndServices: Credit card / Debit card accepted,Wheelchair access
Description: Both have trained with William Ledeuil, both are passionate about Asia, having traversed the continent, and now the duo who run the kitchen at Eels have joined forces to celebrate the joyful diversity of Asian cuisine in a bistro-style duplex. The result: small fragrant nuggets to nibble on your own or to share, concocted from quality products...

Name: Au Bon Accueil
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Visa credit card
Description: In a quiet street in the shadow of the Eiffel Tower, you can enjoy appetising market-fresh cuisine that mirrors the seasons and comes at a very reasonable price: smoked heart fillet of salmon served with lemon cream; roasted chicken supreme, oyster mushrooms and grenaille potatoes; pavlova with exotic fruits – all accompanied by well-chosen wines. A reliably good option, which is always booked out!

Name: Mova
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Visa credit card
Description: From a line-up of carefully selected seasonal ingredients (vegetables and fish), François Merle conjures up appetising, modern recipes, illustrated by a fresh, light starter of rillettes of seabream, celery pickles, coriander sorbet and fish eggs, whose distinctive flavours are exquisitely harmonious. Single set menu at lunchtime, tasting menu in the evening.

Name: Cheval d'Or
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Notable sake list,Visa credit card
Description: It is with great anticipation that you stop in front of this bright red façade high up in Belleville (in the east of Paris), having secured a table for one of the two evening services by booking well in advance. In this restaurant under the leadership of an authentic Japanese chef, ensconced with his team behind a long counter, you will get to enjoy fragrant dishes inspired by Japanese cuisine: Japanese binchotan charcoal grill, home-made soy ramen and onigri. Laid-back service from a friendly and dynamic team.

Name: Kisin
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Visa credit card
Description: When a Bib Gourmand chef from Tokyo arrives in Paris, the first thing he does is open a restaurant, tantalising and bewitching our senses. Diners will sample Japanese produce and genuine udon, made in front of the diner. Natural, additive - free ingredients, most of which are imported direct from the Land of the Rising Sun. Healthy, wholesome and succulent.

Name: Agastache
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Visa credit card,Wheelchair access
Description: This brand-new bistro is the brainchild of two gifted young partners who honed their skills in Lyon. The unfussy, up-to-date interior sets the scene for instinctive, updated and well-crafted dishes. Fine seasonal produce and a distinct fondness for vegetables result in food that combines formal elegance with flavoursome coherence. Now add lashings of generosity and a friendly atmosphere and you will find yourself in one of the best newcomers on the left bank.

Name: Lai'Tcha
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Terrace,Visa credit card,Wheelchair access
Description: In this annex of Yam'tcha, located at the foot of Église St-Eustache, you can enjoy simple but straight-to-the-point Chinese cuisine that is fragrant and made with fine ingredients. The short menu offers various dim sums, but also fresh home-made noodles, Imperial sautéed beef and an excellent salad of Galician beef, lamb's lettuce and oyster mushrooms.

Name: L'Arôme
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Visa credit card
Description: This small restaurant in a characteristic and colourful Marseille street looks like a classroom, with its old maps of France, blackboards, classroom chairs and menus presented in an exercise book. It serves flavoursome, carefully prepared Mediterranean dishes, such as cromesquis of veal. Laid-back atmosphere and a welcome as warm as the Marseille sun.

Name: Le Jean Moulin
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Visa credit card,Wheelchair access
Description: Guests are invited to take a seat in one side or another of a long dining room, divided by a glazed wine cellar, in a designer décor of industrial loft inspiration. The perfect foil to taste Grégoire Baratier’s cuisine in the zeitgeist. The menu changes very regularly, but here are two examples to give you an idea of the market-fresh cooking: thick ravioles of snails and fondant leeks, emulsion of garlic and parsley, scattered with wild herbs; confit of braised veal, mousseline of chervil root, caramelised winter vegetables and a gutsy gravy. Crisp, well-crafted and rich in tributes to Lyon’s culinary heritage.

Name: Sellae
FacilitiesAndServices: American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Visa credit card
Description: On the coattails of Mensae ("table" in Latin) in the 19th arrondissement, Sellae ("chair") is another restaurant in the Thibault Sombardier stable. The chef cooks up modern seasonal cuisine, with a penchant for the South of France and above all for indulgence! In this bistro-style interior, the produce is prepared with real know-how: snail ravioli with grass butter, crispy speck, sweet garlic broth; roast veal, casarecce with mushrooms, vin jaune emulsion...

Name: Amador
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Diners Club credit card,Interesting wine list,Mastercard credit card,Terrace,Visa credit card
Description: A culinary highlight for the city and for Austria. This restaurant's location on the outskirts of the city in the Hajszan Neumann wine estate is something special in itself. Here, a wonderful brick vaulted ceiling and stylish interior design make for a distinctive look. Juan Amador's cuisine more than lives up to the setting: the finest ingredients are used to create a modern and sophisticated set menu comprising dishes that are finely balanced and consistently harmonious. The creative mastermind of this operation is supported by a highly motivated and pleasingly cordial team. Impressive wine list.

Name: Mraz & Sohn
FacilitiesAndServices: American Express credit card,Car park,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Diners Club credit card,Interesting wine list,Mastercard credit card,Visa credit card
Description: This establishment run by Markus Mraz and his sons Lukas and Manuel is a real institution on Vienna's gourmet scene. They serve a surprise set menu comprising a whole series of small courses. They like to concentrate on one main ingredient, which forms the basis of the menu. This approach results in dishes such as their Korean-style chanterelle goulash: a true taste explosion of roasted notes, mild spiciness and full-bodied mushroom flavour. The place has a chic, modern feel and the atmosphere is totally relaxed – they don't stand on ceremony or formality here. In one of the three rooms there is a clear view of the open kitchen. Charming service comes courtesy of attentive and very well-trained staff, not least the sommelier, who maintains a terrific wine cellar and guarantees perfectly balanced wine pairings teeming with interesting ideas.

Name: Steirereck im Stadtpark
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Diners Club credit card,Garden or park,Interesting wine list,Mastercard credit card,Terrace,Visa credit card,Wheelchair access
Description: This fine dining restaurant in the spacious Stadtpark is very modern, with its chic design and clean lines and the creative cuisine of Heinz Reitbauer, who cooks regional produce with great precision and refinement. Excellent, professional service. Be sure to take advantage of the bread and cheese trolley – the selection is impressive!

Name: Silvio Nickol Gourmet Restaurant
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Diners Club credit card,Interesting wine list,Mastercard credit card,Terrace,Visa credit card,Wheelchair access
Description: Silvio Nickol has a style all of his own that you won't quickly forget! In the exclusive Palais Coburg, he serves up extremely imaginative cuisine featuring very sophisticated combinations based on excellent seasonal produce. His creations also showcase the specialties of various regions. The professional front-of-house team will expertly talk you through the menu and competently guide you through the truly impressive wine list. Elegant interior with a striking vaulted ceiling and eye-catching decorative crystal.

Name: Konstantin Filippou
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Interesting wine list,Mastercard credit card,Terrace,Visa credit card,Wheelchair access
Description: Konstantin Filippou presents an extensive tasting menu in which fish and seafood are given top billing; meat is largely dispensed with or plays more of a supporting role. The ingredients for the very modern and contrasting small plates that make up his menu come mainly from Brittany or Scandinavia – for example, the outstanding langostino from Norway, which he serves with cabbage, grapefruit and the wild seaweed cochayuyo. As a native Styrian with Greek roots, the chef-patron discreetly incorporates influences from both his home province and Greek heritage. The minimalist interior is done out in a palette dominated by black and grey. The waitstaff are attentive and competent, including when it comes to recommending just the right wine – you will also find one or two international treasures on the wine list.

Name: [aend]
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Visa credit card
Description: The clean and minimalist design immediately catches the eye, as do the striking brick arches overhead. The clear view into the open kitchen showcases the skill and dedication of Fabian Günzel's team. The pared-down interior is reflected in the set menu, which comprises up to 15 modern and creative courses, made using top-quality produce. Superb wine recommendations.

Name: APRON
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Diners Club credit card,Mastercard credit card,Visa credit card
Description: You will find this stylishly elegant yet modern restaurant not far from the Stadtpark and the historical centre of Vienna, adjoining the Sofitel Hotel. The impressive-looking open kitchen turns out a creative set menu that draws on regional and seasonal ingredients to deliver beautifully handcrafted dishes that are full of flavour. The desserts are fabulous! You can also have lunch in the bistro.

Name: Pramerl & the Wolf
FacilitiesAndServices: American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Terrace,Visa credit card
Description: This former pub in Vienna's ninth district is now a great casual fine dining restaurant. In a pleasantly informal atmosphere, the friendly and highly competent front-of-house team serve dishes that draw on modern inspiration and feature contrasts that work well. A sophisticated surprise menu with the focus squarely on the excellent ingredients is proposed. Tip: take the U4 underground line to get here.

Name: Edvard
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Diners Club credit card,Mastercard credit card,Terrace,Visa credit card
Description: The elegant fine dining restaurant of the Palais Hansen Kempinski Hotel Vienna offers a successful marriage of modern and classic. The food is refined and technically sophisticated, with a penchant for Mediterranean produce. A nice touch is that at the start, your friendly server comes to your table to give you a rundown of the ingredients used. There are Austrian and international wines to accompany your food.

Name: TIAN
FacilitiesAndServices: American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Interesting wine list,Mastercard credit card,Restaurant offering vegetarian menus,Visa credit card
Description: This beacon of vegetarian gourmet cuisine proposes a set menu with six or eight courses that can also be vegan. The depth of flavour in the dishes is down to the technical prowess of chef Paul Ivić, as well as the fantastic quality of the ingredients, which are seasonal and locally sourced. There's a great selection of organic wines – alternatively, opt for one of the non-alcoholic beverage accompaniments. The waitstaff are warm and professional, and they always go about their work with a smile. The stylish decor incorporates modern design into a historical setting.

Name: Specht
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Diners Club credit card,Discover Card,JCB,Maestro,Mastercard credit card,Visa credit card
Description: This restaurant in a little side street in the city centre is a wonderfully cosy setting for a pleasant tête-à-tête or meal among friends. Diners can expect delicious traditional Viennese cuisine prepared using local ingredients. The pretty interior combining modern design, wooden floors, dark green wall panelling and partially vaulted ceilings creates a warm atmosphere. There is a U-Bahn station conveniently located close by.

Name: Mochi
FacilitiesAndServices: Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Terrace,Visa credit card
Description: A lively, informal restaurant serving authentic Japanese cuisine with some more modern twists, at very moderate prices. You can watch the chefs at work, preparing sushi rolls, yakitori or gyu don. At lunchtime, the food is served in bowls; in the evening the presentation is a bit more elaborate. Tables are much sought after, so book early! No reservation possible at lunchtime.

Name: Meierei im Stadtpark
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Diners Club credit card,Great view,Mastercard credit card,Terrace,Visa credit card,Wheelchair access
Description: One floor below the Reitbauer’s gourmet restaurant, you’ll find another upmarket eatery. Alongside some 150 wonderfully matured cheeses, it boasts delicious classics like Wiener schnitzel of suckling calf. Or perhaps you’d prefer a whole Arctic char or some venison goulash? Attractive terrace facing the Stadtpark.

Name: Vestibül
FacilitiesAndServices: American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Interesting wine list,Mastercard credit card,Terrace,Visa credit card,Wheelchair access
Description: With a penchant for seasonal and regional produce, this restaurant serves flavoursome culinary delights such as freshwater fish dishes or classics like Wiener schnitzel. The imposing historical building, which also houses the famous Burgtheater, makes for a unique location with a stylish interior that has a typically Viennese feel with its striking columns and gorgeous stuccowork.

Name: MAST Weinbistro
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Interesting wine list,Mastercard credit card,Visa credit card
Description: Set in a historical town house, this trendy place is a winning combination of modern wine bar and upscale bistro. It is very popular for its great food, is made with seasonal ingredients sourced from local producers – and at fantastic value for money. Organic and biodynamic wines are recommended to accompany your choice of dishes. There is an appealing outdoor dining area, too.

Name: ONYX
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,Credit cards not accepted,Great view,Restaurant offering vegetarian menus,Wheelchair access
Description: What was once the bar on the sixth floor of the DO & CO Hotel in the avant-garde Haas Building has been transformed into a trendy restaurant with a lounge feel and large floor-to-ceiling windows that afford a breathtaking view of St Stephen's Cathedral. Interesting Asian and Japanese dishes are served for sharing – including sushi and sashimi and specialities from the Robata grill.

Name: Woracziczky
FacilitiesAndServices: Credit cards not accepted,Terrace
Description: Diners are given a warm welcome In this pleasingly informal inn (pronounced "Vorashitsky"). Both its laid-back atmosphere and Viennese cuisine are a hit, with house specialities such as beef tartare with avocado, or Tafelspitz (boiled veal) served with a creamy chanterelle sauce. The reasonably priced lunchtime set menu, which changes daily, is especially popular.

Name: Lasarte
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Car park,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Diners Club credit card,Interesting wine list,Mastercard credit card,Visa credit card,Wheelchair access
Description: Still not familiar with the culinary world of Martín Berasategui? It's unusual to find spin-offs that manage to live up to the standards set by the original, but that is exactly what has happened in this incredible restaurant, named after the town in which this chef has built his empire.Here, Paolo Casagrande, the protégé of this San Sebastian master, puts his own spin on the exquisite dishes first conceived by his mentor, showcasing them in a more avant-garde setting (undulating ceilings that mimic waves, ethereal lamps that resemble jellyfish, golden tones...). Whether you order à la carte menu or opt for one of the various tasting menus, your experience is taken to the next level if you sit at the Chef's Table, an exclusive space where you can watch the chefs in action through a large window.

Name: ABaC
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Interesting wine list,Mastercard credit card,Terrace,Visa credit card
Description: Jordi Cruz's, a chef who conjures up flavours from his "mental palate", has a unique culinary style that is a coherent combination of tradition, modernity, top-quality ingredients, attitude and passion – the list goes on. In his elegant restaurant overlooking a tranquil garden he offers diners a unique gastronomic experience that constantly evolves in line with the produce made available by the changing seasons. His technical mastery never fails to impress as he dreams up appealing new takes on Mediterranean dishes alongside constant references to a whole host of flavours from around the world. His cooking is centred around a single tasting menu featuring new recipes alongside the restaurant’s renowned signatures dishes (fried squid a la romana, cured red prawns, dried “hanging tomatoes” etc). Guests can also savour appetisers in the kitchen itself.

Name: Cocina Hermanos Torres
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Interesting wine list,Mastercard credit card,Visa credit card,Wheelchair access
Description: Once over the threshold, a fascinating experience awaits at Cocina Hermanos Torres – one that transports guests to a world where time has stood still thanks to the magical setting and highly delicate cuisine that takes us away from our day-to-day lives. The Torres twins (Sergio and Javier) dreamt of incorporating their culinary microcosmos into the heart of the dining room, transforming a culinary experience into a true spectacle, hence the three cooking stations that dominate the centre of the room, around which tables are arranged beneath romantic “clouds” of light. The cuisine here is centred on a superb tasting menu that invites guests on a gourmet journey extolling the very best seasonal and local ingredients, using them in such a way to extract maximum impact and flavour with a minimum of intervention.

Name: DiverXO
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Interesting wine list,Mastercard credit card,Visa credit card,Wheelchair access
Description: With dishes such as Galician lobster “waking up on the beaches of Goa”, freshwater crab from the mouth of the Guadalquivir River with XO kimchi, nigiri matured for 45 days, and toasted butter risotto with tuber aestivum, Dabiz Muñoz’s fun, hedonistic and often irreverent cuisine breaks the mould of cutting-edge gastronomic cuisine by entering his highly personal and dream-like world. As a result, he ensures a rollercoaster of emotions that constantly challenge the palate. In this striking setting, decorated with flying pigs and huge chrome ants, the single tasting menu invites his guests on a spectacular journey across the world’s different cuisines. And through the predominant use of Spanish ingredients, Muñoz is able to create more recognisable flavours than in the past. Highlighting themes such as invasive species and the Pyrenean ecosystem, the chef works without limits, combining local ingredients with exotic condiments to create intense dishes that are full of contrasts.

Name: Moments
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Diners Club credit card,Interesting wine list,Mastercard credit card,Restaurant offering vegetarian menus,Visa credit card,Wheelchair access
Description: The fine dining restaurant at the Mandarin Oriental Barcelona hotel is run by Raül Balam, son of the famous chef Carme Ruscalleda. In addition to his own undeniable individual talent, there are various culinary traits he has inherited from her. Dominated by amber and gold tones, the modern dining area has a special table from which you can see the chefs hard at work in the kitchen, although their labours are equally visible from other tables nearby. The cuisine here showcases the underlying creativity of Catalan tradition, healthy Mediterranean produce, and the intrinsic distinctiveness of each flavour... all brought together in a themed menu (Les Dîners de Gala) which pays homage to the opulent and surrealist dinners that Salvador Dalí and Gala hosted in the 1970s. The recipes are even presented in the original book published by this extraordinary artist.

Name: Disfrutar
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Interesting wine list,Mastercard credit card,Visa credit card,Wheelchair access
Description: This restaurant is characterised by the inventive spirit of the three chefs at the helm (Eduard Xatruch, Oriol Castro and Mateu Casañas), who have made creativity their watchword. Clearly their time working alongside Ferran Adrià at El Bulli really made an impression!What's so special about this place? The food itself is highly innovative. Playing with shapes, textures and flavours, the chefs exhibit an indisputable craftsmanship. Moreover, a constant stream of innovations emerges from their laboratory, such as their "solid bubbles" or, even more remarkably, a "living table" that changes as the meal progresses (by reservation only). Two tasting menus are proposed: "Classic", comprising the signature dishes of the house, and "Festival", which showcases the latest seasonal creations. One of the pairing options is alcohol-free.

Name: Angle
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Diners Club credit card,Mastercard credit card,Visa credit card,Wheelchair access
Description: Located inside Hotel Cram, Angle is run under the baton of celebrity chef Jordi Cruz. The restaurant, which has a separate entrance to the hotel, has a foyer where diners can enjoy a drink and appetisers before heading up to the dining area on the first floor. This space has a contemporary look and exudes elegance and serenity with its striking floor lamps, wooden fittings and heavy curtains.In the kitchen, the chefs follow the modern, creative blueprint set out by the award-winning chef, without any fuss, but rather with great care and a sense of freedom. Based on market produce, the cuisine is showcased in a tasting menu that features dishes from the three-starred ABaC and others conceived in house. All of it is in keeping with the restaurant's mission to create "haute cuisine for everyday consumption".

Name: Enoteca Paco Pérez
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Interesting wine list,Mastercard credit card,Terrace,Visa credit card
Description: This restaurant is characterised by its bright interior, its decor dominated by white tones, and its commitment to drawing on local produce to tell a story – every effort has been made to create an authentic Mediterranean atmosphere.Located in the luxurious Hotel Arts and presided over by award-winning chef Paco Pérez, this restaurant serves highly nuanced Mediterranean cuisine that is enriched with international influences and the occasional nod to Asian fusion cooking. The governing principles in the kitchen are underpinned by an utmost respect for seasonal produce and a clear bid to elevate traditional dining concepts such as "mar y montaña", which combines seafood with typical mountain ingredients (generally meat, ranging from sausage to game). The attentive front-of-house team pulls out all the stops to make you feel at home.

Name: Cinc Sentits
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Visa credit card,Wheelchair access
Description: This place will have you spellbound! The restaurant has been designed to enhance the dining experience by means of its different spaces. These reflect both the roots and the culinary influences of chef Jordi Artal: the landscapes of La Torre de l'Espanyol (Tarragona), where his family used to produce wine and olive oil, the spirit of Barcelona, as captured in the minimalist design of the dining room, and the private area with its single Chef's Table overlooking the kitchen, from which diners enjoy the spectacle of the chefs at work.The self-taught chef works only with produce from small, local suppliers to create his own highly personal take on modern Catalan cuisine. The two tasting menus feature dishes that are full of exquisite flavours and finesse, with textures and contrasts that never fail to impress.

Name: Smoked Room
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Counter dining,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Interesting wine list,Mastercard credit card,Visa credit card
Description: This place is somewhat reminiscent of a speakeasy, and a meal here is quite the experience. They play ingeniously with smoky flavours and aromas without ever overwhelming the palate. Located in the Hyatt Regency Hesperia Madrid, Smoked Room has its own entrance and, positioning itself as an exclusive alternative, shares its space with the restaurant Leña Madrid. The aesthetically pleasing dining area has an intimate feel and features a Japanese-style bar facing the kitchen as well as just two tables. Sophisticated cuisine is showcased here in a single tasting menu ("Todo es humo" – or "Everything is smoke"), which is based on lightly smoked and charcoal-grilled dishes and always features exquisite combinations of the finest seasonal produce, matured fish and meats, seaweed etc. Reservations are taken from the 15th of each month.

Name: El Poblet
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Interesting wine list,Mastercard credit card,Visa credit card,Wheelchair access
Description: El Poblet was the original name of Quique Dacosta's famous restaurant in Dénia, which now bears his own name. This place was founded by the culinary maestro as a tribute to his own history.Dedicated to cooking with produce from the region, especially his beloved Albufera, Luís Valls is now at the helm here. He combines his mentor's legendary dishes with his own creations, which are brimming with personality, focusing on a modern Valencian cuisine that is deeply rooted in tradition. Diners can look forward to the most exquisite textures, bold flavours, top-quality local produce and even a new take on cold cuts that is guaranteed to impress. Opt for one of two tasting menus or order à la carte. There is no shortage of great labels in the wine cellar, plus an incredible collection of single malt whiskies!

Name: Paco Roncero
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Diners Club credit card,Interesting wine list,Mastercard credit card,Terrace,Visa credit card
Description: In this elegant avant-garde space on the top floor of a 19C building, this restaurant is run by Paco Roncero, a chef who is constantly on the move and constantly pursuing new goals, which includes reinventing his cuisine from one year to the next. In this splendid setting, you can look forward to a comprehensive and highly interactive dining experience that is centred on two highly interesting menus: “Esencia” (lunchtime from Tuesday to Friday only) and “Afirmación”. The chef, who has an unwavering enthusiasm for olive oil, demonstrates his full creativity and imagination in his starters (his signature Filipino of foie gras with white chocolate and cardamom is a prime example), before moving on to delicious, traditionally inspired mains in which seasonal ingredients are to the fore, before surprising guests with desserts that combine sweet and savoury flavours (such as the highly original beetroot with black garlic). The spectacular terrace is an added bonus!

Name: Ramón Freixa Madrid
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Diners Club credit card,Interesting wine list,Mastercard credit card,Visa credit card
Description: Passionate, a perfectionist, approachable and fun, chef Ramón Freixa learnt the ropes as a child, pitching in at his family's restaurant in Barcelona (El Racó d'en Freixa). He advocates a style of behaviour rather than a culinary doctrine: "the whole philosophy behind my cooking, just as in art and in life, revolves around the pursuit of happiness". This elegant restaurant, with its strikingly beautiful flooring, has a main dining area, a private dining room, and a glass-fronted terrace resembling a veranda – it all makes for a truly luxurious setting in the Salamanca district. The three tasting menus ("Temporalidad RFM", "Descubriendo RFM" and "Universo Freixa") might seem rather eccentric at first, but it soon becomes clear that they strike the perfect balance between traditional and cutting-edge cuisine.

Name: Coque
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Interesting wine list,Mastercard credit card,Restaurant offering vegetarian menus,Visa credit card,Wheelchair access
Description: The Sandoval brothers (Mario in the kitchen, Diego front of house, and Rafael in his role as sommelier) are considered three of the biggest stars in Spain’s hospitality industry. This magnificent restaurant, occupying around 1 100m² of space, offers various experiences that take place in stages (in the bar, wine cellar, “sacristy”, kitchen etc) as part of a culinary journey through its elegant facilities, and one which has been designed in a visual way to enhance every sensation to the full. Head chef Mario Sandoval is fully conscious of the need for greater knowledge about ingredients. As such, his “Roots” menu (along with a vegan-vegetarian option) showcases creative cooking which demonstrates the true personal essence of a chef who pays full homage to the very best seasonal ingredients (teardrop peas from Guetaria, shrimp from Motril, wild Galician clams, Toro Bravo beef etc). His cooking also brings to light the research that he carries out in his “agrolab” at the Jaral de la Mira farm-estate.

Name: DSTAgE
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Visa credit card
Description: The most striking thing about this restaurant housed in an industrial loft in Chueca is how it embodies Vitoria-born chef Diego Guerrero's determination to be free to create, to surprise and to break down the barriers around our comfort zone.The high-ceilinged interior has a relaxed feel with its exposed brick walls, vintage design features, open kitchen, plus an adjoining workspace for creatives and venue for small events (DSPOT Studio & Events). The chef believes in getting the most out of his produce and champions a constantly evolving cuisine. Through his set menus ("Dstage" and "Denjoy"), he proposes a fun culinary journey around the world, fusing all kinds of ingredients and creating incredible optical illusions to remind us that things are not always what they seem.

Name: Deessa
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Interesting wine list,Mastercard credit card,Terrace,Visa credit card,Wheelchair access
Description: The gourmet flagship at the Mandarin Oriental Ritz in Madrid, Deessa is a restaurant like no other. The incomparable dining room, exquisitely laid out in the Alfonso XIII salon overlooking the garden, is the perfect setting in which to savour the intrinsic beauty of the great Quique Dacosta’s exquisite culinary vision. This celebrated chef keeps a watchful eye on everything here, closely following the magnificent cuisine created by head chef Guillermo Chávez. Their elegant dishes, exploring the flavours of the Mediterranean and the Extremadura region, are showcased on two tasting menus: one entitled “Histórico Quique Dacosta”, featuring the chef’s signature dishes from his restaurant in Dénia, and “Contemporáneo QDRITZ”. A reduced version of both menus, enticingly called “Esencia”, is also available at lunchtimes midweek.

Name: Ricard Camarena
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Interesting wine list,Mastercard credit card,Visa credit card,Wheelchair access
Description: This magnificent place is part of the refurbished Bombas Gens factory, which also houses an arts and culture centre. Here, there is a large foyer with a contemporary feel, a private bar where hors d'oeuvres are served, and the modern dining room at the back, with an open-plan kitchen where you can enjoy a final aperitif.Along with seven other chefs, Ricard Camarena was distinguished/commended with the Cocinero del Año award (Madrid Fusión, 2021) for his "green activism". His is a coherent signature cuisine solidly grounded in homegrown vegetables and a painstaking process of research. His set menus convey a clear commitment to sustainability, as he uses every last leaf of the vegetables to make his sauces or even the occasional beverage.

Name: Zuara Sushi
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Counter dining,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Interesting wine list,Mastercard credit card,Notable sake list,Visa credit card
Description: One of the most interesting sushi bars in Madrid and one with a certain pedigree, given its location in the premises where DiverXO began its stellar rise.The minimalist Japanese ambience is evident in the dining room where a typical U-shaped counter takes centre stage, showcasing David Arauz’s impressive "Itamae" sushi skills. His cuisine is fully respectful of Japanese techniques while remaining loyal to Spanish ingredients. Choose between two appetising menus (Zuara and Shibui), both of which highlight an innovative touch, successful umami flavours and include superb nigiris in which the rice is cooked to perfection (a firm texture but which melts in the mouth). The name of the restaurant is in fact a palindrome, as it is the chef’s name spelt backwards!

Name: RavioXO
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Terrace,Visa credit card,Wheelchair access
Description: In the words of chef Dabiz Muñoz, RavioXO is "the luxury of eating time", a perfect metaphor to express his informal, handcrafted cuisine, which is fully centred on the world of pasta. Here, all the dough, fillings and sauces are individually made using the very best ingredients.In this extensive restaurant, located next to El Corte Inglés’ gourmet dining space on the Paseo de la Castellana, the stylish decor is inspired by Lázaro Rosa-Violán, providing the backdrop for chef Balo Ortiz, who follows the culinary guidelines set out by award-winning Madrid chef Dabiz Muñoz in every dish. RavioXO’s exclusively à la carte cuisine features options that always include some type of pasta, ranging from the superb and innovative dumplings to some of DiverXO’s most celebrated signature dishes.

Name: COME by Paco Méndez
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Visa credit card,Wheelchair access
Description: If you were once a regular visitor to the legendary Hoja Santa, you won’t want to miss COME by Paco Méndez, which now occupies the same premises and which, in a nod to the attachment Mexicans have with the Day of the Dead, could be described as a "reborn Mexican restaurant".At the helm here is chef Paco Méndez, who has taken over the reins with his wife and head pastry chef Erinna and where he showcases " the coming together of Mexican culture and cooking, Mediterranean ingredients and the legacy of El Bulli ". Discover the flavours of this Central American country (tacos, botanas, moles etc) from a modern perspective on the à la carte and a tasting menu offering two different options. This is accompanied by an extensive selection of typical Mexican drinks (micheladas, tequilas, mezcales etc)!

Name: Ugo Chan
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Counter dining,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Visa credit card
Description: A contemporary restaurant with an open-view kitchen, two counters and a Japanese ambience that is far from lacking in personality. Its meticulous, constantly evolving cuisine could be described by quoting the Greek philosopher Heracles: "No man ever steps in the same river twice".In his restaurant, which shares the nickname given to him by his grandfather when he was a boy ("Hugochan", or "little Hugo"), chef Hugo Muñoz conjures up Japanese cuisine in which seasonal ingredients take centre stage, incorporating enjoyable influences from other cultures and with a nod to iconic Madrid dishes (such as the tripe dumplings and cod fritters). An Omakase menu is also available which can be fine-tuned according to your personal tastes and appetite!

Name: Dos Palillos
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Terrace,Visa credit card
Description: In this bustling restaurant, where the closeness of the tables is more reminiscent of Asian restaurants, discover a tapas concept that has been taken to another level, hence its view that “tapas are not just a way of eating, but a philosophy for life”.Located just a few steps from Barcelona’s Museu d’Art Contemporani, Dos Palillos has a single counter at the entrance, where you can eat without booking ahead, and a second more gastronomic U-shaped counter around an open kitchen, enabling guests to observe the full preparation process. At this second attractive and elegant space, savour enticing tasting menus that showcase a fun fusion between Asian cooking (predominantly from Japan) and Iberian ingredients.

Name: Aleia
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Visa credit card
Description: At Aleia, enjoy a fascinating experience that you’ll rarely find elsewhere, thanks to its combination of fine dining and architecture, and a location on the first floor of the famous Casa Fuster (nowadays the Hotel Casa Fuster), a jewel of Catalan Modernism designed in the early 20C by Lluís Domènech i Montaner.In its bright dining room, with large columns flanking its stunning windows and an extraordinary undulating ceiling that is reminiscent of the titanium panels adorning the Guggenheim Museum in Bilbao, savour a single tasting menu (choose between the long or short option) with a creative and contemporary vision, on which Jerez-born chef Rafa de Bedoya, always under the supervision of the award-winning Paulo Airaudo, showcases consistency and flavour, alongside a few French and Asian flourishes, and with its foundation in locally sourced seasonal ingredients.

Name: Xerta
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Visa credit card,Wheelchair access
Description: If you’re unfamiliar with the natural bounty of the Ebro Delta, a visit to this restaurant in Barcelona is a must to savour the flavours of a region that has been declared a World Biosphere Reserve.Accessed via the lobby of the Ohla Eixample hotel, Xerta boasts a contemporary dining room with views of both its vertical garden and the kitchen. Chef Fran López, who trained and worked for three years with French maestro Alain Ducasse, showcases the flavours of his home region, providing guests with an opportunity to discover its superb gastronomy (eel, oysters, rice etc - 90% of his ingredients are sourced from here) from a creative perspective. An interesting footnote is that Xerta is the first European restaurant with a Michelin star to receive Kashrut kosher certification!

Name: Alkimia
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Interesting wine list,Mastercard credit card,Visa credit card,Wheelchair access
Description: Alkimia has a somewhat surprising location inside the Moritz beer factory, which has been redesigned as a gourmet complex. Once you’ve rung the bell to get in, you’ll find two different spaces (the bistro-style Alkostat and the Alkimia restaurant itself, in front of the kitchen), both featuring attractive designer details, avant-garde references to the marine world, alongside reclaimed classical furnishings that recall the interiors of Barcelona’s former aristocratic mansions (for which the architectural company External Reference was awarded top place for best design at the prestigious 2017 SBID Awards). In the gastronomic dining room, chef Jordi Vilà conjures up fresh, contemporary cuisine which is deeply rooted in Catalan tradition and has a strong focus on fish. He offers just a single tasting menu (Alkimia), although during the hunting season guests can pre-order a second game-inspired menu (Salvaje).

Name: Fierro
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Visa credit card
Description: With a culinary tradition dating back over half a century, this restaurant located just a few metres from the Ruzafa market is renowned for its fresh take on day-to-day tastes that will come as a pleasant surprise.The attentive couple at the helm in the kitchen, Germán Carrizo and Carito Lourenço, are the first to acknowledge that their dreams have well and truly come true in this small restaurant which allows them to enjoy the freedom to combine what they learned when working within the Quique Dacosta group with the culinary roots of Carito’s native Argentina (although don’t be surprised to also find inspiration from Spain and Italy). Their cuisine is centred on a single tasting menu with two wine pairing options, the central theme of which is the Mediterranean. Guests can also savour a few seasonal extras such as truffles, caviar, artisan cheeses etc!

Name: Hisop
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Diners Club credit card,Mastercard credit card,Visa credit card
Description: Named after an aromatic Mediterranean plant, this Michelin-starred restaurant has been enjoying the fruits of its success for some time now, in part due to its competitive pricing.In the contemporary, minimalist-style dining room, chef Oriol Ivern serves fresh, creative dishes that offer a different take on Catalan culinary tradition, and are always based around locally sourced seasonal ingredients and impressive combinations. In keeping with the chef’s personality, the aim of his cuisine is to offer truly unique dishes that are both playful and full of surprising detail. Although not extensive, the enticing à la carte is complemented by an interesting tasting menu with a wine pairing option. A must here, and one that is requested time and time again, is the red mullet with a “mollusc” mayonnaise.

Name: Via Veneto
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Diners Club credit card,Interesting wine list,Mastercard credit card,Visa credit card
Description: Almost everyone in Barcelona is aware of the legendary culinary status of Via Veneto! Even after half a century of service and change, the Monje family has retained the true values of this restaurant that seems anchored in the past, but which has been able to move with the times without losing an ounce of its personality.To an elegant and genuine Belle Époque backdrop, young chef David Andrés maintains the culinary status quo here through cuisine that underpins its classical heritage, albeit with a focus on more modern technique and a select array of ingredients. Delicious game dishes are also on the menu in season. Guests can visit the superb wine cellar, 6m underground, which boasts an outstanding collection of Spanish and French wines. A favourite dish here is the pressed roast duck cooked in its own jus, which has featured on the menu since 1967!

Name: Tabaiba
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Visa credit card
Description: Located just a few metres from Las Canteras beach and taking its name from a native flower, Tabaiba enjoys surprising its guests with what it describes as its “evolutionary Canary Island cuisine”. In this small contemporary space, chef Abraham Ortega (usually seen sporting his typical sombrero), offers guests his highly personal and entertaining cuisine that takes seemingly humble Canarian cooking to new heights thanks to his superb technique and seasonal ingredients sourced from each of the islands. His cuisine is exclusively served on two tasting menus (Tabaiba and Experiencia), featuring elaborate dishes whose aim is to pay dutiful homage to local ingredients such as pella, gofio and bananas.

Name: Hofmann
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Diners Club credit card,Mastercard credit card,Visa credit card,Wheelchair access
Description: This institution, which has played host to a number of chefs who have gone on to win their own Michelin stars, reflects the love affair that its founder chef, Mey Hofmann, had with food, a legacy that she has passed down to her daughter Silvia and her expert teaching staff.In the restaurant itself, featuring staff from the school and a large picture window through which guests can watch activity unfold in the kitchen, a typical à la carte menu is available at lunchtime, enhanced by two gastronomic-style tasting menus in the evening. The focus here is on modern fusion cuisine with strong roots in tradition, which is continually brought up to date in terms of the pairing of ingredients, technique and presentation. The desserts here are always a delight!

Name: Caelis
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Counter dining,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Restaurant offering vegetarian menus,Visa credit card,Wheelchair access
Description: The Ohla Barcelona hotel’s fine dining restaurant boasts an unmistakable appearance, due to the “eyes” or “ocular globes” designed by artist Frederic Amat that adorn its neo-Classical façade. Here, French chef Romain Fornell has introduced his new culinary vision that reinterprets concepts and recipes. His cooking is based around French-influenced Mediterranean cuisine featuring seasonal ingredients, identifiable flavours and astute pairings. In addition to the different-sized tables in the dining room, and in an attempt to involve guests more in their dining experience, the open kitchen is surrounded by a U-shaped chef’s table for 14 diners who can then participate in the creative process. Its interesting tasting menus (Tierra y Mar, Celebration and a vegetarian option) also include the option of ordering individual dishes à la carte-style.
