Original, playful small plates are Mediterranean at their core but display global influences, so expect imam bayildi alongside burgers, caviar and Wagyu beef.

Name: Teible
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Great view,Mastercard credit card,Visa credit card
Description: Freshly baked breads and pastries draw you in to this cool, minimalistic bakery-cum-restaurant at the tip of the Jameel Arts Centre, which boasts beautiful views through its floor-to-ceiling windows. Menus showcase seasonal, local – and occasionally fermented – ingredients in great value dishes.

Name: Ninive
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Visa credit card
Description: It’s set in a bustling area of the city, but this charming restaurant exists in another world: a relaxing oasis, a step back in time. The design reflects a Bedouin tent, with rugs and lanterns, low tables and cosy sofas. Tasty, well-priced dishes come from all over the Middle East and North Africa.

Name: Kinoya
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,Counter dining,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Notable sake list,Terrace,Valet parking,Visa credit card
Description: There’s a buzzing atmosphere at this authentic izakaya, set in The Onyx Tower 2 in The Greens. Five ramen dishes underpin the menu, which also lists other Japanese classics including sushi, sashimi, robata and tempura. Ingredients are good quality, cooking is careful, prices, low and flavours, delicious.

Name: REIF Japanese Kushiyaki
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Counter dining,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Diners Club credit card,Mastercard credit card,Terrace,Visa credit card,Wheelchair access
Description: It’s kushiyaki-inspired but this friendly restaurant offers far more than just grilled skewered meats and vegetables. The menu also covers a wide range of well-priced snacks, sushi and ramen – and save room for one of their creative desserts. The omakase experience must be booked 5 days in advance.

Name: Fi'lia
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Brunch,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Great view,Mastercard credit card,Terrace,Valet parking,Visa credit card
Description: Its name means ‘daughter’, highlighting the females leading the way in the kitchen, as well as the culinary knowledge passed down through generations of women. Set on the 70th floor, it offers impressive views; menus list everything from artisan pizza and pasta to contemporary twists on traditional dishes.

Name: folly
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Brunch,Counter dining,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Diners Club credit card,Mastercard credit card,Terrace,Visa credit card
Description: Tucked away in Souk Madinat, this popular restaurant features an outside terrace and bar as well as a kitchen counter where you can watch the chefs in action. The ingredient-led menu offers precise, modern dishes which are pared-back in style, with an appealing clarity of flavour. Staff are warm and engaging.

Name: Ibn Albahr
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Diners Club credit card,Mastercard credit card,Terrace,Visa credit card
Description: This Lebanese seafood restaurant features fishing paraphernalia like ropes, anchors and even a boat – as well as a beautiful terrace with a great view of the beach. Head to the fresh fish counter to choose what you’d like to eat; simple yet delicious dishes let the ingredients speak for themselves.

Name: Bait Maryam
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Great view,Mastercard credit card,Visa credit card
Description: Named after the owner’s mother, this passionately run ‘home’ offers a warm welcome and delicious, home-style Levantine dishes cooked with love. Sit in the cool, tranquil dining room or out on the glass-enclosed lakeside terrace. The lunch ‘dish of the day & soup’ is a steal – and dessert is a must.

Name: Goldfish
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Counter dining,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Terrace,Visa credit card
Description: Vibrant, modern Japanese dishes – from sushi, uni and yakitori to sharing plates and Wagyu steak – are the order of the day at this funky, buzzing spot located in a smart mall. Prices are more than reasonable, and service is bright and keen; sit at the counter to watch the chefs at work.

Name: Boca
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Terrace,Visa credit card
Description: The bright, sunny look of the room is reflected in the extensive menu which careers joyfully around the Mediterranean, offering something for everyone – be sure to bring some friends so you can order with abandon. The Spanish dishes particularly stand out, such as the good-looking green herb gazpacho – the perfect refresher on a hot day.

Name: LOWE
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Car park,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Terrace,Visa credit card
Description: An appealing, original restaurant with a trendy, pared-back style, a relaxed vibe and a sustainable ethos. The impressive open kitchen features a wood oven, a grill and a rotisserie, which play a key role in many of the global dishes. Some plates are perfect for sharing; the wood-fired sesame bread is a must.

Name: Mezzaluna
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Car park,China UnionPay,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Great view,Interesting wine list,JCB,Mastercard credit card,Valet parking,Visa credit card,Wheelchair access
Description: Perched on the 65th floor of the Lebua Hotel, Mezzaluna offers sky-high and breathtaking views. Toast to the high life at Sky Bar before settling in for a gastronomic journey. The accomplished chef and his team deliver European delights with Japanese precision in a seven-course set menu, along with some surprises. The flavours are balanced and sophisticated, and the food is creative and technically precise. A wine list of substantial proportions and prices accompanies.

Name: R-Haan
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Car park,China UnionPay,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Interesting wine list,JCB,Maestro,Mastercard credit card,Valet parking,Visa credit card
Description: Inspired by an old Thai poem “Nai Nam Mi Pla Nai Na Mi Khao” (In the river, there are fish; In the rice field, there is rice), R-Haan aims to reflect the way in which food has influenced Thai people and culture. Relax in the lounge with a cocktail before entering the main dining room, or book the private room for up to 20 guests. Food is authentically Thai, offering both regional and royal cuisine, using ingredients from all over the country.

Name: Le Normandie by Alain Roux
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Car park,China UnionPay,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Diners Club credit card,Great view,Interesting wine list,JCB,Mastercard credit card,Valet parking,Visa credit card,Wheelchair access
Description: Le Normandie has been the premier destination for sophisticated French cuisine for 60 years, with renowned chef Alain Roux now overseeing operations. His refined techniques and clever combinations of flavours ensure diners are impressed, with dishes including pan-fried Brittany blue lobster medallion with ginger-flavoured vegetables julienne and white port sauce. Views of the imperial Chao Phraya River and the elaborate flower arrangements help to complete the experience.

Name: Sorn
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,Car park,Credit card / Debit card accepted,JCB,Mastercard credit card,Visa credit card
Description: In this restored two-storey mansion, a team of chefs who are said to have all learned from their grandmothers produce a marvellous tasting menu that showcases detailed, refined cooking. Thai classics are elevated to another level with near-faultless execution and meticulously sourced, top-notch produce – seafood dishes and curries prove particularly exceptional. The polished, engaging service team make the occasion extra special, while the street food inspired petits fours provide a memorable finish to a superb dining experience.

Name: Chef's Table
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Car park,China UnionPay,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Great view,Interesting wine list,JCB,Mastercard credit card,Valet parking,Visa credit card,Wheelchair access
Description: Start with champagne or a cocktail in the Pink Bar before taking your seat in this visually stunning restaurant housed inside the Lebua at State Tower hotel. Originally from the Loire Valley, chef Vincent Thierry spearheads the detailed and sophisticated modern French cooking. Dishes deliver well-judged, balanced flavours with the help of contemporary techniques and a global outlook. Top quality ingredients are to the fore and sauces are a highlight.

Name: Sühring
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Car park,Counter dining,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Garden or park,Interesting wine list,JCB,Mastercard credit card,Valet parking,Visa credit card
Description: At Sühring, twin chefs Matthias and Thomas have created a modern German tasting menu inspired by family recipes, childhood memories and travel experiences. From first bite to last, dishes are beautifully presented and feature seasonal ingredients expertly prepared, often with traditional German techniques like fermenting, pickling and curing. The restaurant is in a leafy restored 1970s villa; for an exceptional experience, book seats at the counter in the kitchen.

Name: Signature
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Car park,China UnionPay,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Great view,Interesting wine list,JCB,Maestro,Mastercard credit card,Restaurant offering vegetarian menus,Valet parking,Visa credit card,Wheelchair access
Description: Veteran Chef Thierry Drapeau expands on his ‘cuisine of the soil’ philosophy he first explored in his native Loire Valley. The art-deco dining room has floor-to-ceiling windows and velvet curtains that open to reveal his stage – an open kitchen. Here, he achieves classic French flavours using imported herbs and edible flowers that evoke their terroir. The Flower Bouquet set menus rotate with the seasons, are great value and matched by excellent service.

Name: Baan Tepa
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,Car park,China UnionPay,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Garden or park,Interesting wine list,JCB,Mastercard credit card,Visa credit card
Description: Chef Tam Chudaree Debhakam has worked in some renowned kitchens that focus on farm-to-table philosophy. Here, she brings that ethos to the skilfully crafted, detailed cooking on her contemporary Thai tasting menu. Seasonal ingredients are to the fore, sourced from sustainably minded producers and her own backyard. The menu delivers a memorable culinary journey around Thailand, with a superb range of beautifully presented dishes that showcase terrific flavour contrasts and delicate spicing. The restaurant is housed in an elegant villa and run by a charming team.

Name: Maison Dunand
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Garden or park,Interesting wine list,Mastercard credit card,Visa credit card
Description: Following his successful time as Head Chef of Le Normandie, Arnaud Dunand Sauthier’s next venture was opening his own place. Here he welcomes you into a home designed like the Alpine chalets of the Savoie region in France, where he grew up. The French contemporary tasting menu is inspired by his alpine origins, childhood trips to Brittany and his glittering international culinary journey. Expect too an excellent wine cellar with good representation for Alsace and Savoie.

Name: Gaa
FacilitiesAndServices: American Express credit card,Car park,China UnionPay,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Interesting wine list,JCB,Maestro,Mastercard credit card,Visa credit card
Description: Outside traditional, inside contemporary, Gaa’s location mirrors chef Garima Arora’s exquisite cooking: old-school at heart, transformed with modern techniques and presentation. Garima serves many of the terrific dishes herself, from a tasting menu that is informed by her Indian heritage and includes reinterpretations of street food snacks. This is assured, understated and skilful cooking where the finely judged spicing, extraordinary flavour combinations and contrasts in texture and temperature all stand out.

Name: Sushi Masato
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Car park,China UnionPay,Counter dining,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Diners Club credit card,JCB,Maestro,Mastercard credit card,Visa credit card
Description: Having honed his craft in Tokyo, and built his reputation in New York, Chef Masato Shimizu was one of the first to bring omakase, counter dining to Bangkok, in 2015. All the dishes are made of the finest, seasonal ingredients imported from Japanese fish markets, such as Toyosu market. The same seasonal menu is offered across two floors, but advanced reservations are necessary for the definitive experience, served by Masato himself.

Name: Methavalai Sorndaeng
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Car park,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Terrace,Visa credit card,Wheelchair access
Description: One of the city’s original Thai fine dining restaurants, they’ve maintained a loyal customer base for 60+ years, using the same timeless recipes and cooking techniques. The refined dishes are complex, delivering blasts of flavour. Highlights are crispy rice noodles in sweet and sour sauce, spicy lemongrass salad, and crab meat and acacia red curry. The curry pastes are made from scratch and fishcakes from featherback fish. Small parties should book the private room.

Name: Elements, Inspired by Ciel Bleu
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Car park,China UnionPay,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Diners Club credit card,Great view,JCB,Mastercard credit card,Terrace,Valet parking,Visa credit card,Wheelchair access
Description: The impressive city views make this an ideal spot for a date; it also boasts chic décor, with an open kitchen, oversized industrial light fittings and charcoal walls. They’ve worked closely with Ciel Bleu in Amsterdam on their approach of French fine dining infused with Japanese influences, and three tasting experiences – Ku-Ki (4 courses), Chikyu (6), Mizu (8) and The Complete Experience (9). The Akita Wagyu is a menu highlight, with succulent marbled Japanese beef that’s grilled to perfection.

Name: Le Du
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,Car park,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Interesting wine list,Mastercard credit card,Visa credit card
Description: Chef “Ton” Thitid creatively re-interprets Thai cuisine, with a rotating seasonal menu – Le Du comes from a Thai word meaning ‘season’. In summer, highlights include their signature Khao Chae, as well as Khao Khluk Kapi; the organic rice, cooked with salty aromatic shrimp paste and pork jam, is served with perfectly done river prawns. A relaxed ambience makes this a welcome retreat for diners.

Name: Blue by Alain Ducasse
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Car park,China UnionPay,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Diners Club credit card,Great view,Interesting wine list,JCB,Maestro,Mastercard credit card,Valet parking,Visa credit card,Wheelchair access
Description: The moment it launched in 2019, Blue by Alain Ducasse became a prime destination for gastronomy lovers from Bangkok and beyond. The restaurant brings the renowned chef’s contemporary French fine dining to Icon Siam in an elegant room with panoramic views of the Chao Phraya River. Under its executive chef, Blue offers diners a chance to savour world-class dishes using top quality ingredients. Advanced reservations are essential.

Name: Saneh Jaan
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Car park,China UnionPay,Credit card / Debit card accepted,JCB,Mastercard credit card,Visa credit card
Description: Thai cuisine continues to evolve at this restaurant as it finds new ways to reinvent traditional fare without losing its roots. The menu boasts both carefully prepared classics and rare vintage recipes, including some that once impressed the royal family. The sweet and sour crispy rice noodles with river prawns are outstanding, as is the flavoursome massaman curry with slow-cooked Kamphaeng Saen beef. Start your visit in the relaxing bar area, with one of their signature cocktails made using Thai liqueurs and herbs.

Name: Côte by Mauro Colagreco
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Car park,China UnionPay,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Diners Club credit card,Great view,Interesting wine list,JCB,Maestro,Mastercard credit card,Valet parking,Visa credit card,Wheelchair access
Description: Côte brings Riviera-inspired cuisine to the Chao Phraya River, helped along by panoramic waterside views. Head Chef Davide Garavaglia has worked closely with Mauro Colagreco for years, so has an excellent knowledge of this modern French, beautifully presented style of cooking. The team revel in surprising guests at each course, with menus based upon whatever top-notch produce is available on the day. The gin trolley and wine or non-alcoholic pairings are available to complete the experience, and the outstanding service is warm and professional.

Name: Jay Fai
FacilitiesAndServices: Cash only
Description: Jay Fai has long been a street food icon, and for good reason — the begoggled chef’s signature crispy, golden-brown crab omelettes are simply unparalleled. If you’re looking for another reason to love the local legend, then also try her excellent stir-fried noodles with seafood and gravy. This is a deservedly popular spot and they don’t take bookings, so be sure to arrive early and be prepared to queue.

FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Car park,Counter dining,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Interesting wine list,JCB,Mastercard credit card,Visa credit card
Description: Representing the ratio of exquisite local ingredients to the chef’s inspiration, 80/20’s dynamic seasonal tasting menu offers innovative delights, from the first bite to the last. The concept also applies to the design, featuring mostly Thai materials in an industrial loft style. The chef uses modern techniques and an in-house fermentation lab to produce traditional Thai dishes, ideal for sharing. The delightful signature, Stormy Sea (squid, mangosteen, chilli), is a must.

Name: Yu Ting Yuan
FacilitiesAndServices: American Express credit card,Car park,China UnionPay,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Interesting wine list,JCB,Mastercard credit card,Valet parking,Visa credit card,Wheelchair access
Description: There is a luxurious feel to this lavish Cantonese restaurant that is a gorgeously designed space inside the equally stylish Four Seasons hotel. Expansive windows look out on to a reflective pool which comes to life at night with the illumination of contemporary artworks. The Cantonese chef brings a modern and creative approach to the cooking, as well as a Thai twist in places. The extensive menus include tasting and à la carte options, plus a dim sum selection at lunch.

Name: Aksorn
FacilitiesAndServices: American Express credit card,Car park,China UnionPay,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Terrace,Visa credit card
Description: Taking Thai cookbooks from the 1940s to the 1970s as inspiration, David Thompson expertly recreates the culinary lives of one chef at a time through flavoursome dishes, here on the top floor of Central: The Original Store. Highlights include coconut cupcakes with salted pork, and fermented bean curd relish with minced pork and prawns. Sit in the cosy dining room to see the open kitchen or on the outdoor terrace to take in city and street views.

Name: Khao (Ekkamai)
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Car park,China UnionPay,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Diners Club credit card,JCB,Mastercard credit card,Visa credit card
Description: Serving meticulously crafted Thai cuisine in a beautiful dining room inspired by traditional rice barns, Khao, whose name means 'rice' in Thai, is all about the details. Everything is prepared from fresh, premium ingredients, including the excellent crab roe chilli paste served with mackerel, eggs, and veggies. For dessert, the tapioca pearls stuffed with strawberries (think Daifuku) is a must-try. For a real culinary journey, book the Chef’s Table menu.

Name: IGNIV
FacilitiesAndServices: American Express credit card,Car park,China UnionPay,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Interesting wine list,JCB,Mastercard credit card,Restaurant offering vegetarian menus,Valet parking,Visa credit card,Wheelchair access
Description: Igniv means “nest” in Romansh, the mother tongue of chef-founder Andreas Caminada, and there is certainly a playful nest-like quality to this elegant restaurant in The St. Regis Bangkok hotel. The Head Chef and pastry chef have worked alongside the celebrated founder for many years, all collaborating to craft detailed dishes that are executed with a Swiss clock-making precision. Their excellent tasting menu inspires sharing, with multiple dishes served simultaneously.

Name: Haoma
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Garden or park,Interesting wine list,JCB,Mastercard credit card,Restaurant offering vegetarian menus,Visa credit card
Description: Chef Deepanker Khosla says of his Haoma team, "We grow what we cook, we cook what we love.” And what is that? Sustainable, seasonal, local ingredients sourced from farmers, breeders, fisherfolk and the restaurant’s own garden. They’re turned into delicious, beautifully plated neo-Indian dishes, in à la carte and seasonal tasting menus (including a vegetarian one). It all happens in a Nordic-style dining room where even the decor includes unused plant parts.

Name: Savelberg
FacilitiesAndServices: American Express credit card,Car park,China UnionPay,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Diners Club credit card,Interesting wine list,JCB,Mastercard credit card,Visa credit card,Wheelchair access
Description: Food and mood pair well at Dutch chef-owner Henk Savelberg’s eponymous restaurant, now in a contemporary house in Chong Nonsi. The sparkling dining room features an open kitchen, a refined wine cellar and garden views, with private group dining available. The set menu boast sophisticated modern French fare made from fine international ingredients. Rounding out the experience is the professional service. Booking is essential.

Name: Sra Bua by Kiin Kiin
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Car park,China UnionPay,Credit card / Debit card accepted,JCB,Mastercard credit card,Restaurant offering vegetarian menus,Valet parking,Visa credit card,Wheelchair access
Description: Inspired by its sister restaurant, Copenhagen's Kiin Kiin, Sra Bua is one of Bangkok’s original purveyors of modern, innovative Thai cuisine. À la carte and tasting menus are available, with their dishes – from street food starter to dessert – proving creative and original, yet respectful of traditional Thai flavours. Premium international ingredients are used throughout, while both alcoholic and non-alcoholic pairings are available to complete the experience.

Name: Potong
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Interesting wine list,JCB,Mastercard credit card,Visa credit card
Description: Traditional and novel converge at this Thai-Chinese fine dining restaurant from chef Pichaya “Pam” Soontornyanakij. Set in a historical Sino-Portuguese building that used to be Pam's family’s Chinese pharmacy, Potong blends rustic and modern décor from ground floor bar to rooftop chill space. Her progressive tasting menu is infused with storytelling and hits its peak with aged duck breast. To make it even better, ask the sommelier for a wine pairing.

Name: Canvas
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,China UnionPay,Counter dining,Credit card / Debit card accepted,JCB,Mastercard credit card,Valet parking,Visa credit card
Description: Food meets art at Chef Riley Sanders' plush establishment. Every dish of the 22-course journey is depicted as a painting in the menu, like an art gallery brochure. The talented Texan sources seasonal ingredients from all over Thailand and transforms them with a modern interpretation. Bounty is the kaleidoscopic showpiece and plant-based dish. Counter seats offer views of the chefs, while tables upstairs offer more privacy. Wine or tea pairings are available.

Name: J'AIME by Jean-Michel Lorain
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,Car park,China UnionPay,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Diners Club credit card,JCB,Maestro,Mastercard credit card,Terrace,Valet parking,Visa credit card,Wheelchair access
Description: As you enter this restaurant, your world becomes a little topsy-turvy, with a grand piano suspended from the ceiling and upside-down chandeliers. But take one bite of the creative French cuisine and all will be right again. Protégés of the eponymous Jean-Michel Lorain produce the Memoirs and Wonder set menus with one eye on sustainability, using almost entirely Thai ingredients while retaining a French heart.

Name: Paste
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Car park,China UnionPay,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Interesting wine list,JCB,Mastercard credit card,Valet parking,Visa credit card,Wheelchair access
Description: The food here is as impressive and intricate as the spiral silk cocoon sculpture that fills the airy dining room. Drawing inspiration from royal Thai cuisine, the kitchen also employs century-old techniques and plenty of local ingredients. The roasted duck with nutmeg and coriander and the char-grilled pork, fennel seed, and smoked tomato relish are recommended and can be found on the tasting menus and à la carte. Excellent service further enhances the experience.

Name: Nahm
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Car park,Counter dining,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Restaurant offering vegetarian menus,Terrace,Visa credit card,Wheelchair access
Description: Every dish displays Chef Pim’s creativity and attention to detail, with her passion for authentic Thai flavours shining through in both the set menus and à la carte dishes. For the full experience, order the Heritage set menu. It boasts a stream of delicious dishes from savoury canapés to flavourful mains and a luscious dessert; standouts include Yam Pak Yang Tawai (leaves and fruit salad with Tawai dressing) and Nuea Pad Piroth (stir-fried Wagyu beef).

Name: Chim by Siam Wisdom
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,Car park,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Garden or park,Mastercard credit card,Visa credit card
Description: Chef Thaninthorn’s passionate take on traditional Thai cuisine balances domestic with international and classic with contemporary in dishes that use first-rate ingredients from around Thailand. The "Thai food in 4 Regions” set, presents a dazzling array of flavours. The setting, a vintage wooden house decorated with abundant greenery, invites you to relax and savour your meal. Booking is a must.

Name: Cadence by Dan Bark
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Car park,Credit card / Debit card accepted,JCB,Mastercard credit card,Restaurant offering vegetarian menus,Valet parking,Visa credit card
Description: After the success of his restaurant Upstairs, Korean-American chef Dan Bark opened Cadence to offer progressive American cuisine in an elegant dining room. Building on his experience in some of Chicago’s best restaurants, he combines the flavours of Western and Asian cuisine in complex dishes with an array of components. The cooking can be complemented by an impressive curation of wines or a well-crafted, refreshing cocktail pairing.

Name: Busarin Cuisine
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,Cash only
Description: Busarin, the new sister restaurant of Magnolia Café, has high ceilings, a collection of chinaware and leather green sofa booths that contrast with the light pink walls. When you dine here, it’s like being welcomed into Chef Noi’s home. They serve northern-Thai based on family recipes with noodles and roti instead of rice. The standout is a streaky pork that’s braised in a hung lay curry for two days and emits a powerful aroma of ginger and spices.

Name: Aunt Aoy Kitchen
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,Cash only
Description: The décor is simple, with a display of photos and messages on post-it notes from customers gone by. Aunt Aoy spent much of her career cooking in hotel kitchens. Her expertise is realised in the fluffy yet crispy Chef Omelette with stir-fried minced pork, salted egg and pork crackling.

Name: Dan Chicken Rice (San Sai)
FacilitiesAndServices: Car park,Cash only
Description: For over 20 years this local favourite has been serving tasty, wallet-friendly chicken rice, first in Sam-Yaek Market in San Sai and now at this larger branch on Old San Sai Road. Show up early, both to beat the crowds and because the food invariably runs out before closing time.

Name: Khanom Bueang Wan Phueng Noi (Chok Chai 4)
FacilitiesAndServices: Cash only
Description: This shop is entirely devoted to the delicious dessert known as Khanom Bueang. These crepes are crispy and topped with just the right ratio of aromatic coconut cream, sweet egg floss, and young coconut slices. Be sure to arrive near opening time to avoid a wait.

Name: Burapa
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Restaurant offering vegetarian menus,Visa credit card
Description: This restaurant from the owner of Sri Trat takes diners on a journey east-by-northeast to taste a unique, flavoursome cuisine that joins culinary elements from Isan and the province of Trat. The experience is enhanced by the Orient Express theme, with the ground floor designed to look like a luxury train bar and the 1st and 2nd floors resembling business- and first-class carriages respectively. As it gets busy at dinner, reservations are essential.

Name: Por. Pochaya
FacilitiesAndServices: Cash only
Description: For over half a century, unwavering quality and rare dishes have kept loyal fans visiting this traditional Thai-Chinese spot, which is now run by the third generation of the same family. Among the top-sellers are crab omelette and stir-fried beef with cumin leaves. Crowds are to be expected, so make sure you book to avoid disappointment. It’s closed weekends and holidays.

Name: 100 Mahaseth (Si Phraya)
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,China UnionPay,Credit card / Debit card accepted,JCB,Mastercard credit card,Visa credit card
Description: This nose-to-tail inspired offal restaurant serves elevated Isaan fare made from quality ingredients sourced from local Thai farmers. The chef puts great care into balancing flavours and presenting attractive plates – and this is evident with dishes like the aged beef tongue and the fried offal chips. Guests are served in a dining room that matches the rustic with the industrial; a dry-ageing meat cabinet adds a modern touch. Don’t forget to check the blackboard for aged steak specials.

Name: Krua Kampan Khao Yai
FacilitiesAndServices: Car park,Cash only
Description: The kampan (Thai for sailing ship) is an antique boat at the heart of the restaurant that has been transferred from Ayutthaya. The menu, designed by the owner, uses classic Thai recipes packed with intense flavours. The minced pork spare ribs with betel leaf is a signature dish; every meaty mouthful contains crispy cartilage in a spicy curry. Meanwhile, the red curry rice field snail with coconut milk is brought to life by the enlivening aroma of the betel leaf.

Name: Lab Somphit
FacilitiesAndServices: Cash only
Description: Granny Somphit has prepared her food from scratch every day for more than five decades. This is flavourful Isan food at its best – a lovely balance of intense local spices and Thai herbs. The carefully selected offal cuts are particularly fresh. The signature Isan spicy calf beef salad is delightful; tender meaty slices that are beautifully seasoned with a smoky aroma of rice powder that adds a crispy texture. The homemade beef sausage, fermented beef and pork are also good.

Name: Ket O Cha
FacilitiesAndServices: Cash only
Description: Perennially crowded, this local favourite has a legacy spanning several decades. It specialises in aromatic noodle soup, with a peppery fragrance and mild sweet and salty taste. Diners can choose from tender slow-cooked beef, juicy blanched beef slices, and bouncy homemade beef balls.

Name: Bangkok Bold Kitchen (Central Embassy)
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Car park,Credit card / Debit card accepted,JCB,Mastercard credit card,Restaurant offering vegetarian menus,Visa credit card
Description: Word-of-mouth inspired Chef Nhoi to take the leap from cooking studio in the old town to opening a restaurant in the city centre. Her aim is to preserve the heritage of Thai taste that’s ‘basic and bold’ with creative twists. Check out the unique stir-fried pork and shrimp, hummingbird flowers, fish sauce and scrambled eggs. And the spicy salted beef in coconut cream is tender with balanced flavours, enlivened by fresh shallots and bird's eye chillies.

Name: Jao Nai Fish Ball (Ekkachai)
FacilitiesAndServices: Cash only
Description: This long-standing Chinatown stall may have moved to the outskirts but its flavoursome fish balls still attract many diners. The old townhouse may not be as well-maintained as you’d wish, but the food more than makes up for that.

Name: Somsak Pu Ob (Charoen Rat)
FacilitiesAndServices: Cash only
Description: This cart serves some of the best steamed crabs or prawns on glass noodles at wallet-friendly prices. Make sure you stir the noodles to soak up the tasty juices. It has a few branches, but this is where it all started. Come early or the wait will be long.

Name: Kin Kub Koi
FacilitiesAndServices: Car park,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Visa credit card,Wheelchair access
Description: The chef-owner here knows seafood. Not only does her family run a wholesale seafood business, but she also ran the previous incarnation of this place in Samut Sakhon for years before moving it here. The results are skilfully cooked dishes made from choice seafood, like standouts grilled river prawns and stir-fried crab with bitter beans and shrimp paste. Two dining zones (with and without AC) are available; both face a leafy courtyard.

Name: Konchong Konprung
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,Cash only
Description: The menu at this Chinese comfort food spot traces back to family gatherings the owners attended in their youth. Cherished recipes from those gatherings, plus fresh creations from the chef, are served in a warm, inviting space accented with a homely décor and nostalgic Chinese posters. A highlight is the pickled plum and garlic soup with minced pork balls, which brings together enticing herbal aromas and complex flavours with satisfyingly textured pork balls.

Name: Maan Muang
FacilitiesAndServices: Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Visa credit card
Description: This lovely wooden Lanna house with rustic charm will magically whisk you off to Chiang Mai. The dining area under the raised house is decorated with traditional Thai wooden furniture and earthenware. The staff too are dressed in Northern Thai fashions and speak in a regional dialect. But it’s the dizzying array of dishes and beautiful blend of northern ingredients that tops it off. The Thai curry soup with pork ribs and jackfruit hits the spot.

Name: Nong Rim Klong
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,Cash only
Description: Nong Rim Klong has been reincarnated from a canal-side food stall to a shophouse across two floors. The quality of the fresh seafood, served in generous portions, is the highlight. The scrambled eggs with crab meat are deliciously creamy and the seabass tom yum soup hits the spot.

Name: Khao Soi Mae Sai
FacilitiesAndServices: Cash only
Description: Believed by many to be the world’s favourite curry, this affordable street stall serves the famous khao soi. Their signature dish hits the spot with intense herbs, rich curry paste and tender braised beef. Also, don’t miss the vermicelli rice with northern Thai pork curry and tomato.

Name: Tune In Garden
FacilitiesAndServices: Car park,Cash only,Great view,Terrace
Description: This restaurant is owned by the late National Artist of Thailand and his wife. She cooks delicious homestyle fare drawn from a cookbook she wrote based on her mother-in-law’s recipes. First-timers are served a fixed-price menu; returners can order from the cookbook. Roasted pork ribs with cabbage and fermented pork with fermented bean curd relish stand out. Booking is required.

Name: Nai Mong Hoi Thod
FacilitiesAndServices: Cash only
Description: Chinatown is iconic for its street food and this is one of the most popular stands. Mr Mong has served Hoi Thod (fried oyster) for over 30 years. It’s only small and he’s busy at lunch, but the shellfish are well selected and fresh, and the fried mussels have a great crunch.

Name: K. Panich
FacilitiesAndServices: Cash only
Description: This legendary shop by the Grand Palace uses an 80-year-old family recipe passed down the generations. The mango sticky rice is perfectly cooked and certainly hits the sweet spot. Meanwhile, the steamed sticky rice with banana or taro is succulent and accentuated by the coconut milk.

Name: Polo Fried Chicken (Soi Polo)
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,Cash only
Description: Run by the same family for three generations, this restaurant (actually two outlets in the same alley – one with air conditioning, one without) has been serving up affordable, delicious food for over 50 years. The draw is the deservedly famous fried chicken topped with deep-fried garlic, made from a secret southern-style recipe created by the first-generation owner. The generous som tam with seafood is also highly recommended, with a good balance between sweet and sour flavours.

Name: Guay Tiew Khua Gai Suanmali (Khlang Hospital Intersection)
FacilitiesAndServices: Cash only
Description: Family-owned and managed, this small stall’s hallmark dish is roasted chicken noodles. The noodles have a crispy, non-oily texture and are rich in seasoning aromas. Khao Lao Haeng, the dry option, is served with a crispy omelette, chicken and squid: highly recommended.

Name: Go-Ang Kaomunkai Pratunam (Petchaburi 30)
FacilitiesAndServices: Cash only
Description: This humble chicken and rice stall has drawn a devoted fan base of locals and in-the-know visitors for more than 60 years. The aromatic rice is cooked with chicken oil and perfectly matches the tender and juicy chicken. The soybean with ginger and chilli dipping sauce is the flavourful addition.

Name: Samlor
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Visa credit card
Description: Samlor means ‘tricycle’ in Thai and a traditional one hangs outside this cosy restaurant. Inside the loft-style space, chef Napol creates flavoursome, well-presented elevated Thai cuisine inspired by local street food with specially selected ingredients. They also have a la carte menu, including cut of the day (main course of the day) and catch of the day (fish menu of the day) available. Guests need to check with the chef at the spot what they specially have on that day. The seasonal tasting menu (advance booking required) is also delightful.

Name: Huan Soontaree
FacilitiesAndServices: Car park,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Great view,JCB,Mastercard credit card,Restaurant offering vegetarian menus,Terrace,Visa credit card
Description: Soontaree Vechanont doesn’t just own “Soontaree’s House” – the singer also performs here nightly. Set on the Ping River in an open-air, Lanna-style building with more tables outside, this charming restaurant can accommodate up to 350 guests. Among the Northern Thai cooking they serve is their signature boneless murrel fish stuffed with pork. It’s a creative dish, with the well-seasoned sausage proving suitably fragrant and spicy.

Name: Penlaos
FacilitiesAndServices: Car park,Cash only,Great view,Wheelchair access
Description: Penlaos started over a decade ago as a street stall. Today, it’s an altogether different operation offering a quality menu in a building with high ceilings surrounded by lush gardens and views of the mountains. They serve Isan food using homemade condiments – the spicy catfish salad is a must. The Laosian style spicy mushroom soup is made with Tiliacora juice, seasonal mushrooms and gourd which adds a natural sweetness. The Thai coconut milk custard rounds off your meal nicely.

Name: Krua Suwimol
FacilitiesAndServices: Car park,Cash only
Description: This simple, open-air restaurant serves Thai-Chinese fare. The food is distinctive for its simply cooking techniques yet quality dishes with extra-fresh ingredients and intense flavours. They offer a fantastic range, including several seafood and made-to-order options. The stir-fried crab with curry paste is a must for the succulently sweet crab meat. The spicy salad with mimosa is great too – the water mimosa are carefully selected, steamed and topped with a salad rich in Thai herbs.

Name: Go Neng (Wichayanon)
FacilitiesAndServices: Cash only
Description: Go Neng has been serving deep-fried dough sticks for almost four decades. No matter what shape they take – crocodile, dinosaur, dragon or elephant – each one boasts the same puffy perfection and crispy texture. Other bites, such as the deep-fried bun and fried whole-wheat dough are also great.

Name: Thien Duong
FacilitiesAndServices: Car park,China UnionPay,Counter dining,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Diners Club credit card,JCB,Mastercard credit card,Restaurant offering vegetarian menus,Terrace,Visa credit card
Description: Thien Duong is a showcase of Vietnamese classical design; the antique artworks, mustard-coloured walls, rose-pink granite table tops, shiny black floor tiles and exposed ceiling are an interior design lover’s paradise. The menu too is an exhibition of authentic Vietnamese style and is presented by a chef with an eye for detail. The skewered minced prawns with sugarcane and grilled pork sausage are both nicely crafted, with juicy flavours and complex textures.

Name: Phed Phed Bistro
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,Car park,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Visa credit card
Description: Phed Phed has many branches, but this one stands out for its minimalist wire mesh theme décor. The menu offers comforting Isan favourites steeped in flavour. Don’t miss the herbal pork soup with its tender, crispy cartilage and sweet pumpkin, while the green apple som tum and salty fish sauce with dried shrimp perfectly blends sweet with sour. Large groups of locals pack the place at lunch and dinner. As they don't accept bookings, arrive early to avoid a wait.

Name: Lung Khajohn Wat Ket
FacilitiesAndServices: Cash only
Description: For decades, this place has been serving distinctive Khao Kriab Pak Moh, or steamed rice skin dumplings, opposite Wat Ket Karam. These contain a tasty salty-sweet filling wrapped in a coconut-infused rice flour sheet and a side of coconut cream. Tapioca balls with sweet pork are also offered.

Name: Tue Ka Ko Na Prince
FacilitiesAndServices: Cash only
Description: This Tue Ka Ko – or taro fritter – place has been open for over 20 years opposite The Prince Royal's College, hence the name “Tue Ka Ko Na Prince." Savoury and sweet, their version of the Chiang Mai snack is perfected textured and served with peanut sauce. Deep-fried tofu is also sold.

Name: Na Chantra
FacilitiesAndServices: American Express credit card,Car park,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Garden or park,Great view,Mastercard credit card,Restaurant offering vegetarian menus,Terrace,Visa credit card
Description: Set up in the hills inside the Chantra Khiri Hotel, Na Chantra offers gorgeous views of the national park and a menu that features central and northern Thai dishes. Vegetables and herbs come from their next-door farm and everything else – like the savoury northern sausage with chilli paste – is made from scratch. Don’t miss their signature minced pork with fresh veg and spicy sauce, or the piquant yellow curry soup with sea bass. Start your evening outside, with a seat by the infinity pool.

Name: Bokkia Tha Din Daeng
FacilitiesAndServices: Cash only
Description: Tucked away in a small market stall, this family-run restaurant is famous for its sweet Bokkia. It's a unique treat: sticky egg noodles, topped with crushed ice and syrup, which is amazingly refreshing and not too sweet. The condimental options are also good quality.

Name: Thai Niyom
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Car park,Counter dining,Credit card / Debit card accepted,JCB,Mastercard credit card,Visa credit card
Description: Hidden in the shadow of skyscrapers is this gem of restaurant, which got its start serving family recipes, but now offers an array of Thai cuisine from Chiang Mai to Hat Yai. It is a great place to sample delicious Thai cooking from every region on the same table. Quality ingredients are sourced locally and turned into dishes like the recommended Phuket stir-fried pork belly with shrimp paste and the Chiang Mai Combo, a Northern Thai-style appetiser plate.

Name: Weng (Woeng Nakhon Kasem)
FacilitiesAndServices: Cash only
Description: This push cart on the main drag in Chinatown serves tasty crab fried rice, crab noodles and stir-fried fish maw. Chunks of crab cooked à la minute have a smoky aroma and could put many an upmarket Chinese restaurant to shame. Arrive early or be ready to queue.

Name: Jok Prince
FacilitiesAndServices: Cash only
Description: Visit Jok Prince for a bowl of congee; the ultimate Asian comfort food. The porridge is smooth with a unique smoky aroma, topped with a raw or century egg and pork balls – made with good quality ham that’s minced and seasoned in-house. The pork offal is also fresh and well prepared.

Name: Tek Heng (Mee Krob Jeen Lee)
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Visa credit card
Description: History is on the menu at this legendary Thai-Chinese restaurant. Starting out as a floating shop on Klong Bangkok Yai before moving onshore in 1907, it’s now run by 4th generation descendants of the Thai-Teochew founders. It fills three shophouses adorned with articles, awards, and photos, including some of King Rama V. He is said to have enjoyed the Mee Krob, or crispy vermicelli – one of this place’s many classics based on 130-year-old family recipes.

Name: Han Thueng Chiang Mai
FacilitiesAndServices: Car park,Cash only
Description: Occupying gable-roofed houses near Chiang Mai University, this place may lack a sign but locals have been flocking here for its delicious, competitively priced Northern Thai fare for over a decade. The rustic décor echoes the no-frills food with delicate flavours and textures. Their steamed beef slices with galangal dip are recommended; and for a delicious off-menu dish, order the seasonal special made from ingredients like wild mushrooms. Service is friendly.

Name: Rote Yiam Beef Noodle
FacilitiesAndServices: Cash only
Description: For over 30 years, this small shop has prided itself on serving some of the city’s best beef noodles with intensely flavourful broth packed with Chinese herbs and bouncy beef balls made in-house. Non-noodle fans can opt for beef yellow curry on rice. Either way, be sure to finish with coconut ice cream.

Name: Huen Muan Jai
FacilitiesAndServices: Car park,Credit card / Debit card accepted,JCB,Mastercard credit card,Visa credit card
Description: Headed up by former TV chef Charan Thipeung, this restaurant – whose name means ‘happy home’ – has been serving authentic Northern Thai food since 2011. Set in a Lanna house with a tree-lined garden, it’s a popular, wallet-friendly destination that offers hard-to-find traditional dishes alongside classic favourites. The uniquely flavoured spicy minced fish salad is highly recommended and if you’re unfamiliar with the cuisine, start with the excellent Northern appetizer sampler.

Name: Maadae Slow Fish Kitchen
FacilitiesAndServices: Cash only
Description: Supporting the fishermen of Chumphon in the southeast, the chef opened this restaurant to deliver fresh seafood to the north. It’s caught close to the shoreline and transported within a day. The other seasonal and organic ingredients are sourced locally, while sauces are made in-house without preservatives. The dishes are simple, and the taste of umami features prominently on the menu. But the chargrilled catch of the day is the perfect marriage of flavours.

Name: Sanyod (Sathon-Bang Rak)
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,Car park,Cash only
Description: For over 50 years, this tiny noodle stall tucked away in a small alley has served mouth-watering Thai-Cantonese fare to faithful regulars. The modern dining room is pleasantly appointed and located just opposite the original take-away shop. The star of the menu is chargrilled roast duck marinated in a secret sauce. The deep-fried shrimp balls topped with mustard greens, which are huge, crispy and perfectly paired with a sticky sauce, are also recommended. Meanwhile, meat-lovers will enjoy the tender beef braised in a clay pot.

Name: Sanguan Sri
FacilitiesAndServices: Cash only
Description: Surrounded by high-end businesses and embassies near Lumphini Park, Sanguan Sir still pulls in the international crowds. This legendary but simple Thai eatery began in 1970 and its chipped plates and simple cutlery all add to the feel. It offers small and large portions of signatures and alternating daily specials. The stir-fried crispy snake-head fish in red curry has a luscious amalgam of salty, sweet and spicy, with kaffir lime julienne adding acidity.

Name: Ann Guay Tiew Khua Gai
FacilitiesAndServices: Cash only
Description: Fried noodles are a ubiquitous street dish, but here they take on another dimension, thanks to wok-fried crispiness and top-notch chicken, ham and seafood. The signature roasted chicken noodles are cooked fresh on a hot charcoal stove. Nibble on the tasty assortment of fried snacks while you wait.

Name: Pad Thai Fai Ta Lu (Dinsor Road)
FacilitiesAndServices: Cash only
Description: The aroma of pork roasting on the wok will have your mouth watering before you even enter this funky eatery from chef Andy Yang. The pork – quality char-grilled pork loin slice – tops savoury Pad Thai in the recommended signature Pad Thai Fai Ta Lu Moo Yang (roasted pork Pad Thai).

Name: Piya Radna
FacilitiesAndServices: Cash only
Description: For over 20 years, this simple outlet has been popular with locals. It serves high-quality pad see ew and rad na with either fresh or deep-fried noodles. The delicious rad na is the signature, served with a homemade gelatinous gravy and tender pork slices.

Name: Krua Lawng Khao
FacilitiesAndServices: Car park,Cash only
Description: Food and atmosphere are well-matched at this chill Northern Thai restaurant in Mae Rim. It’s in a two-storey wooden pavilion with regular tables downstairs and cushioned floor seating upstairs; both options offer relaxing rice field views and refreshing breezes. The food here is equally fresh, as well as flavourful and easy on the wallet; the Northern Thai spicy pork salad and the Northern Thai hot and spicy soup with fish and morning glory are recommended.

Name: Mae Khlong Hua Pla Mo Fai
FacilitiesAndServices: Car park,Cash only
Description: Simple in its design with a white pavilion and modest dining tables, the restaurant has a small garden with some outdoor seating. The owners are hands-on, preparing every dish with care. The stir-fried crab has a naturally sweet meat and wok-fried aroma, and is served with glass noodles, spicy chilli and crunchy mimosa. The large butterfly-cut river fish is nicely char-grilled. The grilled river prawns, meanwhile, are clearly the people’s favourite.

Name: Arunwan
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,Cash only
Description: Opened over 60 years ago and now run by the founder’s children, this spot specialises in a pork offal and pickled cabbage soup that they have honed over the years using a family recipe. It’s a fresh-tasting dish and the cabbage combines well with the sweetness of the pork consommé. The wonderfully crispy pork wontons with sweet black sauce are well worth ordering while you wait for your soup.

Name: Khanom Ochin
FacilitiesAndServices: Cash only
Description: Ochin is named after the owner's favourite Japanese film. This second-generation stall only serves takeaway – a range of homemade deep-fried buns presented on a trolley at the front. Their signature is the crispy bun which contains glass noodles, tasty seasoning and vegetables.

Name: Koa Chun Huad
FacilitiesAndServices: Cash only
Description: For more than five decades, Koa Chun Huad, with its simple interior, has been attracting throngs of locals. Named after the chef-owner who has worked in many a kitchen in Chinatown, it serves classic Thai-Chinese dishes at appealingly low prices. Each one impresses but the highlights are the boiled pork slices, perfectly complemented by a soybean sauce, and the intense stewed pork with sweet-salty five spice gravy.

Name: Roti Pa Day
FacilitiesAndServices: Cash only
Description: First-timers should order the plain crispy roti with condensed milk to start. The roti flour here is uniquely made without eggs. Instead, Thai-Pakistani owner Pa Day (Auntie Day) adds salt to the flour that’s cooked to a crispy-chewy perfection in coconut oil. Choose from 20 flavours.

Name: Grim Nguan Noodle
FacilitiesAndServices: Cash only
Description: Opened in 1999, this eatery down a small Bangkok alley is something of a hidden gem. They specialise in fish ball noodle soup, which they have down to a fine art. The fish balls are fresh and provide good umami flavour, the noodles are nicely al dente and the broth is aromatic and flavoursome. Toppings such as cheese and poached egg are available, and the generous portions served with plenty of condiments enhance the already great value for money.

Name: Sae Phun
FacilitiesAndServices: Cash only
Description: Many places sell chicken stew with rice, but how many still have lines out the door after 80 years? This one, run by third-generation owners, does so by cooking the dish just like their grandpa did back in the day. Pair the juicy chicken and rich gravy with rice.

Name: Sawang Bami Kam Pu (Si Phraya)
FacilitiesAndServices: Cash only
Description: This is the place to enjoy top-quality crab noodles in Bangkok. The sweet, succulent giant crab claw flesh is perfectly paired with sticky egg noodles and shrimp dumplings. Be sure to try their famous noodles with extra soup and barbecued pork on the side. Premium quality and fresh ingredients.

Name: Hia Wan Khao Tom Pla
FacilitiesAndServices: Cash only
Description: Entirely focused on top-drawer seafood, this eatery offers a wide range of dishes. The soft-boiled rice with silver pomfret comes with a juicy fillet and fresh, clear soup. The baked mung bean noodles with prawns feature sticky mung bean noodles, underscored by a spicy-sour Thai seafood sauce.

Name: Pae Bronze Pot Porridge 38 Years
FacilitiesAndServices: Cash only
Description: 38 is actually the founder’s lucky number; the place itself has been around for considerably longer – since 1962 in fact. Three generations on, his family is still serving savoury congee boiled in its signature bronze pots – try it with oysters or minced pork and an egg.

Name: Guay Jub Ouan Pochana
FacilitiesAndServices: Cash only
Description: This cart has been serving Guay Jub (rolled rice noodle soup) for over 50 years and there is always a long line. The noodles are tender yet chewy, the broth is aromatic and peppery, and the pork belly is juicy and crispy.

Name: Here Hai
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,Cash only
Description: Good value, high quality seafood sent directly from Surat Thani is the draw here. Its prices may be considered high for street food, but portions are large and ingredients superb. Go for the fried rice with crabmeat and fried mantis with crispy garlic, both cooked with traditional technique and offer pleasant smoky aroma.

Name: Jay Oh
FacilitiesAndServices: Cash only
Description: Jay Oh might be known for her Mama Noodles Tom Yum, but her menu contains numerous other top-notch dishes. Many, including her delicious fried tofu with crispy garlic, boiled rice with duck, and signature crispy pork, are popular Thai favourites. Though the staff only speaks Thai, there’s an English picture menu for non-Thai speakers. Outside the shop, an eager crowd waits up to two hours for tables; to get in faster, arrive just before opening or near closing.

Name: Lim Lao Ngow (China Town)
FacilitiesAndServices: Cash only
Description: After 60 years in business, the family boasts multiple branches, but the original, in Chinatown, is our pick. The bouncy fish ball concept definitely lives up to its name. Made from fresh fish and no flour, they’re served with Chinese noodles and wontons, and leave a joyful aftertaste.

Name: Guay Jub Mr. Jo
FacilitiesAndServices: Cash only
Description: From early morning until late afternoon, locals flock to the small room at the front and large dining area at the rear. Enjoy guay jub as an entrée or in a sweet, peppery rice noodle broth; rich layers of soft pork are encased in a crispy skin. Can be ordered with or without pork offal.

Name: Lai Ros (Rama 6)
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,Car park,Cash only,Wheelchair access
Description: This small glasshouse is best known for its authentic royal Thai recipes and summer menu, including the carefully prepared Khao Chae or rice soaked in flower-infused water with 6 condiments. The good news is that this dish can be enjoyed year round! For coconut milk lovers, try the Kung Tom Ka Thi or coconut soup with prawns and cha om leaves; Khao Mao Nam Ka Thi or crispy green rice with coconut milk syrup is a perfect end to your meal.

Name: Tung Sui Heng Pochana (Stadium One)
FacilitiesAndServices: Cash only
Description: This iconic family-run shop has been packed with locals for more than 50 years. These days, the family’s second generation runs it, but the founder’s talent for cooking dishes like the signature claypot stewed duck with intestines, blood jelly, and feet clearly runs in the family.

Name: SP Chicken
FacilitiesAndServices: Cash only
Description: The sight of passers-by standing trance-like at the front, mesmerised by the plump birds slowly spinning on their vertical spits, is common at this authentic Isan eatery in Old Town Chiang Mai. Though other Isan classics are on offer, the aromatic and impossibly juicy rotisserie chicken is the jewel in the crown here.

Name: Yoong Khao Hom (Pathum Wan)
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,Car park,Credit card / Debit card accepted,JCB,Mastercard credit card,Visa credit card
Description: From its longstanding stall in Samui, to Bangkok in 2017, they’ve reimagined their authentic southern cuisine, with Chef Aom Sujira at the helm. The meat of the charcoaled pork ribs falls away from the bone. Its southern red curry paste boasts a delightful blend of sweet, turmeric, chilli and coconut. Meanwhile, the coconut dumpling in a coconut milk and shell has a lovely aroma of roasted white sesame seeds.

Name: Kai Yang Saeng Thai
FacilitiesAndServices: Cash only
Description: Since opening in 1967, they’ve marinated the rotisserie chicken with a peppery, herbal recipe. The farmed option is juicy and comes with a light crispy skin; the domestic-raised chicken has succulent tenderness. Enjoy it with the sweet chilli dipping sauces.

Name: Khanom Jeen Pradok Ban Kru Yod
FacilitiesAndServices: Credit card / Debit card accepted
Description: The former music teacher is an artist of many stripes. Artisanal souvenirs and musical instruments are on display at the entrance of this newly renovated shop. Their signature is a kanom jeen set with a choice of a range of curries. Chicken wing lovers should definitely order the deep-fried wings marinated in fish sauce and served with curry. If Kru Yod has time away from the kitchen, you may be treated to a rendition on one of his homemade instruments.

Name: Baan Pang Hom
FacilitiesAndServices: Car park,Cash only
Description: Named after the owner's mother, Ban Pang Hom has served Thai dishes with intense flavours for two decades. The open-air structure, wooden interior and greenery give it a rustic feel. Choose the snakehead or seabass and they’ll cook your fish in two halves. We recommend the deep-fried seabass with crunchy roasted peanuts. With half spicy sauce and half miang kam sauce, enjoy fiery Thai sensations before cooling off with a refreshing herbal Isan taste.

Name: Loukjaan by Saneh Jaan
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Car park,China UnionPay,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Diners Club credit card,JCB,Mastercard credit card,Terrace,Valet parking,Visa credit card
Description: The spacious yet homely Loukjaan is the elegantly decorated sister restaurant of Saneh Jaan. The open kitchen runs the length of one wall so guests can watch a hearty menu being lovingly prepared as if by their own grandmother. Try the dishes that are rare in Bangkok, like Mon-style red curry with grilled pork, or the toothsome deep-fried crispy shrimps with northern herbs and spices. Fermented pork lovers must order the stir-fried cowslip flowers with glass noodles and sour pork.

Name: Guay Tiew Mu Rung Rueang Tung
FacilitiesAndServices: Cash only
Description: Depending on your appetite, choose between a small or large portion of clear minced pork soup and perfectly flavoured tom yum broth. Each steaming bowl is topped with homemade fish balls and, if you so fancy, crispy fish skin. The minced pork balls are also a highlight.

Name: Watsana Khao Man Gai
FacilitiesAndServices: Cash only
Description: Despite several moves from its original location, this shophouse has kept its customers so expect queues for its famous chicken rice and the recent addition of noodles. Quality ingredients and consistent cooking are the secret of its success.

Name: Sa-at Sawoei (Kanchanapisek Road)
FacilitiesAndServices: Cash only
Description: Come here for fish balls and fish cakes that are soft and bouncy in texture and freshly made using a secret family recipe. Order them with a bowl of noodles in clear Tom Yam style soup or opt for fluffy fish noodles for an all-fish meal.

Name: Baan Pee Lek
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,Car park,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Visa credit card
Description: Step inside this Northern and Central Thai restaurant hidden on a side street in Prawet District and you enter a charming dining room adorned with an old-fashioned wooden European decor. Opening the menu reveals dishes, many of which are unavailable elsewhere, that honour the owners’ birthplaces, Chiang Mai and Bangkok. Highlights include stir-fried beef with Massaman curry served with a puffy croissant, Yum Luang Prabang and fried minced pork with salted mackerel.

Name: Tang Jai Yang
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Visa credit card
Description: Tang Jai Yang’s chef started cooking char siu, or Cantonese-style barbecue pork, for family and friends before selling it online. There, it went viral, so he opened this understated place. Since almost every dish on the menu contains the succulent pork, you can’t really go wrong.

Name: Ginger Farm Kitchen
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Car park,China UnionPay,Counter dining,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Diners Club credit card,Discover Card,JCB,Maestro,Mastercard credit card,Restaurant offering vegetarian menus,Visa credit card
Description: Rustically furnished and dotted by plants, this restaurant’s huge windows bring the outside in. It embraces a farm-to-table concept using organic and seasonal vegetables, along with free-range eggs and meats from its own farm and local artisans. Expect skilfully cooked classic northern Thai dishes from flavourful salads to aromatic northern Thai curry soups. Grilled organic aubergine salad is a standout. Booking is recommended; parking is limited.

Name: Chakki
FacilitiesAndServices: Cash only
Description: This family-run Cantonese shop has been on Rang Nam Road for 30 years. Chakki’s owner doesn’t believe in menus – everyone is here for their famous deep-fried wontons or deep-fried rice noodles and beef topped with gravy. Once these dishes sell out, the shop closes for the day.

Name: Somtum Khun Kan
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,Car park,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Terrace,Visa credit card
Description: Starting from a small shop in Mueang Thong Thani, and then winning a Som Tam (spicy papaya salad) competition in 1999, Khun Kan has earned his reputation through high quality dishes and great flavours. As well as the famous Som Tam, the menu offers a wide variety of mostly Isan dishes along with a few from other areas of Thailand. Try the juicy grilled pork shoulder with honey and herbs, followed by their signature sweet sticky rice with mango for dessert. Live music adds to the atmosphere on Friday-Sunday evenings.

Name: Baan Yai Phad Thai
FacilitiesAndServices: Cash only
Description: This is one of the best places for Phad Thai – piping hot noodles cooked to perfection, boldly flavoured and with a distinctive smokiness from the charcoal stove. Expect to wait in line. Come with a local since you have to write in Thai to make an order.

Name: Bunloet
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,Cash only
Description: Launched in 1977, this place specialises in egg noodles with grilled pork – the slices of succulent pork rump are marinated for four hours and grilled over charcoal. Other dishes are available; grilled pork with gravy and rice is also recommended.

Name: Krua Apsorn (Sam Sen)
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,Cash only
Description: This family-run stall is inevitably a hit with anyone who eats here, including patrons such as the Thai royal family. The simplicity of the exterior belies the gem of a Thai kitchen hidden inside. Some dishes are unique and feature the family's secret recipes. The stir-fried pork with bird's-eye chilli is tender and bursting with herbal aromas. The signature yellow curry with large prawns and crispy lotus root strikes the perfect blend of sour, spicy and sweet.

Name: Jidori Cuisine Ken
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Counter dining,Credit card / Debit card accepted,JCB,Mastercard credit card,Visa credit card
Description: Jidori roughly translates as ‘premium chicken’. In a friendly, welcoming atmosphere, the signature chicken skewer menu is available in 5, 8 or 10 courses. The chef masterfully uses a range of chicken parts to conjure up different flavours and textures and adds salt throughout the process which enhances the underlying smoky complexity. Save room for the homemade Japanese Ken custard – a decadent caramel dessert that manages to avoid the cloyingly sweet trap.

Name: The House by Ginger
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Car park,China UnionPay,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Diners Club credit card,JCB,Maestro,Mastercard credit card,Restaurant offering vegetarian menus,Terrace,Visa credit card
Description: Open for decades on the edge of the old city, this stylish and quirky spot serves a mixture of Northern Thai classics and those with a more modern twist. Premium ingredients like New Zealand beef are a feature, as are organic vegetables and daily picked herbs from their nearby Ginger Farm. The seasonally changing menu includes the Chiang Mai platter – an ideal way to sample an array of dishes. Pair your food with one of their many lovely cocktails and to extend your evening, continue on to the House Lounge next door.

Name: Elvis Suki (Soi Yotse)
FacilitiesAndServices: Cash only
Description: The king reigns supreme. Elvis Suki rules over local competition having dished up the same delicious recipes for 30 years. Seafood, beef or pork sukiyaki come in a secret eggy sauce with a smoky aroma. The grilled scallops, squid and cockles with spicy sauce are also delectable.

Name: Baan Phadthai
FacilitiesAndServices: Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Visa credit card
Description: This retro-styled restaurant elevates the Phad Thai conversation in Bangkok. The recommended Phad Thai Kung Mae Nam Yang features well-grilled whole river prawns, tasty rice noodles, and a flavoursome sauce, plus 18-20 ingredients that add texture and complexity. The signature dessert, Tub Tim Krob, pairs ruby water chestnuts with coconut juice granita, young coconut flesh, and candle-smoked coconut syrup.

Name: Lay Lao (Ari)
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,China UnionPay,Credit card / Debit card accepted,JCB,Mastercard credit card,Visa credit card
Description: Som Tam comes to the beach at this cosy Ari restaurant, where north-eastern style dishes are topped with the freshest seafood. Opened in 2014 by a family from Hua Hin, the place’s owners delight in offering guests the same food they serve family and friends. The result is fare that balances Isan flavours with seafood from Hua-Hin and Petchaburi, and beef from a notable farm. Fried squid with lay lao sauce is a standout, as is Luang Phra Bang green papaya salad.

Name: Ten Suns
FacilitiesAndServices: Cash only
Description: This popular old town stand sells legendary braised beef noodles soup, including the recommended braised mixed beef soup. The aromatic sweet and salty broth is packed with juicy slow-cooked cuts like cheek, tongue, tendon, shoulder, and shank. Also recommended is the Kobe beef.

Name: Khao Soi Lung Prakit Kad Kom
FacilitiesAndServices: Cash only
Description: Nicknamed "Khao Soi Netflix" after its appearance on the streaming platform, this place has been serving Northern Thai-style curry noodle soup for over 40 years. The star of the show is beef Khao Soi with creamy broth, tender beef, al dente noodles, and toppings both crunchy and delightfully sour.

Name: Somyos
FacilitiesAndServices: Car park,Cash only,Terrace
Description: For decades this place has been known in street-food packed Chok Chai 4 for its tangy Thai dishes with subtle Chinese influences. It also boasts warm service, friendly prices, and late hours, making it a night-owl haven. The ‘super chicken feet’ and shrimp with fish sauce are must-tries.

Name: Guay Jub Chang Moi Tat Mai
FacilitiesAndServices: Cash only
Description: This shophouse specialises in guay jub, a unique broth that radiates with joyful spices. Their peppery sausage is made with pork and eggs; there’s minimal fat on the enjoyable crispy pork; and the fresh Vietnamese sausage spring rolls are topped with omelette and a sweet peanut sauce.

Name: Sanpakoi Kanomjeen
FacilitiesAndServices: Cash only
Description: Both taste buds and wallets are satisfied at this Kanomjeen (fresh rice vermicelli) joint. Opened in 1977, it offers 5 curries to top its rice noodles: red with pork, spicy pork, original fish, bestselling red with beef and flavourful green with chicken. Prices start at 20 THB; side veggies are unlimited.

Name: Plu
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,Car park,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Terrace,Valet parking,Visa credit card
Description: The Water Library’s Plu offers outstanding food, a cosy ambience, and great service in an Art Deco-adorned colonial house. Among the beautifully presented authentic pan-Thailand dishes is the signature braised pork belly and soft-boiled eggs in five-spiced soup; the pork belly is tender and juicy, the deep-fried tofu absorbs the aromatic broth, and the soft-boiled eggs only enhance the flavour and texture. Start with one of the restaurant’s signature cocktails.

Name: Charoen Saeng Silom
FacilitiesAndServices: Cash only
Description: Stewed in a rich, aromatic gravy with Chinese herbs, the soft, caramelised pork tantalises the tastebuds, and is a Bangkok favourite. The recipe, created by the owner’s grandfather in 1959, was adapted by her father. It’s served with a homemade spicy sauce and pickles and is great value.

Name: The Local
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,Car park,China UnionPay,Credit card / Debit card accepted,JCB,Mastercard credit card,Terrace,Visa credit card
Description: This colonial-style building provides an elegant contrast with the skyscrapers of Bangkok. Its private dining rooms ooze old world charm, while the main restaurant has thick wicker chairs and artful murals. The secret family recipes pay homage to the diversity offered by Thailand’s regions. We recommend the deep-fried seabass: deboned and served in large slices with an intense sweet and sour sauce. The assortment of desserts with homemade ice-cream makes for a refreshing finish.

Name: Beer Hima (Prachachuen)
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,Car park,China UnionPay,Credit card / Debit card accepted,JCB,Mastercard credit card,Visa credit card
Description: Despite its quirky name and simple interior, Beer Hima offers so much more. The family’s seafood recipes from Nakhon Si Thammarat province are loaded with flavour. The southern Thai sour curry with grouper is packed with turmeric and chilli and delivers the perfect harmony of sour and spicy, while the rich, aromatic shrimp paste in the stir-fried prawns with bitter beans awakens the senses. There’s ample parking and a private room large enough for 30 guests.

Name: Khao Soi Mae Manee
FacilitiesAndServices: Cash only
Description: Khao Soi is one of the best-known dishes of northern Thai cuisine, and the version they serve at this long-standing, family-run shop is a real winner. Like the other options on the menu, the Khao Soi features quality ingredients and house-made noodles. There are multiple toppings available – with the beef version proving particularly flavoursome – and it’s accompanied by generous sides.

Name: Choy (Phuttha Monthon Sai 2)
FacilitiesAndServices: Car park,Cash only
Description: A little out of the way but this is one of the best kept secrets for roast duck with egg noodles. Try the signature duck noodles with shrimp wonton in Tom Yam soup. Choy is named after the owner; the duck recipe came from his father.

Name: Magnolia Café
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,China UnionPay,Credit card / Debit card accepted,JCB,Mastercard credit card,Visa credit card
Description: With just four large communal tables, Magnolia is a simple, cosy spot enlivened by bold colours, vintage décor, and chandeliers. Their à la carte menu offers tasty, well presented fare from across Thailand. Dishes are distinguished by vivid, gutsy flavours; fried sun-dried squid with peanut sauce and fresh watermelon with desiccated salmon are exemplars. In lieu of a dessert menu, they serve lovely complimentary pandan pudding. Do visit their wine shop next door.

Name: Sri Trat
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,China UnionPay,Credit card / Debit card accepted,JCB,Mastercard credit card,Valet parking,Visa credit card,Wheelchair access
Description: If you’ve been to the coastal province of Trat on the border of Cambodia, you’ll doubtless recall its fiery seafood and curries. At Sri Trat, the owners bring the province’s famed cuisine to Bangkok via their mother’s favourite recipes. They also honour her, not only with a funky mural, but also by expertly crafting eastern dishes like savoury stir-fried tiger prawn with garlic, chilli, and fish sauce and spicy sea bass soup with salacca and shrimp paste.

Name: Baan Landai
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,Credit card / Debit card accepted,JCB,Mastercard credit card,Restaurant offering vegetarian menus,Terrace,Visa credit card
Description: Don’t let the slightly unkempt exterior keep you from visiting Chef Landai’s eponymous restaurant, where he practises the craft he learned from his mother. The interior exudes charm with its eclectic adornments and window to the kitchen where chefs whip up pan-Thai dishes like flavourful pork ribs with red wine sauce (plus several veggie offerings). Pair with flower tea, mocktails, or cocktails, and finish with mung bean marzipan and egg yolk in coconut milk.

Name: S.B.L.
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,Car park,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Visa credit card
Description: Open since 1954, this Chinese restaurant is currently run by a second-generation family member who is keen to make every aspect of the dining experience pleasurable. The menu features mostly traditional Chinese fare with a few creations that show novel twists. The X.O. scallops are a must-try, as is the expertly-steamed snow fish with soya sauce. Quality ingredients handled with skill and experience is the formula that guarantees a good meal here.

Name: Saiyud and Doctor Sai Kitchen
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,Car park,Credit card / Debit card accepted,JCB,Mastercard credit card,Visa credit card
Description: Since 2004, Doctor Sai has been serving pan-Thai dishes, including royal fare, following recipes from her mother, Saiyud, a former cooking instructor, in a setting reminiscent of dining at home. Start with an elegant appetiser like fried prawns and peanuts in an egg net, flower dumplings, or deep-fried pork wrapped in egg noodles. By dessert – try the sweet potato in syrup – you’ll guess this home, with its warm service, belongs to a royal from a bygone era.

Name: Meena Rice Based Cuisine
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,Car park,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Restaurant offering vegetarian menus,Terrace,Visa credit card
Description: Don’t be alarmed when you pass through a rice field driving here, as this hidden gem is worth it. As its name suggests, this alfresco restaurant specialises in rice, alongside new spins on Thai classics. Most are garnished with fruits and edible flowers, giving them bursts of colour. Along with the five-colour rice balls, northern-style spicy minced fish salad is a delight. Vegans will enjoy their many options, including the spicy stir-fried eryngii mushrooms.

Name: Baannai
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,Car park,China UnionPay,Credit card / Debit card accepted,JCB,Mastercard credit card,Terrace,Valet parking,Visa credit card
