Description: Baan Nai, or ‘inner house’ in Thai, is so called because the owner’s great grandfather built it on the innermost part of his land. The house, and recipes cooked by its occupants, have passed down through the family to the present day where, as a boutique hotel and homely restaurant, it serves delicious time-tested dishes like Taengmo Pla Haeng (watermelon with dried fish flakes) and Khanom Pra Paii (sweet mung bean dumplings). Booking is required.

Name: Alma
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Diners Club credit card,Mastercard credit card,Visa credit card
Description: If you’re keen to experience contemporary cuisine, Alma offers a treat for all the senses.Behind its stone façade, this restaurant is teeming with personality. It occupies a 18C building that served as a warehouse for the famous Bertrand bookshop which first opened in 1732 and is recognised as being the world’s oldest. In its contemporary interior full of marked decorative contrasts, choose between a seasonal à la carte and two tasting menus (“Alma”, featuring the chef’s signature dishes, and the maritime-inspired “Costa a Costa”). Their dishes offer a culinary journey with traditional, Mediterranean and international touches and a technical skill that brings out the best flavours and showcases local ingredients. A restaurant that is best enjoyed in unhurried fashion!

Name: Belcanto
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Diners Club credit card,Interesting wine list,Mastercard credit card,Visa credit card,Wheelchair access
Description: Belcanto boasts a superb location in the Bairro Alto (Chiado) district popular with tourists, on a corner close to a former convent damaged by the large earthquake that devastated the city in 1755.In his culinary empire’s showcase restaurant, chef José Avillez offers a modern à la carte and two extensive set menus (Evolução and Belcanto) offering a journey of gastronomic discovery in a dining room divided into different spaces, alongside a chef’s table in the kitchen. José Avillez’s dishes are influenced by Lisbon’s different light, its maritime shoreline and its distinct districts: in the words of this celebrated chef, “cooking is our very own fado, and our own form of expression”. Interestingly, the napkin provided for dessert is in the shape of a sleeve, recalling the way the chef once wiped his mouth on his sleeve as a child!

Name: Encanto
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Restaurant offering vegetarian menus,Visa credit card
Description: On the Portuguese culinary scene, chef José Avillez is one of those figures who is constantly raising his already legendary profile through his work in the kitchen and his desire to diversify the cuisine on offer in his restaurants. This small yet welcoming eatery, located next to his award-winning Belcanto, will surprise guests with its contemporary aesthetic (note the designer bookcases on each wall connected to each other via the ceiling) and a culinary approach which features a touch of creativity. In no way does its complete focus on vegetables prevent it from conjuring up dishes that abound in nuance, flavour and technique. The single 100% vegetarian tasting menu is well supported by a wine list of biodynamic labels, craft beers, kombuchas etc.

Name: Kanazawa
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,Counter dining,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Diners Club credit card,Mastercard credit card,Restaurant offering vegetarian menus,Visa credit card
Description: Named after the chef who opened this restaurant and also the capital of the Ishikawa region, Kanazawa offers a glimpse into a different culinary world.Its traditional Kaiseki cuisine, which became recognised as one of the most refined in Japan after it had been served by the imperial court and featured in traditional tea ceremonies, will delight guests in this tiny, minimalist-style eatery with just a single counter for eight diners, where chef Paulo Morais creates his superb cuisine, explaining each dish in detail. He offers several menus which adhere to the Kaiseki philosophy, albeit with a more liberal approach, but always respecting its true essence, with his dishes taking on a more elaborate and gastronomic feel in the evening. The quality of his fish and nigiris is truly spectacular!

Name: Loco
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Visa credit card
Description: Located just a few steps from the Basílica da Estrela, Loco is full of surprises as soon as you step through the door, thanks to the tree hanging from the ceiling of the entrance hall – a sensation that continues in the dining room with its abundance of designer features, barely half a dozen bare tables and an open kitchen that enables guests to feel part of the cooking experience, enhanced by the chefs themselves serving some of the dishes. Head chef Alexandre Silva’s culinary skills, incorporated into a single 16-course tasting menu, highlight the provenance of his seasonal ingredients (organic and sourced from local producers where possible); he also prioritises the use of organic wines and gives plenty of prominence to the accompanying breads.Interestingly, Silva has a high media profile, having won the first edition of Portugal’s Top Chef competition in 2012.

Name: Fifty Seconds
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Diners Club credit card,Great view,Interesting wine list,Mastercard credit card,Visa credit card
Description: If you’ve never eaten lunch or dinner 120m above ground, you might want to enjoy the experience in this superb restaurant in the famous Vasco da Gama tower that dominates Lisbon’s skyline, with its impressive views of the city, the Tagus, and even the magical Troia peninsula.Here, discover innovative and modern Mediterranean cuisine with its own identity, under the baton of award-winning Spanish chef Martín Berasategui. Take your pick between à la carte dishes and two menus based around the region’s finest ingredients, all of which are prepared with the greatest delicacy and contemporary techniques. The unusual, highly elegant circular dining space is completely glass-fronted and accessible via a panoramic lift that takes exactly 50 seconds, hence the name of the restaurant.

Name: Euskalduna Studio
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,Counter dining,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Visa credit card
Description: This restaurant in the lower section of the city is very popular with gourmet food-lovers, hence the difficulty in booking a table! After ringing the bell to gain access, you’ll enter an intimate space with its own distinct character in the style of a typical Japanese bar known as an “izakaya”, with a counter in front of the kitchen where every dish is prepared. The tasting menu is one that will definitely leave a lasting impression, showcasing chef Vasco Coelho Santos’s passion for different world cuisines. His consistent approach to cooking sees him toying with flavours to their very limit, enabling him to cook on the grill, age fish, and add a touch of smokiness, alongside interesting seasonings such as herbs with a hint of spiciness. He often incorporates a surprise dish on his menu.

Name: Pedro Lemos
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Diners Club credit card,Interesting wine list,Mastercard credit card,Restaurant offering vegetarian menus,Terrace,Visa credit card
Description: An interesting choice both in terms of its cuisine and its location in Foz do Douro, where the waters of the Douro meet those of the Atlantic.The attractive building, part of the city’s architectural heritage, is split between two levels, with one on the charming ground floor (home to the wine cellar), and the other, the main dining room (with a more cosmopolitan feel), upstairs. Pedro Lemos concentrates his cuisine on three tasting menus (one of which is vegetarian), all of which feature elaborate dishes that highlight the freshness of ingredients from the local area and, more generally, from other regions around the country. We highly recommend hailing a taxi to get here as the restaurant is situated in an historic district of the city with narrow streets where parking is difficult.

Name: Kabuki Lisboa
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Counter dining,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Notable sake list,Visa credit card
Description: Located in the renowned Galerias Ritz at the Four Seasons Hotel Ritz Lisbon, Kabuki Lisboa was the first of the group’s ventures outside Spain. This is a far from ordinary restaurant given the strong relationship that the Portuguese have always had with the sea and the historical fact that they were the first Europeans to establish contact with Japan. Its elegant dining rooms, laid out over three floors with a contemporary design, offer several dining options: a bar for cocktails, digestifs and a business-style menu; a main room (on the floor below) featuring a sushi bar serving sashimi, usuzukuri, nigiris, makis etc; and a bright space on the top floor where guests can order a menu (lunch only) dedicated to a different ingredient each day. Japanese-Mediterranean cuisine based around the very best Portuguese ingredients.

Name: Feitoria
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Car park,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Diners Club credit card,Interesting wine list,Mastercard credit card,Restaurant offering vegetarian menus,Terrace,Visa credit card,Wheelchair access
Description: For many, Feitoria is a compulsory stop for visitors to the Portuguese capital, combining an intrinsic elegance with polished service and cuisine that is constantly evolving.It boasts an attractive reception space plus a dining room with a classic yet modern feel. The creative contemporary cuisine has its roots in tradition and pays full attention to flavours and perfect cooking techniques, hence a dining experience that showcases complicated presentation and skill. The ingredients used here are of a remarkable standard, hence the willingness to showcase these and explain their provenance in detail. The Semente tasting menu has a particular focus on vegetable proteins and is available in two formats (6 or 8 courses). A vegetarian version is also available.

Name: Antiqvvm
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Car park,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Restaurant offering vegetarian menus,Terrace,Visa credit card
Description: There are places in the world that, because of their location, exert a special power of attraction and this is definitely the case with Antiqvvm, situated in a leafy park in the centre of Porto, next to the Museu Romântico – a sensation enhanced by its pristine garden boasting idyllic views of the banks of the Douro!In its elegant dining rooms, tastefully embellished with classic and contemporary decorative detail, chef Vítor Matos has a penchant for seasonal cuisine that places huge emphasis on his source ingredients, combining these in a way that aims to enhance the main component of each dish. In his own words, the chef “is always striving to promote the values of cuisine that is cultural, natural, evolving, social and artistic”.

Name: CURA
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,Car park,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Interesting wine list,Mastercard credit card,Restaurant offering vegetarian menus,Visa credit card,Wheelchair access
Description: This elegant and contemporary restaurant, with a separate entrance from the hotel and an open-view kitchen, is the gourmet dining space in the renovated Hotel Four Seasons Hotel Ritz Lisboa and is the perfect setting for an experience that will linger long in the memory.Taking its name from the word “curadoria” (or “curatorship” as in an artistic sense), it provides the backdrop for chef Pedro Pena who, along with his staff, adds a bright personal touch to his contemporary haute cuisine, yet with an apparent simplicity that involves using few, and mainly local and seasonal, ingredients. Guests can choose between three highly interesting tasting menus: Meia Cura, Origens, and the vegetarian Raízes.

Name: Le Monument
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Interesting wine list,Mastercard credit card,Visa credit card
Description: If a high-flying culinary adventure sounds appealing, Le Monument offers the perfect opportunity – to the luxurious backdrop of Le Monumental Palace hotel.French chef Julien Montbabut, a recipient of a Michelin star in Paris, adopts a different take here, taking guests on a gastronomic journey through the different regions of Portugal. He rekindles classic recipes from each area, albeit with a more innovative approach that is based around modern cuisine, but which pays homage to native ingredients and respect for flavour. The dining experience is limited to a single tasting menu (choose between a short or long version), and is accompanied by a booklet that provides an explanation of each dish and a map that offers a visual introduction to the region that inspired it.

Name: Vila Foz
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Car park,Counter dining,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Restaurant offering vegetarian menus,Visa credit card
Description: A restaurant full of surprises, occupying what was once the luxurious main hall of the Vila Foz hotel &spa, a 19C mansion overlooking the Praia do Homem do Leme.Here, to a backdrop of elegant mouldings, period gilded work and mirrors that take their inspiration from the finest palaces, discover the gourmet cuisine of chef Arnaldo Azevedo, who showcases contemporary cuisine that extols the full flavour of wonderful Portuguese fish and seafood on his menus (Novo Mundo and Maresia). An unusual feature here is a counter (formerly the bar) facing the kitchen which offers a much more personal, close-up and intense option called the Kitchen Seat, reserved exclusively for just two guests and an experience that is heightened by interaction with the chef!

Name: EPUR
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Visa credit card
Description: A culinary enclave well worth considering in the historic Chiado district on one of Lisbon’s famous hills. Here, behind the robust façade of an old building, you’ll find an informal, pleasantly modernised interior that includes an open-view kitchen and dining rooms lit in a contemporary, minimalist fashion, geometrically shaped ceilings and azulejo panels which are a silent testament to the past but which add appropriate character and personality. Not forgetting the impressive views of the Tagus!The creative cooking here boasts a traditional and international outlook, and is extremely visual, yet at the same time elegant, pure and with a strong focus on vegetables. French chef Vincent Farges focuses on the essentials to elevate the dining experience, offering a single surprise tasting menu, the price of which varies according to the number of courses (4, 6 or 8).

Name: Eneko Lisboa
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Visa credit card
Description: A splendid restaurant, both in terms of the elegant cuisine of Spanish chef Eneko Atxa and the setting, occupying a former industrial building that was home for many years to the legendary Alcântara Café.The originality of its spacious dining rooms, replete with impressive iron beams and rivets, has enabled the creation of two distinct spaces: the informal “Basque”, serving simple cuisine with its roots in that region; and the emblematic Eneko Lisboa, which aims to bring the superb flavours honed by the chef in Larrabetzu, to the Portuguese capital. Choose between two tasting menus (Erroak and Adarrak) that are entirely based on dishes from the award-winning three-Michelin-star Azurmendi restaurant and that reproduce their aromas and textures to a very high level.

Name: 100 Maneiras
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Visa credit card
Description: The concept behind 100 Maneiras is one of absolute freedom – a freedom not to follow rules or pre-conceived ideas that restrict one’s personality or creativity.Everything here revolves around chef Ljubomir Stanisic, a native of Sarajevo (Bosnia-Herzegovina), who arrived in Portugal in his late-teens following the war in his country, healing the wounds of his soul by devoting himself to cooking. The three tasting menus here (A História, O Conto, and Ecos do 100) are based around innovative cuisine with a constant nod to his origins, although influences from his adopted homeland and further afield are also evident. His more traditional starters and desserts also have an interesting twist given that he used to make these with his mother!

Name: Eleven
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Car park,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Diners Club credit card,Great view,Interesting wine list,Mastercard credit card,Restaurant offering vegetarian menus,Visa credit card,Wheelchair access
Description: The name Eleven refers to the eleven friends, one a chef, who embarked upon this business venture in a unique space with a minimalist look in the upper section of the Amália Rodrigues gardens, with stunning views of the Eduardo VII park. German chef Joachim Koerper, who has vast international experience behind him, serves Mediterranean-inspired cuisine with a meticulous and creative touch, based around locally sourced seasonal ingredients. His culinary focus is built around three menus: one dedicated to the “50-year career of Joachim Koerper”; a second more contemporary offering simply called “Onze”; and a third, “Lavagante Azul”, which showcases the blue lobster after which it is named.

Name: Zunzum Gastrobar
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Terrace,Visa credit card
Description: This elegant, completely glass-fronted gastro-bar, occupying a modern building close to the city’s cruise ship terminal (and opposite the unusual Museu do Lactário or Milk Station Museum), favours high-quality contemporary cuisine that is based around traditional Portuguese recipes, but without closing the door on inspiration, dishes or techniques from further afield. The bright, designer-inspired interior, with its predominant red and white colour scheme, and the terrace boasting pleasant views of the Tagus come as a pleasant surprise.

Name: Oficio
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Terrace,Visa credit card
Description: This centrally located restaurant, almost directly opposite the Bairro do Avillez gastronomic complex, defines itself as an "atypical tasco ", where the concept is to offer contemporary Portuguese cuisine perfect for sharing, served in the informal atmosphere of a typical neighbourhood restaurant. Here, you’ll find starters, petiscos, hot specialities, sharing boards and seasonal dishes on the menu, all of which showcase excellent technique, typical flavours and the occasional Mexican touch, given that the chef worked in the famous (and now defunct) Hoja Santa restaurant in Barcelona.

Name: Gruta
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Visa credit card
Description: Gruta’s is one of those of places where you can eat well at a reasonable price. To a backdrop of stylish yet informal decor and a setting in an alleyway just off a shopping street, chef Rafaela Louzada, a Carioca from Rio but with Portuguese roots, focuses on a concise menu on which fish and seafood (mainly from the north of the country) take centre stage. Her dishes are high on presentation and flavour, combining Brazilian and Portuguese influences and a contemporary style of cooking.

Name: Solar dos Nunes
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Valet parking,Visa credit card
Description: One of those not-to-be-missed family-run restaurants with lots of character. Having opened its doors in 1988, it continues to offer the same friendly and professional service, delighting guests’ palates with the finest Alentejo dishes and flavours such as Alentejo-style partridge escabeche and “grandmother’s” dogfish soup. It is impressively run by the owner who offers an extensive and traditional à la carte featuring plenty of daily specials and, somewhat surprisingly, a good selection of Spanish hams, including Jamón Ibérico Joselito Gran Reserva. A small terrace at the entrance completes the picture.

Name: Carnal
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Diners Club credit card,Mastercard credit card,Visa credit card
Description: This lively, centrally located restaurant has quickly become fashionable given that it is owned by famous chef Ljubomir Stanisic (head of the 100 Maneiras group). Carnal describes itself as a Mexican gastro-bar, and is one of those places that immediately appeals to the senses. In its informal, modern design setting featuring subtle details relating to Mexican culture, enjoy harmonious, well-thought-out cooking with a perfect balance between flavour and spiciness in every one of its superb dishes. Don’t miss the delicious pork tacos or the tacos with fried cauliflower.

Name: Semea by Euskalduna
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Terrace,Visa credit card
Description: This restaurant has improved in every respect following its move to the banks of the Douro – it has gained space, consolidated its culinary philosophy, and now boasts the added benefit of views of the river. The cuisine here, which includes rice dishes cooked in a wood-fired oven, is based around the grill and open fire, using local seasonal ingredients to create dishes that, although uncomplicated, are full of flavour and feature a strong focus on presentation. The restaurant’s other attractions include the delightful panoramic terrace on the first floor.

Name: O Frade
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Counter dining,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Terrace,Visa credit card
Description: A small corner restaurant named after the family that owns it. Its interior is evocative of a traditional Alentejo “tasca”, with simple decorative details that highlight the production of the famous “vinho da talha”, a wine with a long historical footprint that, in keeping with Roman tradition, is made in large earthenware amphorae and is a highly renowned wine in the Alentejo. Welcoming service, plus an attractive U-shaped bar popular for dining, where guests can savour a variety of “petiscos”, rice dishes and traditional Alentejo recipes with a contemporary touch – all accompanied by an extensive choice of wines.

Name: Arkhe
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Restaurant offering vegetarian menus,Visa credit card
Description: This restaurant, which takes its name from Ancient Greek (meaning “beginning” or “origin”), features a modern-minimalist look and is run by Portuguese-Brazilian chef João Ricardo Alves who, having spent time working halfway round the world (Switzerland, France, England, Italy etc), decided to return to his family’s homeland. He is accompanied by Alejandro Chávarro, another experienced professional who is Arkhe’s sommelier and front-of-house manager. The vegan- and vegetarian-inspired cuisine on offer here is based around the best local and seasonal ingredients and always results in an interesting harmony of flavours.

Name: In Diferente
FacilitiesAndServices: Credit card / Debit card accepted,Diners Club credit card,Mastercard credit card,Visa credit card
Description: Despite not being in the centre of town or on any of the main tourist routes, it is well worth heading to this peaceful, welcoming and contemporary-style restaurant. Here, Angélica Salvador, the young chef of Brazilian origin, interprets her personal vision of traditional Portuguese and international cooking through dishes that are elaborate and very well presented. Her aim is to create dishes that are different, personal and showcase innovative detail, extracting maximum benefit from the superb fish delivered to the nearby auctions in Matosinhos and Aveiro, as well as from the region’s outstanding meats.

Name: TURK FATİH TUTAK
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Counter dining,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Diners Club credit card,Interesting wine list,Mastercard credit card,Restaurant offering vegetarian menus,Visa credit card,Wheelchair access
Description: Here, Fatih Tutak expresses his love for his Turkish terroir, showcasing ingredients from the region and produce from local traders on a daily basis. This is a chef who cooks with respect for tradition and what nature has to offer. His predilection for sustainability is reflected, among other ways, in his zero-waste approach and his use of preservation techniques such as fermentation and dry-ageing.Familiar flavours take on an extra dimension at Turk. Age-old traditions are adapted here to the spirit of the times.Part of his originality lies in his nuanced use of delicate acidity and smoky flavours. Think grilled lamb with a sumptuous fermented vegetable jus or confit mackerel with the tang of kaffir lime. He makes his börek with thin slices of poached artichoke, an onion cream, salty cheese and caviar. This extraordinary symphony is enhanced by a coulis of pulses, the finest olive oil and an intense balsamic vinegar. The exuberance of bold flavours is this chef's trademark.When it's time for dessert, he invites you into the open kitchen of this chic, contemporary establishment. Here, in the thick of the action, you can admire the cooks working their magic! It is the perfect ending to the inspiring story Fatih Tutak tells with his cuisine.

Name: Araka
FacilitiesAndServices: American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Restaurant offering vegetarian menus,Terrace,Visa credit card
Description: Here you’ll find it's easy to forget you're in the metropolis of Istanbul. You’re actually in the Yeniköy district, in the north of the city, just beyond the exclusive marina you pass on the way (taking the Bosphorus ferry over is a must). Behind its charming façade, this rural-style restaurant awaits with its cosy, romantic interior and a terrace to the rear where you feel cut off from the world. This enchanting spot perfectly suits Zeynep Pınar Taşdemir's highly individual style.Seasonal ingredients are showcased on the menu. The young chef likes to express her creativity with vegetables and herbs. Pumpkin puree is imbued with the potent freshness of za'atar and combined with pickled vegetables and warm olives in a spicy sauce. A robust dish that is full of character and pleasingly harmonious thanks to its subtle acidity. This chef is adept at balancing spicy, savoury flavours with tangy aromas. She creates exciting dishes that let the regional produce do the talking.

Name: Neolokal
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Great view,Interesting wine list,Mastercard credit card,Restaurant offering vegetarian menus,Terrace,Visa credit card
Description: Maksut Aşkar and his young team preserve their culinary heritage and guide it into the future with their exciting cuisine. This also involves an emphasis on sustainability, as in the rigorous selection of local produce (including the fine Turkish wines) and the proximity of suppliers.Chef Aşkar puts his stamp on authentic recipes with a subtlety that is all of his own. Imagine a finely spiced 'cupcake' made of bulgur and a tasty chicken preparation, accompanied by a rich cream velouté and a full-bodied chicken demi-glace, topped with a potato crisp.The location of the restaurant, in the Salt Galata, makes your experience all the more memorable. The large windows and fabulous terrace afford superb views of Istanbul's rooftops and beautiful mosques.

Name: Mikla
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Great view,Interesting wine list,Mastercard credit card,Restaurant offering vegetarian menus,Terrace,Visa credit card
Description: Mehmet Gürs' New Anatolian Kitchen combines respect for tradition with a sense of innovation. Among other things, he emphasises the importance of craftsmanship and the diversity of produce that Turkey has to offer. He works with the finest ingredients and gives them pride of place in original dishes that are stripped of unnecessary fuss.Everything here revolves around the depth of the flavours.A lightly boiled and then grilled octopus tentacle, for example, is enhanced by the addition of a slightly sweet lacquer; a pickled green bean salad with purslane and apple vinaigrette provides a pleasant tanginess; add an intense vegetable gravy and dried fish eggs and you have a fascinating creation that grabs your attention with every bite. And those who avoid meat will be glad to know that the chef always offers a vegan menu. An adventure awaits you here and that also goes for the setting – the magnificent 360° view of Istanbul you get from the eighteenth floor of the Marmara Pera hotel really is the icing on the cake.

Name: Nicole
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Great view,Mastercard credit card,Restaurant offering vegetarian menus,Visa credit card
Description: The chef revamps traditional recipes, adding delicate nuances. Take, for example, the dolma, a typical dish of stuffed vegetables, to which smoked yoghurt is added to put a novel spin on the familiar flavours. Then there are the Middle Eastern spices that give an extra dimension to the classic, intensely reduced red wine jus served alongside the butter-soft lamb. Here, creativity is deployed with respect and a sense of purpose.

Name: Tershane
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Restaurant offering vegetarian menus,Visa credit card
Description: Fancy experiencing the contemporary version of Istanbul? Then head to the eighth floor of Hotel Momento. Its large windows afford views of the city's historic skyline, and the sexy decor shimmers around you. Everything here revolves around mezze, kebabs and grilled lamb. Thanks to the open kitchen, you can see before your very eyes how these taste sensations are expertly prepared. Generous, spicy, creamy, robust: a true Turkish feast.

Name: Pandeli
FacilitiesAndServices: American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Restaurant offering vegetarian menus,Visa credit card
Description: Take the stairs to the first floor above the Egyptian bazaar and marvel at the characteristically Turkish decor with its blue mosaics on the walls and historical cachet. The chef resolutely sticks to traditional Turkish dishes: think grilled aubergine salad, wood-fired spicy chicken, roast lamb with rice, to name but a few. A firm favourite!

Name: Aman da Bravo
FacilitiesAndServices: American Express credit card,Car park,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Terrace,Visa credit card
Description: The laid-back, upscale vibe and trendy terrace give Aman da Bravo a certain Côte d'Azur feel. Come here to escape the hustle and bustle of the city and discover the Turkish version of modern ‘bistronomy’. Premium, locally sourced produce is given pride of place. Just a few choice ingredients suffice to bring robust tastes to your plate. The chefs draw on international flavours to enhance this hip culinary experience.

Name: SADE Beş Denizler Mutfağı
FacilitiesAndServices: American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Restaurant offering vegetarian menus,Terrace,Visa credit card
Description: The never-ending hustle and bustle of the lively Nişantaşı neighbourhood is what characterises this cosy establishment. Locals and international diners come here for either a quick bite or a substantial dinner with friends. Genuine Turkish hospitality and great value for money are the biggest draws of SADE Beş Denizler Mutfağı. Anatolian delicacies such as spicy beef tongue salad with chilli and manti (Turkish ravioli) served with potato, kokoretsi meat and yoghurt are celebrated here with the generosity you would expect. No fuss, just rich flavours you won't be able to get enough of.

Name: Calipso Fish
FacilitiesAndServices: American Express credit card,Car park,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Diners Club credit card,Mastercard credit card,Restaurant offering vegetarian menus,Terrace,Valet parking,Visa credit card
Description: Istanbul residents come to this sun-drenched restaurant to escape the hustle and bustle of the city. The waiters give expert advice on the wide selection of mezze in the display fridge – the salads are beautifully fragrant! And that's just the beginning, because the traditional preparation methods accentuate the rich flavours of super fresh fish and seafood shellfish.

Name: Giritli
FacilitiesAndServices: American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Diners Club credit card,Mastercard credit card,Restaurant offering vegetarian menus,Terrace,Visa credit card
Description: In summer, Giritli welcomes you to its atmospheric terrace, where the kitchen is also located. If the weather lets you down, you can always cross the street to the Mediterranean-style restaurant. Be sure to try the enticing mezze menu (drinks included), which inventively showcases traditional flavours. Fresh produce, seasoned to perfection, is generously proportioned... a real feast!

Name: Aheste
FacilitiesAndServices: American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Restaurant offering vegetarian menus,Visa credit card
Description: Leave the Pera district behind as you step into this trendy bistro, then head to the romantic dining space under the vaults. This restaurant has plenty of character and will immediately win you over with its modern take on mezze. On the menu are Turkish specialities, including grilled lamb heart, and in-vogue (also vegetarian) options, such as an original creation based on four preparations of rice.

Name: Karaköy Lokantası
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Restaurant offering vegetarian menus,Terrace,Visa credit card
Description: Beautifully light hummus and tzatziki, crispy dumplings with yoghurt sauce, lamb börek... With a selection of 80 mezze, a whole host of sharing platters and other traditional dishes, you're spoilt for choice. This is understandably a popular place, where the quiet terrace and sea blue tiled wall are a feast for the eyes. Delicious food and great value for money!

Name: Cuma
FacilitiesAndServices: American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Restaurant offering vegetarian menus,Terrace,Visa credit card
Description: A stroll through the trendy Çukurcuma district, famous for its antique shops, should certainly include a visit to Cuma. At this cosy establishment with a fabulous terrace at the front you can enjoy both a traditional Turkish breakfast and a Mediterranean-inspired lunch or dinner. Seasonal produce is shown off to its best advantage in tapas such as sea bass ceviche, in richly garnished pizzettas, tasty pasta dishes etc. Everyone is sure to find something to their liking here, and it’s all very good value.

Name: Alaf
FacilitiesAndServices: American Express credit card,Counter dining,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Great view,Mastercard credit card,Restaurant offering vegetarian menus,Terrace,Visa credit card
Description: Alaf is a vibrant restaurant with a great cocktail bar on the roof terrace. Chef Deniz cooks up cuisine with various influences: sometimes it is inspired by the Yörük, sometimes it is Anatolian, the list goes on. Courtesy of the wood-fired oven he enthusiastically melds authenticity with modern techniques. A diverse journey of discovery for your taste buds!

Name: Delta
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Diners Club credit card,Great view,Interesting wine list,Mastercard credit card,Restaurant offering vegetarian menus,Visa credit card,Wheelchair access
Description: Delta is located inside the Stavros Niarchos Foundation Cultural Centre (SNFCC), an avant-garde complex that also houses the National Library of Greece and the Greek National Opera. This restaurant, on the fifth floor of the building (accessed by a panoramic lift), came as a pleasant surprise thanks to the design of its dining spaces as well as other details such as the exclusively designed bronze bar, the dreamlike trees suspended from the ceiling, and the impressive sea views. Here, chefs George Papazacharias and Thanos Feskos, both of whom have been trained in some of Europe’s best restaurants, showcase their creative cuisine, which places sustainability at the heart of everything, hence the continual focus on the provenance of ingredients (from their own kitchen garden, locally sourced, responsible fishing etc). The striking cuisine here is focused on a single 12-course tasting menu (vegetarian and vegan options are also available but need to be requested in advance).

Name: Hytra
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Diners Club credit card,Great view,Mastercard credit card,Restaurant offering vegetarian menus,Terrace,Visa credit card
Description: If you’re looking for a restaurant with plenty of innate charm, this could be the perfect option for you. Hytra is located on the 6th and 7th floors of the Onassis Cultural Centre, a modern building with views of the Acropolis that in summer relocates to the rooftop terrace from where you can enjoy dinner beneath the stars while admiring the incredible Parthenon as a backdrop. The contemporary-style Greek cuisine on offer here, featuring fine textures and meticulous presentation, is based around Greek ingredients and herbs grown in the restaurant’s own kitchen garden, all of which are very clearly evident in its sauces, creams, seasonings, and even its cocktails. Choose between the à la carte and two enticing tasting menus, one of which (Think Green) is vegetarian. Access is via Leontiou Street, where you’ll find a security guard directing you to the lift.

Name: Botrini's
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Diners Club credit card,Interesting wine list,Mastercard credit card,Terrace,Visa credit card
Description: A modern, elegant restaurant occupying a former school in the up-and-coming Chalandri district and located slightly away from the city’s tourist hotspots. The cheery entrance and intimate tree-shaded terrace come as a pleasant surprise. Here, half-Greek, half-Italian chef Ettore Botrini offers two extensive tasting menus which showcase creative Mediterranean-focused cuisine with constant references to the two countries that are part of his DNA. He always works with locally sourced ingredients and creates several dishes with a specific connection to the island of Corfu, where he spent his childhood. To elevate the gastronomic experience even further, why not dine at the exclusive chef’s table, with seats for just four guests?

Name: Varoulko Seaside
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Restaurant offering vegetarian menus,Terrace,Visa credit card
Description: If you’re looking for a restaurant with an authentic maritime flavour, this eatery overlooking the small yet attractive port of Mikrolimano will come as a pleasant surprise thanks to the superb views of the fishing boats moored out front.Traditionally, Piraeus is known as the port of Athens, hence the plethora of tavernas and restaurants specialising in fish and seafood located here. Varoulko Seaside follows the same influence, although chef Lefteris Lazarou takes his maritime cuisine to another level! The freshest ingredients are key to his cuisine which is based around the catch of the day (sea bass, red mullet, grouper, tuna, shrimp, prawns etc) and presented on an à la carte and two tasting menus. His hot dishes, including a delicious fish patty, are accompanied by cold specialities in the shape of ceviches, carpaccios and tartares.

Name: Spondi
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Car park,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Diners Club credit card,Interesting wine list,Mastercard credit card,Restaurant offering vegetarian menus,Terrace,Visa credit card
Description: In this elegant restaurant close to a busy square behind the ancient Panathenaic Stadium, enjoy highly professional service, attractive vaulted dining rooms, and two Mediterranean-inspired terraces perfect for alfresco dining and a romantic candlelit supper. The cooking here is centred around elaborate and highly visual contemporary French cuisine that is showcased via an array of à la carte dishes as well as on an enticing “Discovery” tasting menu. Seasonal produce is very much to the fore here, although some ever-popular ingredients (crab, langoustine, lamb, chocolate etc) feature all year round. Particularly friendly and attentive service is a constant here!

Name: The Zillers
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Diners Club credit card,Great view,Mastercard credit card,Terrace,Visa credit card
Description: This was once the family home of German architect Ernst Zillers, who came to Athens to design some of the city’s public buildings, fell in love and then spent the rest of his life here. The building, situated next to the city’s Orthodox cathedral and converted into a hotel (Zillers Boutique Hotel), boasts a rooftop terrace and a multi-purpose Roof Garden with fine views of the cathedral and Acropolis. During the day it serves light meals and snacks; however, in the evening the space is transformed into the culinary realm of chef Pavlos Kiriakis, who offers two contemporary tasting menus on which he showcases his “creative philosophy that reinterprets high-quality ingredients and traditions in a contemporary way ”. He also hosts his renowned ‘Four Hands Dinners’, working with other leading chefs.

Name: Pelagos
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Car park,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Great view,Mastercard credit card,Terrace,Visa credit card,Wheelchair access
Description: If you’re keen to get away from the hustle and bustle of Athens, why not head to the Four Seasons Astir Palace Hotel, a luxury resort on an archipelago to the south of the Greek capital? At Pelagos, a restaurant that delights guests with its spacious sea-view terrace, enjoy Mediterranean cuisine featuring an Italian touch and classic French influences. Its successful fusion of ingredients is showcased on two tasting menus: “The Classics 360°”, featuring the restaurant’s most successful signature dishes; and “Pelagos On Tour”, a culinary project developed between chef Luca Piscazzi and manager Cédric Vinckier, that champions the country’s cuisine and has seen them scour the islands of Tinos, Lesvos and Kalymnos, as well as the region around Athens, in search of the very best artisanal ingredients.

Name: Soil
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Diners Club credit card,Mastercard credit card,Terrace,Visa credit card
Description: Soil occupies a delightful house with a romantic patio-terrace, in the shade of leafy orange trees in the Pangrati district, a stone’s throw from the famous Panathenaic stadium – the venue for the first Olympic Games of the modern era. Here, chef Tasos Mantis (co-owner along with Alexandros Mouridis, who runs the front of house), creates contemporary seasonal cuisine featuring classic techniques, a solid basis in Greek cooking and a Nordic touch. This is showcased on a menu of well-presented small plates that reaffirm the restaurant’s “farm to table” concept, with a special focus on vegetables, herbs and edible flowers from the chef’s kitchen garden in Alepochori (cultivated by his father). At the end of the experience, guests are even given a bouquet of the herbs used in their meal.

Name: CTC Urban Gastronomy
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Interesting wine list,Mastercard credit card,Terrace,Visa credit card
Description: A restaurant that is highly sought after during the summer months thanks to its delightful urban terrace dotted with verdant trees and bushes. Here, chef Alexandros Tsiotinis, who is well supported by his kitchen team, focuses on Mediterranean-based cuisine featuring modern techniques and meticulous presentation, showcased on a single 11-course surprise menu that is gradually revealed by staff as if they were unveiling a secret. Dishes change according to the availability of seasonal ingredients with the exception of one or two that are mainstays throughout the year, such as “sweetcorn velouté flavoured with lobster, truffle and a bergamot espuma”. A gastronomic experience in which guests should also sit back and savour some of the tasting menu’s superb wine pairings!

Name: Oikeîo
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Terrace,Visa credit card
Description: A sweet little restaurant in a chic neighbourhood, with tables on two different levels, as well as outside. The décor is traditional and the place has a warm, cosy feel. Menus offer great value family-style dishes made with fresh ingredients and feature the likes of sardines, moussaka and octopus in vinegar.

Name: Nolan
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Diners Club credit card,Mastercard credit card,Terrace,Visa credit card
Description: (Temporarily closed for refurbishment) A contemporary bistro in the centre of the city, just a few steps from the busy Syntagma Square. The chef at the helm here (his father is Greek, his mother Japanese), creates contemporary Greek-focused cooking with plenty of Asian influences, and enticing dishes that are fresh, colourful and perfect for sharing. Next door is a separate space called “Sweet Nolan”, a pastry shop that complements the Nolan brand’s other ventures, creating desserts for the restaurant but also selling directly to the public.

Name: Cerdo Negro 1985
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Diners Club credit card,Mastercard credit card,Terrace,Visa credit card
Description: This small taverna with a casual ambience, close to the Kerameikos archaeological site, is run in a relaxed fashion by two brothers who have combined their Greek heritage with a passion for Spanish cuisine. In this single-storey property with an attractive covered patio, they complement their varied à la carte of contemporary Mediterranean cooking (most dishes are cooked over a wood fire), with a six-course Taste of Cerdo Negro menu. Make sure you try the homemade bread and the “Welcome to Cerdo Negro” starter.

Name: NUTA
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Diners Club credit card,Mastercard credit card,Visa credit card
Description: Experienced chef-owner Andrea Camastra is from Puglia, lives in Poland and has a passion for Asian cuisine; all three have an influence over the tasting menus at this clever and original restaurant – and the kitchen team carry off all the combinations of flavours and styles with aplomb. With a degree in Chemistry from Oxford, Andrea even has an on-site lab for testing out his creations. Arrive hungry, because the generous dishes just keep on coming.

Name: Le Braci
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Interesting wine list,Mastercard credit card,Terrace,Visa credit card
Description: There's a clubby feel to this intimate Italian restaurant thanks to its zinc-topped bar, high ceiling and dark green colour scheme. The appealing Italian menu covers all regions, while dishes are authentic and full of flavour. A superb range of wines includes those from small Italian producers and lesser-seen regions.

Name: Koneser Grill
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Terrace,Visa credit card
Description: This redeveloped former vodka factory to the east of the city comes with an industrial look and a laid-back vibe. It’s all about steak here, with a focus on Polish beef, aged in-house, and then cooked over a wood-fired grill. Prices represent good value and the steaks to share are a great option.

Name: alewino
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Interesting wine list,Mastercard credit card,Terrace,Visa credit card
Description: Spread across various rooms, this starkly decorated bistro started life as a wine shop. There’s still a range of bottles for sale, along with a wine list that offers plenty of younger and lesser-known producers. The well-priced menu includes more starters than mains, which allows guests to order a few plates to share. Traditional Polish flavours and dishes are approached with a modern sensibility and prepared with plenty of care.

Name: Kieliszki na Próżnej
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Bring your own bottle,Counter dining,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Diners Club credit card,Interesting wine list,Mastercard credit card,Terrace,Visa credit card,Wheelchair access
Description: A huge, gravity-defying rack of wine glasses is the first thing you notice when you arrive at this friendly wine bar and bistro. Next, it’s the striking black and white wildlife mural filling one wall. The appealing menus represent good value, especially at lunchtime, and include hearty dishes that are bursting with bold and punchy flavours. An extensive wine list offers plenty of great quality choices to fill all those glasses with, but ‘bring your own’ is welcome too.

Name: D.O.M.
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Interesting wine list,Mastercard credit card,Restaurant offering vegetarian menus,Valet parking,Visa credit card
Description: Without a doubt, Alex Atala is the world’s best-known Brazilian chef, a status earned thanks to cuisine that “always has lots to tell. ” He views his food as “a viable dream”—it is contemporary yet wholly engaged with the culinary roots of the country. Tasting menus (some of which are vegetarian) make full use of traditional Brazilian ingredients (tucupi, jambu, pupunha palm heart, and more) and are designed around Amazonian and indigenous cooking that predate the discovery of the New World. (Last update: September 2020).

Name: Oteque
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Diners Club credit card,Interesting wine list,Mastercard credit card,Visa credit card
Description: The surprises here begin at the entrance, since nothing gives the impression that hidden behind its discreet front door is this temple of Rio gastronomy. The attractive dining room boasts high ceilings and an informal atmosphere with a modern-industrial feel. Extraordinary chef Alberto Landgraf transports guests to a world of highly precise culinary sensations based around his consistent use of the region’s very best fish and seafood. His delicate dishes showcase a skilful fusion of ingredients and flavours. (Last update: September 2020).

Name: Oro
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Valet parking,Visa credit card
Description: This is a restaurant that is well worth frequenting, as the partnership formed between chef Felipe Bronze and sommelier Cecilia Aldaz works to perfection due to their unmistakable chemistry and friendly approach. Here, the cuisine features a fusion of Brazilian roots and cutting-edge gastronomy, as reflected on two menus—both offering a wine pairing that pays homage to the country’s regions. The kitchen is upstairs, so diners can expect constant traffic—with servers cradling carefully balanced trays. (Last update: September 2020).

Name: Kinoshita
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Diners Club credit card,Mastercard credit card,Notable sake list,Valet parking,Visa credit card
Description: Kinoshita is one of the most prestigious restaurants in São Paulo as well as one of the first to serve authentic Kappo cuisine—thereby bringing the true essence of Japanese gastronomy to Brazilian palates. The excellent Washoku dishes are perfectly balanced, impeccably presented and made from seasonal ingredients. Nigiri takes pride of place on this menu, which also features sashimi, temaki and grilled yakimono dishes—all elegant, finely textured and full of flavour. (Last update: September 2020).

Name: Evvai
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Diners Club credit card,Mastercard credit card,Valet parking,Visa credit card,Wheelchair access
Description: Chef Luiz Filipe Souza’s story is first and foremost a reflection of his confidence and dedication—both key to his success at Evvai. Beyond this small bar is an elegant main dining room with views of the kitchen. The Italian cuisine is split between traditional à la carte dishes and a more innovative version of the tasting menu. The nine-course Oriundi option combines modern Italian cooking with a contemporary take on Brazilian cuisine. (Last update: September 2020).

Name: Mee
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Notable sake list,Valet parking,Visa credit card
Description: If you’re looking for a unique Asian-inspired experience, make sure you book a table at Mee, where you can enjoy pan-Asian fusion cuisine featuring the flavours of Thailand, Cambodia, Vietnam, Korea, Japan and elsewhere. Here you’ll find a sushi bar plus interesting menus, including one that is dedicated to our esteemed guide (MEEchelin)! The portraits by the Belgian artist Christian Develter, inspired by the tattooed faces of women from the Chin tribe in Myanmar, are particularly striking. (Last update: September 2020).

Name: Cipriani
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Diners Club credit card,Mastercard credit card,Valet parking,Visa credit card
Description: Located inside the "Copa", the city's, and perhaps Brazil's, most legendary hotel. Here, under the baton of chef Nello Cassese, discover Italian-international cuisine showcasing contemporary techniques and presentation which uses authentic Italian products in combination with locally sourced ingredients. The splendid dining room overlooks the hotel's famous pool, but if you're looking for a unique experience, we recommend booking the "chef's table" seating six guests in the kitchen itself. (Last update: September 2020).

Name: Maní
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Diners Club credit card,Mastercard credit card,Valet parking,Visa credit card
Description: This restaurant demonstrates a true passion for good cooking. The contemporary decor comes as a pleasant surprise, with its off-white tones and the use of different building materials, which combine to provide a creative space perfect for an enjoyable dining experience. Allow your senses to run free as you savour modern dishes with superb textures and clearly defined flavours, which are created using the finest Brazilian ingredients. (Last update: September 2020).

Name: Jun Sakamoto
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Valet parking,Visa credit card
Description: Thanks to his larger-than-life personality, Leonardo Jun Sakamoto has left his unmistakable mark on this discreet restaurant where you won’t find any signage. Here, you will savour what may well be the finest nigiri in the city. Of course, it is all best enjoyed seated at the sushi bar—with a front-row view of items being artfully prepared by these chefs. Prices vary depending on whether the master or his equally skilful right-hand man, Ryuzo Nishimura, crafts the dishes. Reservations are a must. (Last update: September 2020).

Name: Huto
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Notable sake list,Valet parking,Visa credit card
Description: Cuisine of the highest quality is the order of the day in this small restaurant run by the attentive owner himself. Here, you would be well advised to take the chef’s advice and choose one of the three omakase menus (the Japanese word ‘omakase’ translates loosely as ‘leave it up to us’). Show complete confidence in your host by enthusiastically ordering menu 3, savouring each and every ‘surprise’ dish until you ask the kitchen to stop, otherwise you won’t stop eating... An extraordinary experience! (Last update: September 2020).

Name: Kan Suke
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Visa credit card
Description: This tiny Japanese eatery demonstrates why, in most cases, the best perfumes are sold in small bottles! Located in an unpretentious shopping mall, you’ll need to keep your eyes peeled as it’s easy to walk past without realising that you’ve just missed a jewel of Japanese cuisine. The highlight on the menu is its superb sushi, like tuna, eel, sea urchin, and sardines, all prepared with a special balance of flavours. For dessert, there’s no doubt that the classic pudim is an absolute win. (Last update: September 2020).

Name: Picchi
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Bring your own bottle,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Diners Club credit card,Mastercard credit card,Valet parking,Visa credit card,Wheelchair access
Description: This Italian restaurant adjoining the Regent Park hotel is surrounded by art galleries and luxury boutiques and is well worth a visit. Here, amid a classic-cum-contemporary ambience, chef Pier Paolo Picchi rekindles memories of his childhood through Italian dishes. These showcase well-defined flavours and innovative touches, and the Brazilian ingredients make an interesting contribution. Try the pici pasta from Tuscany with a Calabrese sausage, white bean and peperoncino sauce. (Last update: September 2020).

Name: Lasai
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Diners Club credit card,Mastercard credit card,Valet parking,Visa credit card,Wheelchair access
Description: Located in a historic building, this is a unique restaurant that reflects the cutting-edge aspect of Brazilian cuisine. The kitchen team is guided by the strict principles of seasonality and proximity, working with small producers who raise their own chickens and grow their own organic produce. The name “Lasai” translates to “tranquil” in Basque, and is a nod to the many years that this chef worked with Andoni Luis Aduriz at Mugaritz in Spain. Choose between two set menus: the longer “+” or the shorter “-”. (Last update: September 2020).

Name: Casa Santo Antônio
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Diners Club credit card,Mastercard credit card,Terrace,Valet parking,Visa credit card,Wheelchair access
Description: A perfect example of how a dream between friends – now co-owners – can become a reality. In Granja Julieta, a quiet district in the south of the city, you’ll find this pleasant 1960s style chalet, where guests can choose from an impressive classic Italian menu featuring specialities such as burrata with tomatoes, olives and slivers of Sicilian lemon, or the superb brie tortelli with a truffle-flavoured sauce. Some of the tables on the terrace enjoy views of the glass-fronted kitchen. (Last update: September 2020).

Name: Nit
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Diners Club credit card,Mastercard credit card,Visa credit card
Description: The most informal and fun of Catalan chef, Oscar Bosch’s restaurants, Nit transforms the chef’s Mediterranean cuisine into a selection of exciting and original tapas dishes, all prepared with carefully chosen ingredients. This contemporary-style destination, next door to Bosch’s other eatery (Tanit), is full of character, with an enclosed terrace and a large bar. The liveliest tables are in the back, facing the kitchen, which turns out Spanish cuisine best enjoyed in the company of friends. (Last update: September 2020).

Name: Brasserie Victória
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Diners Club credit card,Mastercard credit card,Valet parking,Visa credit card
Description: It is estimated that around ten million inhabitants of Lebanese descent live in Brazil. Esfihas (a type of Arab pizza) and quibes (meat croquettes) are as popular here as Brazilian staples such as pão de queijo (cheese bread) and coxinhas (chicken croquettes) and are sold at almost every Brazilian street stall. The Brasserie Victória, run by the same family for over 40 years, is nowadays considered the symbol of Lebanese presence in São Paulo, serving authentic, family-style cooking that represents the varied cuisine of their homeland. Make sure you try a little of everything. (Last update: September 2020).

Name: TonTon
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Diners Club credit card,Mastercard credit card,Terrace,Valet parking,Visa credit card,Wheelchair access
Description: Located in a quiet residential street, this cosy, bistro-style restaurant is testament to the fact that travelling the world is always an enriching experience. Proof comes in the form of owner-chef Gustavo Rozzino's delicious international dishes, which take their influence from Brazilian, Italian, French and English recipes; this unusual culinary combination representing the various countries in which he trained as a chef. (Last update: September 2020).

Name: Manioca
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Visa credit card
Description: It’s spacious, bright and eclectic, yet despite its size, Manioca is somewhat hidden, as its sits inside a huge shopping centre behind the modern Livraria Cultura bookshop and customers to have walk between the bookshelves to reach it. Top-quality products, reasonable prices and a high level of technical skill are the hallmarks of this restaurant, which serves modern cuisine with Brazilian and international influences. Allow plenty of time as it gets very busy. (Last update: September 2020).

Name: Charco
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Terrace,Visa credit card,Wheelchair access
Description: Despite its compact size, this restaurant in the Jardins district not far from Parque Trianon, is very welcoming with its small terrace and rustic-contemporary interior. Chef Tuca Mezzomo, a young gaucho from the Río Grande do Sul region, focuses on grill-based cuisine that showcases products and ingredients from different parts of Brazil. Guests are able to discover the large variety of flavours that this country has to offer through his dishes. As an added bonus, Charco even cures its own meats. (Last update: September 2020).

Name: Le Bife
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Car park,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Diners Club credit card,Mastercard credit card,Valet parking,Visa credit card,Wheelchair access
Description: With French celebrity chef Erick Jacquin as its consultant, Le Bife’s success is down to the simplicity of its menu: four quality meat dishes (filet mignon, entrecôte, steak tartare and hamburger) with salad, three sauces and a choice of sides included in the price. The executive menu, served midweek lunch, is based around the same formula but with just a single meat option (the cut of the day) and a delicious dessert – hot chocolate gateau with vanilla ice cream. (Last update: September 2020).

Name: Miam Miam
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Visa credit card
Description: A restaurant with retro furniture, colourful decor and exposed brickwork, which harks back to the past; it is, in fact, the former mansion of chef Roberta Ciasca’s grandmother. They serve comfort food and traditional Brazilian classics, which showcase contemporary cooking techniques and a demonstrate a flair for presentation. A simpler, very reasonably priced menu is available at lunchtime, accompanied by a salad buffet. (Last update: September 2020).

Name: Cepa
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Terrace,Visa credit card
Description: If you like the idea of a seasonally inspired dining experience, escape São Paulo’s hectic business district and head for this unassuming restaurant—located in a residential district close to the São Luiz hospital. Here, chef Lucas Dante—who runs Cepa with his sommelier wife—focuses on creativity, ensuring that his cooking is always fun and based on products sourced daily from the market. The tasting menu is available in the evening and is a worthy option. (Last update: September 2020).

Name: Mocotó
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Valet parking,Visa credit card,Wheelchair access
Description: Like its founder Zé Almeida, who came here from inland Pernambuco in the 1960s, you’ll need to embark on something of a pilgrimage to get to this famous and secluded eatery specialising in cuisine from the north-east. Originally famous for its mocotó dish, the kitchen, now run by Zé’s son Rodrigo Oliveira, conjures up many other delicacies from the north-eastern hinterland, including unforgettable torresminhos (pork rinds), prepared according to a secret recipe, that are crunchy, succulent and some of the best we’ve ever tasted! (Last update: September 2020).

Name: Più
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Diners Club credit card,Mastercard credit card,Terrace,Visa credit card
Description: This restaurant, in the western part of São Paulo, comes as a pleasant surprise. It's set within a simple yet charming house, in which chef Marcelo Laskani, co-owner along with maître d’ Mauricio Cavalcante, offers Italian-inspired cuisine built around a few solid principles: strong technique, meticulous presentation, and reasonable prices thanks to the judicious use of less luxurious ingredients. It's full almost every day, so advanced booking is highly recommended. (Last update: September 2020).

Name: Corrutela
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Visa credit card
Description: A restaurant that showcases the gastronomy of the future, in which sustainability is a central theme and an attractive "leitmotiv". The focus of the chef is on healthy, contemporary cuisine based around seasonal and organic ingredients, including fish and seafood, that help the planet. As an example, Corrutela does not use products wrapped in plastic, it makes its own flour and compost, and creates its own energy from solar panels. (Last update: September 2020).

Name: Maria e o Boi
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Diners Club credit card,Mastercard credit card,Terrace,Valet parking,Visa credit card
Description: This is a pleasant and informal restaurant that specialises in meat and is located in the charming Ipanema district. Here, you can enjoy Brazilian and international cooking with an Italian flair, which is always attractively priced and accompanied by copious sides. It is renowned for its grilled items (no fewer than seven different cuts of meat) and several signatures, including the ten hour-roasted beef rib (costela minga) as well as the surprisingly delicious duck heart with garlic bread and Grana Padano. (Last update: September 2020).

Name: Ama.zo
FacilitiesAndServices: American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Garden or park,Mastercard credit card,Terrace,Visa credit card
Description: Ama. zo makes for a memorable dining experience that is both interesting and affordable. Here, in the delightful setting of a landscaped terrace—with large jabuticaba trees and an almost imperceptible cover to protect the dining space from the elements—savour reinterpreted Peruvian cuisine that is crafted from local products. Dishes feature strong flavours and pleasant textures with subtle nods to the Amazon and enticing Latin influences. (Last update: September 2020).

Name: Tordesilhas
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Diners Club credit card,Mastercard credit card,Terrace,Valet parking,Visa credit card
Description: This established restaurant has a good reputation and has just celebrated its 25th anniversary. It's famous as a trailblazer for tasting menus of Brazilian cuisine, which are served Tuesday to Saturday evenings. There are lots of petiscos for sharing, as well as more creative dishes such as the three Amazonian sorbets served on jambu pearls, and the traditional feijoada, which is only available Saturday lunchtimes. Look out for the impressive collection of artisanal peppers! (Last update: September 2020).

Name: Balaio IMS
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Visa credit card,Wheelchair access
Description: Occupying the same modern building as the Instituto Moreira Salles, this restaurant is an excellent place in which to discover and enjoy chef Rodrigo Oliveira’s simple, fresh and attractive cuisine in the centre of São Paulo. In this modest setting, enjoy a combination of the successful dishes first created in the Mocotó restaurant, the latter, in particular, bringing a more traditional family-style influence to the dishes served here. Some tables are shared. (Last update: September 2020).

Name: Kith 2º Andar
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Visa credit card
Description: This restaurant continues to make a big impression in Pinheiros, an office district where more informal eateries tend to be the norm. Its bright interior, which combines contemporary design with industrial touches, acts as a backdrop for the Brazilian cuisine with occasional international twists. Authentic, fresh dishes and refined techniques are the cornerstone here, with a focus on barbecue-grilled meats—a nod to chef Juliana Faingluz’s gaucho roots. (Last update: September 2020).

Name: Zena Caffè
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Diners Club credit card,Mastercard credit card,Terrace,Valet parking,Visa credit card
Description: Zena, which translates as Genoa in the Ligurian dialect, is a simple, happy and vibrant eatery that pays homage to Liguria; the region which is home to pesto sauce. Faithful to the region’s traditional recipes, Zena Caffè serves dishes that are fresh, healthy and quick; special mention must go to its focaccias (with their light dough and generous fillings), its gnocchi and its home-made desserts such as the splendid latte dolce fritto (a thick milk-based cream which is left to solidify before being breaded and fried, and served with the caramel-flavoured doce de leite). Go with friends and order dishes to share, as well as a jug of sangria or clericot. (Last update: September 2020).

Name: Pici Trattoria
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Visa credit card,Wheelchair access
Description: Situated opposite the Praça Nossa Senhora da Paz, this restaurant boasts an Italian-style decor with colourful chairs and tables and windows inscribed with items from the menu. The original menu, overseen by renowned chef Elia Schramm, combines classic Italian recipes and Brazilian ingredients, resulting in a host of generous dishes which are full of flavour. Artists’ photos adorn the walls, while jazz music plays gently in the background. (Last update: September 2020).

Name: Banzeiro
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Terrace,Valet parking,Visa credit card,Wheelchair access
Description: Banzeiro is a breath of fresh air on Sao Paulo’s culinary scene. Chef Felipe Schaedler made the leap to this Brazilian metropolis from Manaus, where he has two other restaurants, in order to popularise the flavours and cooking of the Amazon. In this vibrantly decorated space, discover dishes—many cooked on the grill—that are contemporary, delicate and highly visual. Make sure to try river fish, such as pirarucú and tambaquià, as well as the highly unusual saúva ant with a mandioquinha foam. (Last update: September 2020).

Name: Tanit
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Diners Club credit card,Mastercard credit card,Valet parking,Visa credit card
Description: The design of this restaurant is a real talking point with its striking entrance, modern high-ceilinged interior, polished concrete floors and wood-panelled walls, along with intelligent use of natural light. Spanish chef Oscar Bosch creates technically skilled, carefully presented Mediterranean dishes which are adapted to Brazilian tastes, alongside local specialities. Its signature tapas, varied rice dishes and popular roast suckling pig are all worthy of particular praise. (Last update: September 2020).

Name: Petí Gastronomia
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Car park,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Visa credit card,Wheelchair access
Description: This curious restaurant will come as a surprise, as it’s located in a small glass-fronted courtyard behind a large shop which specialises in fine arts. The young chef, who has already worked in some leading restaurants across Europe, crafts delicately presented, contemporary dishes using seasonal ingredients; all the time using the latest techniques to create fine textures and well-defined flavours. The menu offers several options and is changed every two weeks. (Last update: September 2020).

Name: Fitó
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Diners Club credit card,Mastercard credit card,Visa credit card,Wheelchair access
Description: This restaurant pays homage to the culture and cooking of northeast Brazil – one of the country’s most popular cuisines. What stands out at this simple restaurant is the authenticity of the food and the enthusiasm of the owners, with the wife running the kitchen and her husband out front. The menu focuses on hearty cooking from the state of Piauí and includes daily specials and north-eastern classics such as Carne de Sol and Arroz Maria Isabel. The petiscos on the counter are well worth trying! (Last update: September 2020).

Name: Komah
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Diners Club credit card,Mastercard credit card,Visa credit card
Description: A queue of people waiting outside a restaurant is always a good sign and this is precisely what you see at Komah, a restaurant serving Korean cuisine with a modern flavour. You’ll enjoy a memorable dining experience here, thanks to the chef who delights his guests with a full range of flavours which extends from sweet to spicy. Make sure you try the Samgiopsal (roast pork belly with a gochujang sauce glaze) and the Kimchi Bokumbap (sautéed rice with kimchi and a creamy omelette). (Last update: September 2020).

Name: Lilia
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Diners Club credit card,Mastercard credit card,Visa credit card
Description: A unique and different restaurant in which young chef Lucio Vieira demonstrates a new interpretation of hospitality. The unassuming façade, adorned with just a small poster, provides access to a steep staircase that leads guests to the upper floors with their decor of extreme simplicity. The highlight here is the updated traditional cuisine, teeming with strong flavours and always based around ingredients from the market to ensure maximum freshness and affordability. (Last update: September 2020).

Name: Arturito
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Diners Club credit card,Mastercard credit card,Valet parking,Visa credit card,Wheelchair access
Description: Celebrity Argentinian chef Paola Carosella’s aim is to please the palate rather than take it by surprise. Her dishes showcase a passion for fresh vegetables and herbs in which simplicity and honesty are key. Her cooking is delicious, well executed and based around the very best ingredients. For lunch, the excellent executive menu and dish of the day are popular choices, while the dinner menu boasts clear Italian and Argentinian influence along with a contemporary touch. (Last update: September 2020).

Name: A Baianeira
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Diners Club credit card,Mastercard credit card,Reservations not accepted,Terrace,Visa credit card
Description: Simplicity is the buzzword here as the restaurant developed in a small garage that once upon a time only sold the traditional "pão de queijo".
