Today, the owner-chef, who has trained the entire team of women working with her, pays homage to her origins by offering family-style dishes that combine the cooking of Bahia and the northeast – Brazilian dishes that showcase technical skill and attractive presentation. The sweet potato gnocchi with cream cheese is well worth ordering. (Last update: September 2020).

Name: Didier
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Diners Club credit card,Mastercard credit card,Visa credit card
Description: Run by a friendly married couple, Didier combines both Brazilian and French roots, with the female half of the partnership front of house and her classically trained French chef-husband manning the stoves. In this bright setting, reminiscent of a winter conservatory and terrace, enjoy reasonably priced classic dishes that showcase the chef’s international training in France, the USA and Brazil. He achieves great things with a limited budget, working with seasonal products and the freshest possible fish. (Last update: September 2020).

Name: Artigiano
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,Credit cards not accepted,Terrace,Valet parking
Description: This restaurant specialises in the cuisine of the Emilia-Romagna region of Italy, serving home-made pasta and pizzas and popular ingredients from the region, such as Parma ham and Parmesan cheese. Everything here is hand-made (as evidenced by its name) and prices are reasonable. Make sure you try the roselline romagnole (pasta stuffed with ham and mozzarella and a Parmesan sauce). There’s a delightful terrace for cool alfresco dining. (Last update: September 2020).

Name: Barú Marisquería
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Terrace,Valet parking,Visa credit card
Description: This small restaurant with an attractive and relaxed ambience serves fish and seafood with a focus on freshly caught ingredients cooked over the barbecue, a familiar sight on Brazilian beaches but not as popular in the city where grilled meat options are more common. Proud of his Latin-American origins, Colombian chef Dagoberto Torres also includes a choice of superb ceviche dishes on his menu. Simple presentation, yet packed with flavour! (Last update: September 2020).

Name: Ecully - Perdizes
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Diners Club credit card,Interesting wine list,Mastercard credit card,Terrace,Valet parking,Visa credit card,Wheelchair access
Description: Tables here are set out on the old patio amid a plethora of trees, including an impressive mango tree at its centre. In this rustic yet contemporary space, the young chefs, who met each other in Ecully, France, create recipes influenced by Italian, French and Brazilian cooking. Under the same roof, they also run a wine boutique featuring over 400 reasonably priced labels (they are also importers and distributors). This is a good choice for diners wanting to eat a tasty meal accompanied by wines that won’t break the bank. (Last update: September 2020).

Name: A Casa do Porco
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Diners Club credit card,Mastercard credit card,Reservations not accepted,Terrace,Visa credit card
Description: Enjoy pork at its best! Chef Jefferson Rueda, a native of São José do Rio Pardo, takes the tastes and flavours of his youth and reinterprets them using contemporary techniques and eye-catching presentation. The welcoming setting is a combination of a bar, restaurant and small market. Don’t miss out on the sushi of pork jowl and the delicious Porco a San Zé, roasted for 8 hours in a special wood-fired churrasqueira. They don't take reservations, so customers are seated in the order they arrive. (Last update: September 2020).

Name: Bistrot de Paris
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Diners Club credit card,Mastercard credit card,Terrace,Valet parking,Visa credit card,Wheelchair access
Description: Sitting out on the front terrace of this restaurant, set in a charming little alleyway, you could be forgiven for thinking that you’re in a romantic, secretive part of Paris. It has both the atmosphere and the cuisine of a Parisian bistro; the honest cooking adheres to French techniques but with a nod to Brazilian produce. In 1990, its renowned French chef, Alain Poletto, won the 'best technique' prize at the Académie Nationale de Cuisine as a result of his research into sous-vide cooking. (Last update: September 2020).

Name: AE! Cozinha
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,Booking essential,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Visa credit card
Description: This is an intimate and surprising restaurant that is also particularly welcoming. Located in a district with a bohemian feel, it is run with lots of enthusiasm and passion by two chefs (Ygor Lopes and Walkyria Fagundes) trained in some of the best kitchens in Spain and Brazil. The highlight is on a contemporary Brazilian menu that is well-edited and focuses on sustainability. Here, dishes showcase a multitude of flavours and textures, and are creatively presented. Given its size, be sure to book ahead. (Last update: September 2020).

Name: Noel
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Diners Club credit card,Interesting wine list,Mastercard credit card,Terrace,Visa credit card
Description: You can be sure of top-quality cuisine at Noel, an excellent restaurant in the centre of Zagreb. The current seasonal tasting menu (“Spring Blossom”) is inspired by the greenery and vegetables available at this time of year, all of which are skilfully “re-worked” by the expert chef. Highlights include delicious lightly fried artichoke served with fresh almond flakes and artichoke cream. The extensive wine list includes labels from Croatia, Slovenia, France and Italy, while the restaurant’s own craft beer makes a pleasant aperitif. Last but not least, the works of art displayed around the restaurant are by a local artist with whom it’s possible to exchange a few words during your dinner – one of the dishes on the menu has even been named after him!

Name: Šug
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Terrace,Visa credit card
Description: Away from the busy tourist centre of Split, this informal, attractive and relaxing restaurant, where the young, friendly staff greet guests with courtesy and a smile, offers a good selection of traditional meat and fish dishes from Dalmatia. A small pleasant outdoor space in the inner courtyard and excellent value for money complete the picture.

Name: Beštija
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Diners Club credit card,Mastercard credit card,Visa credit card
Description: Occupying the courtyard of a building in the city centre, this pleasant bistro is simply decorated in a mix of traditional and contemporary styles and attracts a young, mixed crowd. The cuisine, heavily inspired by market availability and Croatian produce, showcases precise, aesthetically pleasing presentation and generous portions, using numerous yet carefully balanced ingredients.

Name: Tač
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,Car park,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Diners Club credit card,Mastercard credit card,Terrace,Visa credit card
Description: Despite its location in a residential district outside the city centre, it’s worth heading off the beaten track to eat in this restaurant with its welcoming dining rooms and attractive summer terrace. Meat and fish dishes feature on the menu – we particularly enjoyed the fish, which is of a very high quality and prepared in simple, traditional recipes.

Name: Izakaya
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Diners Club credit card,Mastercard credit card,Terrace,Visa credit card,Wheelchair access
Description: Although not in a central location, this modern restaurant serving delicious, carefully prepared Japanese cuisine is situated in an area that has a lively evening atmosphere. Don’t miss the chef’s signature rolls, including the excellent Kanji Uramaki (with swordfish tartare) and Age Lobster roll (with lobster in panko bread). The pleasant outdoor space is perfect for an after-dinner cocktail.

Name: Zinfandel's
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Diners Club credit card,Mastercard credit card,Terrace,Visa credit card
Description: Situated in the Hotel Esplanade, one of the most luxurious hotels in Zagreb, Zifandel's cuisine has the international stature that you would expect of a grand hotel in a capital city. The excellent menu here features an array of top-quality local and international dishes.

Name: DILL
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Visa credit card,Wheelchair access
Description: A strong sustainability ethos drives the kitchen at this moodily lit and atmospheric first floor restaurant. The internationally experienced chef uses traditional Icelandic methods alongside modern techniques to produce a multi-course menu of creative, diminutive dishes that really pack a punch – and they’re served and explained by the chefs themselves.

Name: ÓX
FacilitiesAndServices: American Express credit card,Counter dining,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Visa credit card
Description: Intimate and lively, this 16 seater counter restaurant offers an entirely engaging dining experience helped along by some top Icelandic produce. Your evening begins with a drink in the cosy lounge, where you’re encouraged to get to know the other guests before taking your seats at the counter. Dishes are an excellent fusion of the traditional and the modern, with gimmicks eschewed in favour of a real intensity of flavour.

Name: Ănăn Saigon
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Terrace,Visa credit card
Description: After working abroad in Hong Kong, Chicago and Bangkok, chef-owner Peter Cuong Franklin has returned to Vietnam to open this restaurant in a lively market. He applies modern cooking techniques to authentic street food recipes to create enticing flavours. Whether you order the fresh tuna tartare, a roasted duck-mozzarella-herb mini pizza, shrimp and pork tacos, or bone marrow Wagyu beef phở, every dish is a masterclass of well-balanced flavours and textures.

Name: Hibana by Koki
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Counter dining,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Notable sake list,Visa credit card,Wheelchair access
Description: Guests are cosseted from arrival to departure for a theatrical experience at a 14-seat counter in the basement of Capella hotel. Affable Chef Hiroshi Yamaguchi skilfully and precisely cooks teppanyaki dishes rich in complex flavour. The menu features a distinctly decadent edge, epitomised by the premium ingredients flown in twice weekly from Japan, such as abalone, spiny lobster, sea urchin, Yaeyama Kyori beef and Hokkaido hairy crab.

Name: Gia
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,JCB,Mastercard credit card,Visa credit card
Description: Gia đình, meaning "family", is a reference to chef Sam Tran and partner Long Tran's longing for their homeland during their years working abroad. The restaurant decor draws inspiration from the Temple of Literature just across the road. Their 12-course set menu changes with the seasons and is informed by Vietnamese culinary heritage. Deceptively complex, the beautifully crafted dishes showcase well-judged combinations of subtle flavours, with acidity and texture playing prominent roles.

Name: Tầm Vị
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Visa credit card
Description: This vintage tea house feels distinctly North Vietnamese with its nostalgic collection of Chinese furniture, hand-written signs and an antique gramophone and telephone. They serve Northern Vietnamese dishes with some central and southern options. The Vietnamese ham with periwinkle chả ốc (snails) comes with fresh herbs, vegetables and rice vermicelli with fish sauce. The subtle crab soup with canh cua mừng tơi (malabar spinach) comes in a clear broth.

Name: Cuc Gach Quan
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Visa credit card
Description: The restaurant sports two dining rooms facing each other on the same street, flanked by a supremely relaxing koi pond and leafy garden. The menu is mostly traditional Vietnamese, such as đậu hũ chiên sả ớt (deep-fried tofu with finely chopped lemongrass), and the signature canh chua cá hú fish soup, rich in tangy sweetness. Make sure you save room for desserts like deep-fried banana or the sương sâm jelly with an intense herbal flavour.

Name: Phở Chào
FacilitiesAndServices: Cash only
Description: Mama Dung started out in the northern city of Nam Dinh in 1986, armed with her grandmother's recipe for a light, clean, pure broth. Now, in this shop, diners choose between a three-day beef-bone stock or chicken broth; stand-out dishes include the phở bắp hoa, featuring crunchy medium-rare beef, and Mama Dung's gà tôm mắm sốt (crispy fried chicken). There is also phở tine – a creative Western-style take on phở, served with golden French fries, beef noodle soup and cheese.

Name: Xới Cơm
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,Cash only
Description: Experience authentic Northern Vietnamese home cooking in this cosy restaurant, whose vintage interior is reminiscent of Hanoi houses in the 1980s and 1990s. The menu options vary daily, with simple yet delicious dishes like stir-fried water spinach with garlic and deep-fried tofu with green onion. A comfortable venue at eater-friendly prices, while the helpful staff is on hand to explain the Vietnamese menu in simple English.

Name: Phở Minh
FacilitiesAndServices: Cash only
Description: Despite its hard-to-find location down a narrow alley, Phở Minh has been attracting hungry Saigonese with its traditional beef noodle soup since 1945. Choose between beef tenderloin, brisket and a mix of different cuts available on the day. Their freshly baked pâté chaud is a must: the puff pastry is flaky and the meat filling piping hot. Come here for breakfast because they tend to sell out before 10am.

Name: Phở Hoàng
FacilitiesAndServices: Cash only
Description: This phở shop has been around since 2008 and the owner Mr Hoang is justly proud of his clear beef broth that takes over 12 hours to make. Feel free to customise your beef noodle soup by ordering tendon, flank, minced beef or even a raw egg on the side. Every bowl comes with garnishes like coriander, basil, lime wedges, onions and bean sprouts. For drinks, try their monk fruit herbal tea made with over 10 different herbs.

Name: Cơm Tấm Ba Ghiền
FacilitiesAndServices: Cash only
Description: Since the 1990s, this unassuming stall has been serving what many locals consider to be the best cơm tấm (broken rice dish) in town. Their most popular version is steamed broken rice topped with pork chop marinated in a secret sauce and perfectly grilled over charcoal, along with pickled radish and sweet and sour fish sauce. There is a chicken version as well.

Name: Chả Cá Thăng Long
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,Credit card / Debit card accepted
Description: Three outlets with the same name in the same street run by the same family can be a tad confusing! Make a beeline for number 6B; a century-old, pale yellow painted townhouse reached through a small courtyard. The highlight is chả cá, grilled catfish with turmeric, cooked at the table in a sizzling saucepan with spring onions and dill, and deliciously paired with vermicelli noodles, coriander, shrimp paste and peanuts for an intriguing combination of textures.

Name: Hum Garden
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Restaurant offering vegetarian menus,Terrace,Visa credit card,Wheelchair access
Description: This attractive house with a pleasant courtyard, patio and quaint furnishings outside the city centre, nestles on a quiet street in a residential area. The Vietnamese-inspired vegetarian cuisine, rich in modern twists, uses mostly organic, fresh ingredients, sourced direct from farmers. The deep-fried mushroom rolls are simply out of this world.

Name: Phở Bò Ấu Triệu
FacilitiesAndServices: Cash only
Description: The shop, which lacks any signage, boasts a single distinctive feature: phở bò, to the exclusion of anything else on the menu. And why shouldn’t it, when the minced beef noodles here are so good? Served in an intense beef bone stock, cooked for 10 hours, it comes with tender beef flank and tendon.

Name: Hồng Phát (District 3)
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Visa credit card
Description: Hủ tiếu hồng phát noodles symbolise the culinary marriage of Choazhu and Khmer culture that was introduced to Saigon in the 1970s. Friendly service is de rigueur at this simple shop, which offers all-day dining but where locals particularly flock for breakfast. The soft rice noodle soup comes with minced meat, liver, fresh tiger shrimps or braised blood curd accompanied by an assortment of herbs and bean sprouts. The chả giò tôm cua (shrimp and crab spring rolls) make a great appetiser.

Name: Don Duck Old Quarter
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Visa credit card
Description: Bliss for duck lovers! This eatery in the bustling Old Quarter conjures up almost every conceivable form of your favourite poultry. For an authentic local taste, try the duck phở noodle soup. For a variation of the Chinese classic, order the grilled à la Peking duck or enjoy duck in hotpots, spring rolls, or even deep-fried and tossed in a sweet and sour sauce. Tasty food, a casual vibe and reasonable prices make this place a firm favourite.

Name: Habakuk
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,Brunch,Credit card / Debit card accepted
Description: Tucked away in a narrow side street, Habakuk doesn’t stand out, so keep a lookout for the blue back-lit signs. By day it's a speciality coffeeshop serving single-origin coffee and a small brunch menu. In the evening it morphs into a modern bistro. The concise dinner menu is modern European with distinct Mediterranean accents. The cooking is confident, neatly presented and steeped in well-judged flavours; the service is warm and helpful.

Name: Chay Garden
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Restaurant offering vegetarian menus,Terrace,Visa credit card
Description: Located at the end of a quiet pedestrian street in the busy city centre, this vegetarian restaurant crafts delicious, affordable Vietnamese nosh, such as braised eggplant with banana and green beans. The old colonial-style house sports a charming tree-lined patio, which provides the perfect foil to this fine dining experience. The small dining rooms are thoughtfully and attractively furnished and one boasts a colourful fresco.

Name: Phở Miến Gà Kỳ Đồng
FacilitiesAndServices: Cash only
Description: A true gem in the bustling city, the chicken phở here is nothing short of amazing. The essence of its deliciousness lies in the rich, aromatic chicken broth made by slow-cooking chicken bones for 3-4 hours. The tender chicken slices and rice vermicelli are also to die for.

Name: The East
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,China UnionPay,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Diners Club credit card,JCB,Maestro,Mastercard credit card,Visa credit card
Description: In a popular area teeming with eateries and buzzing with energy, The East stands out from the crowd with its excellent Northern Vietnamese cuisine. Start with the crab spring rolls wrapped in a fine, crispy skin packed with savoury filling. The bún chả Hanoi (grilled pork and rice vermicelli) is the signature dish here and a street food staple in the capital. The Vietnamese-style flan rounds off this enjoyable dining experience. The smart two-storey house also sells ceramics created by local artisans.

Name: Xôi Bát
FacilitiesAndServices: Cash only
Description: Xôi – steamed sticky rice – is a Vietnamese staple popularly eaten as a quick breakfast or lunch. Determined to shatter the stereotype of xôi as a frugal fast food, in 2021 a young team opened Xôi Bát, a charming little eatery with a contemporary design and great attention paid to detail. They put their recipe for a relatively soft sticky rice into dishes such as xôi phá lấu trứng non, which includes quail eggs, pig ears and fried shallots, and is served with soup and kimchi as a simple, appetising meal.

Name: Bun Cha Ta (Nguyen Huu Huan Street)
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,Cash only
Description: Popular with tourists, Bun Cha Ta offers various bún chả and fried spring rolls. The classic bún chả features tender, smoky grilled pork, well-seasoned meat patties and smooth rice noodles with a balanced soup base. Among the crispy spring rolls, the seafood crab version delivers a consummate umami flavour, while the chicken is rich and meaty. They also offer rice noodles with fried tofu and tomato sauce and fried spring rolls for vegetarians.

Name: Phở Hương Bình
FacilitiesAndServices: Cash only
Description: This simple stall has been proudly serving Vietnam’s national rice noodle soup dish, phở, since 1958. There are only two items on the menu – phở gà (chicken noodle soup) and phở bò (beef noodle soup). Feel free to order additional toppings such as chicken skin, egg yolk, beef brisket and tendon. The broth is clear and light, rich in full-bodied flavours and a savoury sweetness.

Name: Phở Lệ (District 5)
FacilitiesAndServices: Cash only
Description: Vietnam’s national noodle soup dish has taken the culinary world by storm, and Phở Lệ, one of the leading restaurants in town, insists on making it exactly the same way they have been doing for over 70 years. Come here for authentic southern Vietnamese style phở – in rich broth with a robust meaty flavour and a hint of sweetness from vegetables. Despite its age, the stall is neat and clean, and always jam-packed with hungry locals getting their noodle fix.

Name: Chào Bạn
FacilitiesAndServices: Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Terrace,Visa credit card
Description: As its name, which means “hello friend” in Vietnamese, suggests, Chào Bạn is the epitome of friendly and easy going. In the kitchen, Chef Madame Hang gives traditional Vietnamese recipes a new spin with modern techniques and much aplomb. Her nem rán cua (crab spring rolls), deliver balanced flavours and contrasting textures. The menu’s Dac Biet section is a treasure trove of her creative signature dishes.

Name: Phở Phượng
FacilitiesAndServices: Cash only
Description: Like most phở shops, you can order the house special to sample different beef cuts with the ubiquitous noodle soup. But the most popular ingredient here is oxtail – braised for 40 hours until the meat is tender and the skin gelatinous.

Name: Phở Gia Truyền
FacilitiesAndServices: Cash only
Description: The numerous hearty options include phở tái nạm (slices of flank steak), phở tái (round steak) and phở chín (brisket). Add crispy quẩy (fried dough sticks), to perfect your dish. For the ultimate hunger obliterating meal, splash out on a little extra and order trứng gà (golden egg yolk).

Name: Phở Hoà Pasteur
FacilitiesAndServices: Cash only
Description: This popular restaurant has been serving delicious phở to the locals since it opened in 1968. The interior and service may not be glamorous, but the food is appropriately affordable and their delicious hallmark broth is a masterclass of balanced flavours. The menu offers a wide range of quality toppings including beef brisket, flank, tendon and tripe, as well as meatballs. Small Vietnamese side dishes are also available.

Name: Phở Gà Nguyệt
FacilitiesAndServices: Cash only
Description: The chicken noodle come with a variety of chicken cuts, but the tender thigh is a favourite – perfect in both soup and dry noodle dishes. Mix and match thigh and wings or wings and breast, adding condiments to taste. Open until midnight, it’s a popular late-night spot.

Name: Tuyết Bún Chả 34
FacilitiesAndServices: Cash only
Description: This stall is famous for its bún chả (rice noodles with fresh herbs and pork), chargrilled to order. Dip the noodles in the flavoursome broth and feel free to order an extra spring roll for added crunchiness.

Name: Bếp Mẹ ỉn (Le Thanh Ton)
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Visa credit card
Description: Eat like a local at this hidden gem near Ben Thanh Market! Inside, the vivid yellow walls are decorated to echo the exterior of village houses, complete with blue shutters. With its pleasant buzz, the restaurant has a welcoming atmosphere. Perch on one of the wooden stools, as the regulars do, and sample the signature Vietnamese pancake with shrimp and pork, served in a shallow bamboo basket. The fried rice with shrimp and egg, served in a coconut shell, is also worth trying. The service is friendly, portions are perfect for sharing.

Name: 1946 Cua Bac
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,JCB,Mastercard credit card,Visa credit card
Description: The signature dish of this conspicuous restaurant, located in a brightly coloured yellow and green house, is the fried crab and rice porridge hotpot. Served in small bowls at the table, the crab, pigeon, beef balls and vegetables combine in a naturally sweet medley of flavours. The staff have only a smattering of English, but English menus are available with an enticing range of authentic Vietnamese dishes. Book in advance to make sure of a seat.

Name: Dim Tu Tac (Dong Du)
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,China UnionPay,Credit card / Debit card accepted,JCB,Mastercard credit card,Visa credit card
Description: Dim Tu Tac has four restaurants in the city. The Dong Du branch seats over a hundred and is always busy, particularly at lunchtime. They serve traditional Cantonese cuisine in a comfortable, modern setting, including a large selection of dim sum, BBQ dishes, soups, seafood and much more. This is as close to an authentic Cantonese eatery as it gets, using traditional cooking techniques to deliver pleasant textures and delicious flavours at eater-friendly prices.

Name: Phở 10 Lý Quốc Sư
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,Cash only
Description: One of three branches in Hanoi, this small phở eatery enjoys a fine reputation, but beware of imitations in the city. The menu offers 10 impressive phở options, including tái and chin (brisket), nạm (flank beef) and bắp trần (beef fillet). A competent team operates the compact corner kitchen, which is visible through a glazed partition. The phở itself is hearty and supremely refreshing with tender pieces of beef that melt in the mouth.

Name: Noni
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Visa credit card
Description: What was once the home of ‘Xmun Borg & Sons Bakery & Confectionery’ is now anequally appealing restaurant; sit at ground level for a quiet meal or, for a livelier ambience, head downstairs, past the kitchen, to the stylish, stone-walled cellar. The restaurant’s moniker comes from the nickname of chef-owner Jonathan Brincat – whose passion involves bringing a refined, modern approach to traditional Maltese and Mediterranean cuisine. The attentive team are happy to make recommendations from the concise menu, which showcases quality seasonal ingredients in visually appealing, well-balanced dishes, cooked with a measured approach and an eye for detail. A fairly priced list of local and Italian wines provides the perfect accompaniment.

Name: Under Grain
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Diners Club credit card,Mastercard credit card,Visa credit card
Description: Enter the Rosselli Hotel and descend via the lift to this elegant cellar restaurant, where you walk past the kitchen before entering into a dining room with a vaulted stone ceiling and dark, moody décor. Under Grain is inspired by Merchant Street’s former tailor shops and evidence of this theme is all around, from the sewing pattern menu to the clothing displays – and even a pin-cushion bill-holder.As a tailor would create something exquisite from cloth, the chef here does the same with fine ingredients, skilfully applying his talent to produce a beautiful end product. Expertly cooked Mediterranean dishes burst with bold, gloriously harmonious flavours and, while their base may be classic, the overtones are modern. Professional, personable service and a relaxed atmosphere add to the experience. The wine list is well-chosen and contains plenty of gems from the world, especially from Italy and France.

Name: ION Harbour by Simon Rogan
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Great view,Interesting wine list,Mastercard credit card,Terrace,Visa credit card,Wheelchair access
Description: AS OF MARCH 2023, SIMON ROGAN, THE CHEF-OWNER OF L’ENCLUME IN CARTMEL, UK, HAS TAKEN THE LEAD OF THE FOOD OFFERING HERE.  From the moment you step out of the lift, the team at this restaurant put all their effort into creating a memorable experience. It’s set on the 4th floor of a hotel and the magnificent view from the terrace over the Grand Harbour provides an amazing backdrop for your meal. The restaurant itself is stylish yet informal, with some tables able to catch a glimpse into the kitchen, and service is second-to-none, with some excellent wine recommendations from the passionate sommelier. Mediterranean cuisine is prepared using modern techniques and is beautifully presented, with careful attention paid to detail and colour. The highly talented chef makes a point of choosing ingredients of the highest quality for his dishes.

Name: Rubino
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Visa credit card
Description: This sweet little bistro started life in 1906 as a confectionery shop, serving, among other things, cassata Siciliana – which it still offers today. Sit in one of three cosy, traditional rooms and receive hands-on service from the owner. The blackboard menu lists classic Maltese and Italian dishes.

Name: Grain Street
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Terrace
Description: Situated on the main pedestrianised street in the centre of town, this restaurant with an attractive outdoor dining space serves simple, informal Mediterranean cuisine. Dishes include lasagne with squid, cuttlefish ink and nduja sausage as well as delicious desserts such as lemon meringue tart with olive oil and thyme ice cream.

Name: DC. by Darren Chin
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Diners Club credit card,Interesting wine list,JCB,Mastercard credit card,Visa credit card
Description: The three-story restaurant is divided into bars and dining rooms, including a Louis XIII-themed private room. Diners may choose from the four- to seven-course menus, plus one for vegetarians. The dishes range from classic French, such as sole à la meunière, to novel creations with Japanese influences, all underpinned by solid skills. Save room for the cheese cart with 20 choices, or crêpe Suzette flambéed by your tableside.

Name: Dewakan
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Car park,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Visa credit card
Description: Dewakan means “food from God,” and the chef gives thanks to God with a dining experience that is truly Malaysian in every sense. Every ingredient is sustainably and locally sourced; even the dinnerware is handmade by local artists. There is only one prix fixe tasting menu. Dishes feature many items that are fermented or dry-aged in-house, alongside seasonal fruits and herbs. The shrimp head chocolate petit fours are one of their signatures.

Name: De. Wan 1958
FacilitiesAndServices: American Express credit card,Car park,China UnionPay,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Diners Club credit card,JCB,Mastercard credit card,Restaurant offering vegetarian menus,Valet parking,Visa credit card
Description: Sunny and cheerful like the local celebrity Chef Wan, the room is inviting and bustling. Similarly, the food is guaranteed to lift your spirits with big tropical flavours. Whet your appetite with pomelo salad with crispy prawn cheeks in kerabu lime dressing and a hint of fish sauce. For mains, go for bakar bakar, BBQ meat or seafood that comes with your choice of the chef’s mouth-watering sauces. Portion sizes are big enough for sharing.

Name: Congkak (Bukit Bintang)
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,Credit card / Debit card accepted
Description: Named after a traditional Malaysian game, Congkak is located in residential Jalan Beremi, not far from the city’s bustling central district. The restaurant is an expression of national pride and identity serving what visitors would deem as exotic, but are classics for locals. The most popular dish, the nasi ambeng platter, offers a multitude of textures and combinations of spicy, sweet and savoury flavours that go nicely with sambal. Different serving size is available to suit for your party size.

Name: Nam Heong Chicken Rice
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,China UnionPay,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Visa credit card
Description: Since 1938, this household name has been hugely popular among locals for its famous Hainanese chicken rice. Now, it has three branches in Malaysia. Two kinds of chicken are offered – the pricier “veggie farm” chicken with leaner and firmer flesh, and the free-range version with fattier and softer meat. Barbecue meats, such as roast pork belly that boasts crispy skin and alternate layers of fat and lean meat, are also worth trying.

Name: Wong Mei Kee
FacilitiesAndServices: Credit card / Debit card accepted
Description: Open for a few hours each day, this stall attracts foodies in droves for char siew, roast chicken, and the coveted siew yok – roast pork that boasts crackling skin and succulent meat, perfect with the homemade chilli sauce.

Name: Nasi Ayam Hainan Chee Meng (Jalan Kelang Lama)
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,China UnionPay,Credit card / Debit card accepted,JCB,Mastercard credit card,Visa credit card
Description: This family-owned business has been a staple of the local dining scene since 1965 and is now run by the second and third generations. Instead of Wenchang chicken from Hainan, they use local chicken for leaner, softer and juicier meat. Besides steamed chicken, the short menu showcases various chicken dishes, such as fried chicken, sesame honey, salted egg yolk, or even Kung Pao sauce. There are also Malay and Thai dishes. Opt for smaller portions to sample more dishes.

Name: Dancing Fish
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Bring your own bottle,Car park,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Valet parking,Visa credit card
Description: Dancing Fish offers classic Malay-Indo flavours with distinct local identity. The signature Dancing Fish is nicely fried with a tender meat in crunchy batter. Like the restaurant, it offers numerous versions with different toppings and sauces. The enticing flavours of sambal and savoury sauces paired with the restaurant's many dishes reveal the diversity of a classic cuisine that’s rooted in local culture. Dishes are reasonably priced and use quality ingredients.

Name: Ah Hei Bak Kut Teh
FacilitiesAndServices: Cash only
Description: This 30-year-old shop makes its own bak kut teh daily at 5 am with a blend of 16 Chinese herbs. The soup may look a bit on the dark side, but it boasts not only aromas and flavours, but also health benefits. In addition to the typical spareribs, you may choose other pork cuts, such as tripe, intestine or belly. Or, you may add mushrooms or deep-fried tofu skin to the health tonic served in claypot. Side dishes of fish or veggies are also good.

Name: Anak Baba
FacilitiesAndServices: Credit card / Debit card accepted,Restaurant offering vegetarian menus
Description: Since 2018, this cosy little gem tucked inside the Little India has been serving authentic Southern Peranakan cuisine that melds Indo-Malay flavours with Chinese influences. The must-try nasi lemak with ayam goreng kunyit is the quintessential national comfort food – coconut milk lends a subtle sweetness to the rice, in stark contrast with the juicy fried chicken, fiery sambal and crisp water spinach.

Name: Heun Kee Claypot Chicken Rice (Pudu)
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,Credit card / Debit card accepted
Description: Set in an old but neatly organised dining area not far from Pudu wet markets, Heun Kee has long been loved by locals. The charcoal stove at the front of the restaurant adds intense heat to the claypot, producing cooked rice with intense charcoal flavours and interesting textures and aromas. Choose from a variety of soups, vegetables and side dishes to enrich your dining experience. However, bear in mind that claypot dishes can take up to 30 minutes to arrive.

Name: Hai Kah Lang
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Visa credit card
Description: The owner of this joint also runs a seafood stall on the opposite side of the street. Rest assured only the freshest catch (mostly from northern Borneo) can make it to the table. To sample what it has to offer, first-timers may order mixed seafood noodles with crab, clams, fish, squid, shrimp, and laver seaweed in a briny-sweet fish bone broth that exudes rich aromas of Huadiao wine. Snacks like fried fish cake are also worth trying.

Name: Sao Nam
FacilitiesAndServices: American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,JCB,Mastercard credit card,Terrace,Visa credit card
Description: A bright yellow colonial-style house, a red sign with a playful twist, and a colourful room that feels warm and welcoming, Sao Nam checks all the right boxes for a fun-filled Vietnamese meal. Their iconic phở bò – rice noodle soup with sliced beef – packs tons of flavour in a broth that takes more than ten hours to make. Their mangosteen and prawn salad tantalises your taste buds with umami, sourness, sweetness and contrasting textures.

Name: Hing Kee Bakuteh (Jalan Kepong)
FacilitiesAndServices: Credit card / Debit card accepted
Description: Just as bak kut teh is Malaysia's iconic dish and soul food, this restaurant also has a place in the hearts of locals. It’s particularly popular for lunch. The bak kut teh soup has a characteristic mild flavour that’s well-balanced with a subtle use of herbs and light, sweet flavours. The dry, spicy version has a richer, thicker consistency. The four shop houses that line the boulevard offer plenty of seating and absorb the noise and energy of the street.

Name: Aliyaa
FacilitiesAndServices: American Express credit card,Counter dining,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Restaurant offering vegetarian menus,Terrace,Visa credit card
Description: Amid cute bars and eateries in Plaza Damansara stands Aliyaa, famous for authentic Sri Lankan dishes. On the menu, beef, mutton, chicken, seafood or veggies mingle with distinctive Sri Lankan spices to great effect. Besides the famous whole crab, also try the Negombo prawns in pineapple gravy; or Kuliyal, curry rice and tomato paste baked in banana leaf. Food is generally quite spicy, but the chef will gladly adjust the level of heat to your liking.

Name: Restoran Pik Wah
FacilitiesAndServices: China UnionPay,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Restaurant offering vegetarian menus,Visa credit card
Description: Tucked away from busy traffic, this restaurant could be hard to find, but your efforts will be rewarded with some of the most authentic Chinese food you can get in town. Apart from familiar staples available in all Cantonese restaurants, the longstanding household name also serves rarer items not found elsewhere, such as frog and venison. Their famous dishes in sizzling claypot are simply unmissable. Reservations are recommended on weekends.

Name: Lai Fong Lala Noodles
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,Cash only
Description: What began as a street stall 10 years ago that shot to local fame now occupies two shop floors on the street corner. Red lanterns adorn the ceilings, and large photos cover the walls like wallpaper. Chinese vintage gadgets, like an abacus, decorate the interior. Lala means “clams” in Malay, and a bowl of flavoursome lala bihun with prawns is a must. The broth, meanwhile, is aromatic with Chinese yellow wine and ginger. Portions are generous.

Name: Field
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Booking essential,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Diners Club credit card,Mastercard credit card,Restaurant offering vegetarian menus,Visa credit card
Description: Two friends run this stylishly understated restaurant. Czech dishes mix classic and modern elements and some are finished at the table by the engaging team. Seasonality leads the way, so curing plays a key role throughout the year. As well as wine pairings, they offer interesting non-alcoholic drinks matches.

Name: La Degustation Bohême Bourgeoise
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Booking essential,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Diners Club credit card,Interesting wine list,Mastercard credit card,Visa credit card
Description: This iconic restaurant sits within a historic building in the heart of Prague and comes with a wall chock full of wines and a buzzy, laid-back vibe. Choose from a 3 or 5 course set menu where well-judged, judiciously seasoned Czech dishes echo the seasons and flavours burst through.

Name: Divinis
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Booking essential,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Diners Club credit card,Mastercard credit card,Visa credit card
Description: You’ll find this intimate, homely restaurant tucked away on a side street; it’s run with great passion and has a friendly feel. Rustic, seasonal Italian dishes have original touches and are cooked with flair. The perfect accompaniment comes in the form of a large collection of wines from Italian growers.

Name: Dejvická 34 by Tomáš Černý
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Terrace,Visa credit card
Description: Chef-owner Tomaš Černy worked in the best Italian restaurants in the city for many years before opening his own charming neighbourhood restaurant north of the river. The menu mixes Czech and Italian dishes and showcases some top quality imported ingredients. Dishes are robust and packed with flavour.

Name: The Eatery
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,Counter dining,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Interesting wine list,Mastercard credit card,Visa credit card
Description: This highly regarded restaurant in the suburbs delivers much more than its name and industrial styling first imply. The menu evolves from day to day, in line with the latest seasonal produce, and is accompanied by a superb wine list. Ask for a seat at the counter to witness the efficiency of the kitchen team.

Name: Na Kopci
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Booking essential,Car park,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Terrace,Visa credit card
Description: Leave the city behind and escape to this buzzy bistro, whose name means ‘on the hill’. The wallpaper is a montage of pictures of the owner’s family and the atmosphere is warm and welcoming. Classic Czech and French dishes are packed with flavour and the local beers make a great accompaniment.

Name: Eska
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Diners Club credit card,Mastercard credit card,Terrace,Visa credit card
Description: A café, bakery and restaurant in a converted fabric factory. The dining room has a stark, industrial feel with exposed bricks, pipework and girders, and the open kitchen adds to the buzz. Old family favourites are given modern makeovers; much use is made of traditional techniques like marinating and fermenting.

Name: Iva New Balkan Cuisine
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Restaurant offering vegetarian menus,Terrace,Visa credit card
Description: There’s great value to be had at this semi-basement level restaurant with a pared-back modern look. The extensive menu covers everything from breakfast to street food, and much more. Traditional Balkan recipes are subtly refined yet remain wholesome and comforting. They favour using smaller producers. A small, yet attractive, wine list is available and a smart service will welcome you.
